CDLN1HLxywhOzfO1UheFsw.text: On my quest to find the best Thai food in Vegas, Komol is taken out of the race.   LOCATION: Yes, Komol lies in the same shopping center as the Green Door. The Commercial Center has all the characteristics of a shady place. Its old, a little dirty, and you'll likely pass a few hobos. But hey, there's a few good places to grab a bite.   FOOD: What strays me away is the wild inconsistencies between visits. Sometimes its good, sometimes its great, and sometimes I'm left disappointed. The stir-fry's usually come out quite good here. The usual Pad Prik King and Chili Mint Beef have never led me astray. But I must suggest to steer clear of the Yellow Curry. I believe the cooks are confused whether or not its a sweet curry or a savory curry. Its different every time. On occasion, I'll order a Pad Thai. Despite being a generic Thai dish, there are quite a lot of components involved in preparing the seasoning. A heavy hand on the tamarind or fish sauce WILL be noticed. The flavor varies visit to visit so I can't say I love it 100% of the time.  SERVICE: The servers have always been really nice. The young man who usually waits on us is seriously one of the nicest most genuine servers I've ever met. But I'm not sure if they're understaffed or just relaxed.  When it comes to food, patience isn't my strong suit. Whether the restaurant is full or nearly empty, it takes forever to get our first plate. Entrees never arrive together and at times its hard to distinguish whether they forgot our order or its just coming out slow. Also, they're a little stingy on the napkins; request a couple extra before your food arrives.   Komol has one of the largest, heaviest menus I've ever seen. Real talk, it is really heavy! A few pages of food are sandwiched between big chunks of wood. But what they gain in variety, they lose in quality.

zr8YzKfWt7IeuS8r55Jpaw.text: Had dinner here tonight with a friend. A little hard to find, had to drive around the center for a minute. Decor is standard Asian restaurant fare. Service was slow and impersonal. In their defense, it seems like they have two servers to wait on and bus the entire restaurant and they were fairly busy tonight.   Food - Tom yum soup was ok (kind of hard to screw up). I ordered some fried squid which was hard and tasteless and the sauces seemed off. The waitress took that off our bill when I asked her to take it away after barely eating any. Sea bass with ginger sauce was decent, not great.   My friend ordered the fresh spring rolls and veggie delight, which were both a little better than my food (we shared), though those seemed more along the lines of Chinese-American dishes than Thai food. Maybe I ordered the wrong things or it's mainly geared towards the vegetarian food, but I thought everything about the place was pretty mediocre. They do have a large vegetarian section in an already large menu, but it's not that hard to find good vegetarian friendly meals in any Thai restaurant.  I love Thai food, but I can't see myself coming back here. The food tastes more like an average Chinese restaurant than a real Thai place. It wasn't too expensive fortunately - about $55 for one appetizer, a cup of soup, two entrees, and two beers, plus tip.

FwLHB8tfeS3a1R2Y8N_GzA.text: I love Komol! I have eaten here on a regular basis since I moved to Las Vegas in 1997 and it still remains my favorite restaurant. A perfect retreat from sensory overload and a quiet place to catch up with a dear one. The service is attentive and unobtrusive and the bathrooms are clean.  Of course the most important part, the food! Komol's vegetarian offerings have expanded over the years to include gluten and soy duck along with the tofu and mushroom options. Pretty much everything they have on the meat menu they have on the vegetarian menu. I try to get something different every time, but I have a weakness for fresh spring rolls in the summer and tom kha in the winter. This time I got the Hot and Spicy Vegetables with green curry and gluten. Delicious! I have enough left over for lunch today too.  Their thai iced tea is delicious--if I ever save room for dessert I am totally going to thry their homemade thai iced tea ice cream.  That other Thai restaurant in Commercial Center may get the press, but the locals know Komol's the best!

KXsknuOi7fgisNRf0qRAcQ.text: This place has the best curry I've ever had with good prices. 5 stars, they earned all of them.

-c05G_xUg39nqlnjvC9nwA.text: All of the Thai restaurants I've ever tried in America all share something in common: the food can range from disgusting to delicious, but it never tasted truly authentic. It was missing this quality that I can't put my finger on that I had in all the dishes when I was in Thailand. Thai food in America is all very saucy, pungent, and overpowering -- which, don't get me wrong, can be INCREDIBLE sometimes. But the beauty of the Thai food in Thailand is that it's not very saucy, pungent, and overpowering, but still maintains this tastiness that I've never experienced in America.  Until now.   Komol Restaurant is the most authentic Thai restaurant that I've ever had in America.   Just take their Pad Thai for example -- it's probably less saucy and orange-colored than you're used to. The Pad Thai flavor isn't as strong, but for some reason, each bite releases a delicious taste that isn't like the overpowering and sweet Pad Thai that you're used to in America. Even the Pad See Ewe, which is usually dark brown because of the overuse of soy sauce, has a lighter hue at Komol, but still packs in all of the unique flavor that Pad See Ewe should have.  The Herbal Salad, which is highly reviewed on Yelp, was good, but a little too pungent. It's like your typical Rainbow or Tea Leaf Salad at your local Burmese joint, but with way too many overpowering flavors.  The curries (Panang and Masamun) are both delicious, but these are more standard tastes that are pretty much the same in Thailand and in America.  Also, they make an excellent Thai iced tea.  I don't want to sound like a Thai food snob or connoisseur. It's very likely that I have no idea what I'm talking about. But I love Thai food and I love the Thai food I had when I was in Thailand. I'm not a professional -- just speaking from personal experience, and this is what I know to be True for myself. What I know to be True now is that you're not going to get a more authentic Thai food experience than at Komol.

WCPd5921drDiDky993P45Q.text: You must get the all green stir fry.  I have had a secret fantasy for quite some time now, and Komol was restaurant enough to make it happen this week. At every Asian restaurant I visit, I try every trick I know to maximize the amount of green vegetables in my dish. I will ask for "Only Broccoli" and hope they don't upcharge. I will specify no water chestnuts, no baby corn. My fantasy, you see, is a 100% green stir fry, and I had pretty much given up and accepted that the mere cost of such a prime produce creation must be daunting to most Asian kitchens.   So, my tastebuds did a second take when upon closer inspection of the Komol menu I discovered an all green, basil stir fry! Snow peas, American AND Chinese broccoli, and bok choy - I almost wanted to run outside and scream to the world, "I found it!" It may be simple, but purchasing and chopping all of these items is too much of a commitment for me.   So for me, this is a perfect dish. At least twice a week, I just want a big pile of alluring greens, and this is just that. I will wake up craving this very soon and very often.

pjkkcuIZObXrgqnsX0OkeQ.text: Tasty food and great service. There's a wide breadth of options among the Thai cuisine which is nice to choose from. The portions are satisfying!

RczqQftWMXM541gTasDG5g.text: My husband has changed his mind about this place.  This is now both of our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  Great food and great service.

V2NeVMh8YzXDKddBDUWb2Q.text: It's one of those places I hear about a lot, want to go and just never have.  After a Elite event at the Barrymore, I knew we had  to try it out. Lucky me, some of the best people in Vegas came to join us for dinner.   BF and I tried the famed herbal salad and it was a refreshing treat. I love salads of all kinds and I never thought of coconut being something to add. Now that I know how it is made, I will be making this at home and trying out the rest of the large menu.   Massaman Curry- I am a huge massaman freak so we had to try this on our first visit. It was very spice heavy in a cinnamon-y profile and sweet. While I appreciated it is unique, it just was not quite my thing.   I  dont get their spice rating...while our herbal salad was more "medium" spicy than "mild", our massaman had no spice to it at all. Seems in some reviews I read to be inconsistent.   Tried bites of my friends foods and all were quite nice so definitely there is good quality here. The pad thai and panang were quite good actually.   Service was okay, a bit slow though they were nice about it.   Hard to say if it is food we need to drive across town for yet, but when I'm in the area I will definitely be coming by to taste more.

RI4S-CyXpEft4w4UYa300A.text: The food at Komol is definitely worth the trip.  My family and I still remember how good all the dishes we ordered (and we ordered a little bit of everything) was!  It's a little difficult to find, because the area that Komol is located in is surrounded by a lot of office buildings and some other assorted restaurants (including at least one other Thai place to make it extra confusing).  But I'm glad my family and I looked around for it, because the food is fantastic.  And there's a pretty extensive menu, if my memory is correct. The place has a lot of vegetarian and vegan options in particular, which is great if you have a big party and people who are particular about certain foods or ingredients.   And I remember that the hostess was so sweet and patiently explained everything to us.  She checked in on us several times in a nice but not irritating way to make sure we were happy with our food as well.  I do remember that if you choose something spicy, it will be very spicy.  So consider that fair warning if you can't handle the pepper heat!  This place is at the top of my list for the best Thai food in town, regardless of what the Las Vegas mags might say.  Do try it and see what you think.  Everything on their menu was delicious, from their curries to the appetizers and drinks, so you can't go wrong with Komol.

LgNvRyq-8J2A0tYyxmSG4g.text: Extremely disappointed as this place was highly recommend by locals. Firstly, the restaurant was dirty with plates of food left out for hours on the table next to us. They ran out of eggplant at 2PM...The service was non-existent. We had to get our own chopsticks and service our own bill. Would suggest trying a different venue.

c76GGJ-dEDAvFKQWbAMnEw.text: For those who are not aware of this place - yes it looks like you've entered the wrong part of town. Be not afraid! Keep going in, cuz you are in the right spot!   We are fans here. When hubby craves Thai food, we only travel here. For him, it is bringing his memories back of seeing the foods on his travels there when he was younger. (and he has been looking for a place like this for a very long time - TRUST ME!)  Right after entering you are greeted very quickly and seated promptly (or are given a good time estimate if waiting is the only option) They love kids here and are well prepared to accomodate towards them.  Hubby leans towards Pad Kee Mao (or some variety of the wide rice noodle). I like to mix it up. Papaya Pad Thai is very tasty - hubby wasn't super fond of it, but for me - I was just lapping it all up! Since we had the wee one, we had to keep it mild - :( - but one of these days we are hoping to have all mouths on fire!  The soft shell crab app is YUUUUMMY! Gives you that perfect taste, but doesn't weight your belly down so you get to fill up on the main course!  Chicken Chili mint - very awesome! Fire and ice in one bite!  Seafood Basil Fried Rice - yuuuum! Can't tell you how many times I have been here with all the food, but I have never been disappointed. I always strive to have something I didn't eat the last time just to be able to say at one point that I have eaten everything on the menu!   Oh and let's not forget our beverage staple: Thai Iced Tea - traditional, (and now) red or green!!! Wish I knew the secret to making it, love it so very much - someone has told me before it was Lipton tea, but somehow I am doubtful - and am striving to know the secret to it. (note for the great internet research project).   Now juuuust to be fair to the competition in the same parking lot - there is a Lotus of Siam restaurant nearby also Thai cuisine, but have yet to explore their restaurant.   And lastly - can't review the desserts, since our bellies are always full to the brim by the time we are done! (oh did I mention you get to take home leftovers too?) That's right more bang for your buck! Ok now my tummy is getting hungry for Thai food..... hmmm Happy dining!

7gPKHlHc_sc4iMnBtU_hUQ.text: This place was soo disgusting!!! They had sooo much garlic chopped all over the food!!  When the server came back and asked how the food was, my cousin told her the food was disgusting and she simply said, " ohhhhh" and turned around.... Uh ohh ok...... check Pleeease!'

aEel3mZuzCaN-6JpDdSrcQ.text: Friendly, quick service and excellent food. Separate vegetarian menu with many options.  Favorite dish: Spicy Chili Mint Tofu with Peanuts

Zlow-vHJLfLhaYMCP4Y-hw.text: We ended up at Komol because the Lotus of Siam was fully booked and Komol had some great Yelp reviews.  They had one great dish, a couple of good ones and a couple not so good.  First the great one...herbal salad.  You should definitely order this.  It's got a mix of apples, herbs, lemon grass and is a great mix of flavors.  Definitely my favorite plate of the night.  We also had garlic prawns and a soft shell crab appetizer which were both pretty good.  The prawns were a tad on the salty side but we had some rice to help off set it.    The lowlights would have to be the penang beef and the pad see ew noodles.  The penang curry was missing some flavor and the beef was tough.  The pad see ew were very bland.  I've better in many other places.  Would I go back?  Maybe if i couldn't get into Lotus of Siam.  I'm sure there's more dishes that are good here, but it may be a while before I go back to find them.

oMJFalvX7LCkl-99500RgA.text: When you pull into the shopping center, don't immediately abort.  Everything in you will tell you to abort, you must fight it.  Komol is on the eastern side of the shopping center.  Just pretend you didn't see all the sketchy other stuff, and head inside.  You can get soy chicken, soy duck, soy shrimp...maybe soy beef (?) instead of meat for anything.  I got the orange soy chicken.  It was great.  They didn't over-sauce it.  The chicken came in stick-like form.  Sounds weird, but it was good, and made for easy eating-with-my-hands.  I want to try the orange soy duck next time.  I also tried my old man's vegetable panang curry.  Normally, I HATE curry.  Even the curry that you say "oh my god, this is the best curry, you have to try it!" I will hate.  However, I had just finished a soccer tournament and was dying of starvation.  Something about that made me want to try the curry, even though I was expecting to hate it.  But, alas, I liked this curry!  I wouldn't want to eat an entire order of it (note: I HATE curry), but I did supplement my orange soy chicken with a few bites of the curry and it was really good.  So, if you like curry, it is probably awesome here.  Great choice for vegetarians, I'd definitely go back.

-s9ncy1GsEOnoabg0E-y4w.text: Komol is a restaurant located a couple minutes off the strip in a center with lots of other Asian restaurants. You know this place is good because they have lots of awards and newspaper clippings on the walls and it is usually crowded. 5 stars for the quality of the food, both vegan and non-vegan. It's my favorite vegan place to visit in Vegas as a non-vegan (makes sense, right?). Actually, my whole family loves this place. The appetizers are reasonably sized and priced. Delicious thai iced tea, and they can make it vegan. The spring rolls, egg rolls, and fried tofu are all great. We always get the pad see ew and it never disappoints. The desserts we've had, coffee and thai iced tea ice cream, were delicious. I tried the homemade coconut ice cream with sweet sticky rice this past visit. It was definitely a new type of dessert for me, but I liked it. The coconut ice cream was very light and airy. Downside is you sometimes wait a while for your food, but it is definitely worth the wait.

zHPvgDcLFSSjaQVT8kJrOg.text: The food was delocious and the service was great

IvrvIUrSGMiyIdQ85WM05A.text: Excellent high quality Thai cuisine.  Been going there for many years and I'm always happy with the food.

X2arnGmOeOSjvi9MTm2dsw.text: Great food and awesome service!  As soon as we enter someone met and greet us with a smile.   The servers gave some good recommendations from the menu. We ordered Chicken Satay for Appetizer. Our entrees are Beef Massaman, Panang, Pad Thai combination, Crispy Crab with combination Fried Rice. We also ordered Mango with Sticky Rice, Fried Banana with Ice Cream, Taro Ball and Banana with Sweet Coconut Milk.  Service charge was applied to our bill (we're party of 5) and it's worth it- Best Service we ever experienced here in Las Vegas.   The best!

ce3SeLHorrhgoXP0jxKzFQ.text: One of the best Chicken Fried Rice i have found this side of the Pacific!    We have been coming to Komol for a long time.  The decor never changed (or that i recognize being different) and everything stays the same.  Fortunately the food is also consistently good through the years.  This is a must-stop whenever I'm in Vegas.    The only problem is that it is a pretty popular place and it could get busy so the food may take a while to get served.    Otherwise, no complain and highly recommend!

B7nC5U6B7Eb8oNmfnjyppg.text: UPDATE: Komol Restaurant at 953 E. Sahara Ave. earned a C grade and 36 demerits during a routine inspection on June 19. Inspectors found food that wasn't stored at the proper temperature, no hand washing and more during the visit. Link to full article: vegas.eater.com/archives... First impression.. shady people trying to take advantage of vegetarians and vegans. Vegans beware, white sugar and more: happycow.net/reviews.php... Also MSG is already prepped into the food even tho they will lie and say ok no problem. Place is filthy and as they say the bathroom gives you and idea what the kitchen is like. Place was empty of customers (now i know why) and waiter seated us at tiny table and we asked for larger table as we expected a few more guests and his drama went into action as he was clearly pissed and slammed down utensils and plates. We were out the door and called owner to tell him of this poor service, he was like "I don't care, this is my family and they come first so go elsewhere". We did and will not return or refer this place to anyone.

CRtxjPuBD5ecAYlPoJcxZg.text: I love this as well as my husband. I was super sad when Long life vegie closed. but very excited to try this place out and be very please with their vegan options. Their veggie fried rice is super yummy.

MdV8NarG-_hqLwZLevjM2g.text: Best Thia food I've found in Las Vegas. Must visit!! Will not disappoint and the menu is huge. Ordered six different dishes and not one  disappointment. The service was awesome and a good variety of wine and beer to boot. it was an overall GREAT dining experience.

bs2a150aeRr4B3YFRtjU4w.text: super delicious!  great selection for vegetarians.  best thai food i've had in vegas.  the herbal salad was so good - never had anything like it before!  got a tofu/stir-fry dish that was tasty too - but the salad was the best!  good level of spiciness (1-10 scale) - i like my thai food hot!  ready on time & reasonably priced.  i got take-out so can't speak to the restaurant experience - but it looked fairly busy and smelled deeeelish!

z8x53GkdFUSMTYM8KOc7wA.text: Awesome taste. Best thai food ever had. Penang Chicken and Chilli Mint Chicken are BEST bets :)

xjHNbC_tR2GPDxDA7O46BA.text: If you're thinking about Lotus of Siam, think again... Especially if you're vegetarian.. Total home run!

uTvAMm0XfYURAG42e3X1MA.text: We tried this restaurant based on other yelp reviews...we were not disappointed! The food we ordered was incredible...pork satay, Indian chicken curry, Thai tea and coconut ice cream.  Service was amazing and we are big fans! We can't wait to go back again! Cha our server was a True delight.

nAUjuk1IUSrlVNuvq9tCaA.text: Panang curry was exceptionally good (their signature dish. homemade recipe. superb!!), the best thai food I ever had. Fried Ice cream.. I cant stop talking about it. It is an ice cream ball covered with yummm sponge cake and fried crust topped off with whipped cream. MUST TRY!  Huge menu options and we went 2 consecutive days fr Lunch and dinner!! Most of the items we had was pretty good!!!

IhEcVN37bZi1WpgS0sXSUg.text: OK, If you like Lotus of Siam and maybe planned poorly by not making  reservations there, have no fear and try Komol Restaurant - they are both in the SAME strip shopping center!  Komol is in the center of the parking area for the entire strip mall and is easy to miss if you are not looking for it.   Having walked down near here to visit another location on a Sunday, I already knew LoS was closed for lunch and yet I wanted more Thai.  Yelp came to the rescue and delivered me to another outstanding Thai restaurant!  I could hardly believe that two of the best Thai establishments I've eaten at in the US are in the same location!  Hmm.. maybe its the location - what looks to be 40 year old, barely maintained strip mall not terribly far off the far end of the Las Vegas strip.   I agree with another reviewer, its hard to believe both LoS and Komol are within eye-shot of each other..Karma anyone?   As I mentioned in my LoS review, this is too far to walk for 99.9% of the Strip crowd, so be prepared to take the bus or a cab.  You can get here on the bus w/ a single transfer and then only have to walk a short distance across mostly parking lot to reach Komol.    The interior is nicely decorated and they have many of the awards they have won clearly posted near the entrance.  I was so glad to get out of the afternoon Vegas heat and it was plenty cool inside.  I immediately ordered a Thai Iced Tea and water, water, water.    The wait staff was very attentive as I had 3 Thai Iced Teas before I left but I'll get to that and lost count on the water refills - that dry Vegas air is tough.   After scanning the huge and varied menu, I must say I was overwhelmed with the choices and options and it took me a while to decide.  However the Chief's special looked right for me as I honed in.  It is a blend of spicy herbal curry sauteed with string beans, carrots, bell peppers and basil leavers.  I omitted the bell peppers and asked for an "8/10" on the heat scale.   The dish arrived promptly and I took my first bite - wonderful but then the heat kicked in and well as another reviewer said, beware of the pepper scale.   Normally, I can eat all but the extreme 10/10 Thai hot levels but 8 was too much for me on this dish .  There is NO WAY I could have eaten it without the cream in the Thai Iced tea to calm the heat!  I asked the waitress about the "8" rating and she said that dish was normally hot b/c of the chili peppers already in there, she had recommended milder for most customers.    It was good, but damn was it hot!   I highly recommend scaling back on your normal heat rating scale or be prepared for a hot but delicious ride here!   You can always turn up the heat after the dish arrives!   If you love Thai food, then you have 2 great locations in the same strip mall and honestly, you cannot go wrong at either one..  Give Komol a try and you will be rewarded with a Thai meal you won't soon forget and be glad you took that ride!  Did I mention they cater to vegetarians as well!

pefx9NDxpfQ-Kx-QJaEPLA.text: totally off the strip, but worth the travelling.  I'd take a taxi out there and then call them about 20 min before you're done eating.  It's also on a bus line, but I'm not sure which one.  The menu is HUGE and 1/2 of it is vegan (and really great).  A fun place to bring a large group.

nJr5PHXRRZXY1wwaoE4Hkg.text: this place totally rocks! i was looking for a nice sit down restaurant in vegas that would offer food other than the typical vegas buffet fare - and did it ever live upto its expectations. While from the outside, it looks like a hole in the wall, once you go in you'll see its quite nicely decorated. Other than the teak engraved menus, the food is the main star of this place and rightly so! we had the tom yum mushroom soup, pa kang vegetables and red curry chicken. all were equally delish but highest points go to the soup! Best thai I've ever had!! we were in Vegas for 3 days, and needless to say, we squeezed in 3 trips! Great service, ambience and food..and did I mention its super cheap? amazing....the only downside its kinda hard to find ...its in a strip mall with tons of korean food/karaoke/bars around but you'll enventually spot it. Skip the fancy food on the strip and go to this joint..you'll love it.

uDsYfSzcjHRtrjn4vHj4HQ.text: Got a #10 spicy green papaya salad here and SHE-YI-IT!!! It was the hottest thai dish I have ever had. Just loaded with fresh green and red Thai peppers. Ate the entire thing! And felt it burning holes in my stomach lining for the next 6 hours. So good!  Lots of veg items and lots of locals eating here.

QAUbELPjKVF3Msw3b_fuHA.text: My absolute favorite Thai restaurant! Their lunch specials, which include Soup of the day, and spring roll, are the best for under 10 bucks! Unlike many Asian restaurants, the service here is actually very good. I always get their Beef Panag Curry or their famous Pad Thai.

_issP0paqBIEVoSk74InuA.text: When in Vegas and especially staying around the North Strip, make the trip off the strip to Komol.  Some of the best Thai food I have ever had, particularly the absolutely delicious Panang Chicken and Chili Mint Pork.  Even better is the fantastic service - they treat you like a valued friend rather than a one-time visitor - possibly a function of being off the strip a ways.

LNsrDMt9yNoY0qfuRkbDJQ.text: best panang curry ~ hands down! wish they are close to my house like Archi's...which is like 5mins away from my house.  sadly its 20 ~ 25mins away from my condo. i have to say Archi's got better spicy basil pork which i really love but havent seen any thai restaurant with better panang than komol

LdHqARAmKu_1Pd2UykJK9w.text: Pineapple fried rice and papaya salad.  I'm really not a big fan of the latter and half of it was nothing but a big chopped off chunk of totally raw supermarket cabbage.  The former was pretty good, though it tasted as tho it may have been  flavored with ketchup.  2 1/2 rounded up to 3.

Z21Ltn6WN0bJ6V4ZllQSIg.text: I am a fan of Thai food and eat it in every city I travel to. I recommend the Komol. Food was excellent.

AE6JbC439PKVkF9SwBZylw.text: Komol has been in Las Vegas for well over thirty years. We've been going there for at least twelve years. Took some very fussy picky eaters with us for their first meal at Komol. They were ecstatic. This place never misses. They freshly prepare your food and really do adjust the level of spice purposely to your request it asked. Adding or eliminating a spice or an ingreidnet here or there is never an issue. Polite courteous staff with very attractive decor.Hey ......my wife even liked our dinner and that say it all. Komol, not to be missed.

vQYs6ohazRsCxdLbA2QzSQ.text: Komol is delicious! And they have great lunch specials! I usually stick with the Panang with tofu and I'm so happy with my choice every time. The service is fast and friendly, though I've only dont takeout (never dined in). My coworkers and I love Komol!

DnDYIwZjOcg-k0ww6r0tQQ.text: Had a great experience at Komol last weekend.  Our party of 4 shared a bunch of items to get a good feel for the menu.  Started out with the chicken Tom Ka Kai soup.  The flavor was great & spiced to perfection based on our request.  We then tried the soft shell crab with garlic.  There was plenty of garlic, which I love & this is now my favorite soft shell crab dish I've had.  Also tried tempora shrimp & vegetables, and their panang curry signature dish.  On the side was added red spice in case anyone wanted more heat on their plate.  Everything was great & everyone at the table loved the food.  Service was excellent.  We were well taken care of by Dutch & Ann.  Both friendly, attentive and willing to go the extra mile for the group.  The finishing touch was the fried Vanilla ice cream.  That was the sweet treat I needed to complete this meal.  It made my weekend afternoon nap that much better!

goSUA9YPTE6MRxoK12gUKw.text: The food is splendid. Five stars. Most of the time, I have not had one complaint with the food as it is flavorful and delicious.   I have been to this location over 15 times and absolutely love the food. So why not 5 stars?   The way I was treated last time was unacceptable. I entered the restaurant with two of my friends for lunch. First, the waiter was incredibly rude and just brushed us off. It took 20 minutes to even get us water and take our order. Mind you, at this time, there were not many people in the restaurant. Nonetheless, we place the order. After about 40 minutes, we began to get really restless. A very large group of people came in and they ordered immediately. Other customers came in and ordered as well. We complain. 30 minutes pass. No food. We complain and are told to wait. Again. The other people that came in WELL after us begin to receive their food. We complain again and get told our food is on the way. 15 minutes pass, my two friends receive their food. I had to wait another 25 minutes until I got my food. How is this possible?! AND my curry was lukewarm! We did not even receive an apology.   I asked for a manager and there was not one available. I asked for a phone number and I have called at least 10 times to complain and always get told the manager is not available at this time. Unacceptable. Not coming here ever again. I feel bad for taking my friends here and making it sound like a respectable restaurant.

ZnRZYTB4PP9i2fK98BSdww.text: I agree with the reviews above- this Thai restaurant is not as overrated as Lotus of Siam.  The menu is extensive and somehow impressive. It accommodates to tastes from the heaviest herbivore to the heaviest carnivore, and allowing some options for the fungivore as well.  My friend Linda, ordered a beer and a hot saki - satisfactory to the casual diner who orders a couple of drinks with the meal.  She ordered the Vegetable Delight and I - The Tom Yu Chicken Soup with Tofu. While after sampling both dishes, they are not extraordinary to me, I will give them a thumbs up.  I was a little irritated of the indifference from the three waitresses. While they were a little busy tonight Friday, it is not that they had a full house ( there were about six tables ) and they couldn't even bother to walk by our table to check how we were doing?

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Yum Chicken with Tofu
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable Delight
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Affordable prices.

v_pm3RE-mho3_a3-aPW9HA.text: Came here today for lunch guess i need to find a new place. Cant believe that the health department close them down 2 weeks ago and they are still closed. So many people keep walking up to find this picture on the door. So we went next door and ate.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. How Sad.
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Health Department close them down.

5KjNLGFF5P-HaiIWVxhkuA.text: Stumbled upon this place without even checking yelp, it is your True definition of a hole in the wall, but the food is excellent and seems just like mama would make. I reccomend it, and it won't break the bank.

OfJr7yqWF4Fp8V4uxito-g.text: "Dissecting The Herbal Salad"  ATMOSPHERE:  Faux flowers, intricate wood carvings and pictures of Thailand decorate the restaurant and it still looks the same as it was when we last visited. It was also pretty busy for lunch! Long time no see Komol!   BOMB BITES:  One of my favorite salads in town is their Herbal Salad, so we ordered that and since it was a bit chilly, a bowl of Tom Kha(spice level 1) also sounded great.  Our food didn't take too long because all we ordered was a soup and salad, but the soup came first. It was good, but  boy did it pack some HEAT!?!? Aside from the heat,  the dominant flavors were coconut, lime, and fish sauce. I prefer to make my Tom Kha with a little more aromatic flavors (more lemongrass, kafir lime leaf, and galangal) which was barely evident, but still good. The herbal salad arrives and we dig in. All these memorable flavors are what made me a fan in the first place. All of the fruits,  veggies, tofu, cashews, and aromatics. Mysteriously, our mouths started heating up again!? A few seconds later, we discover that the same dried chili that was in our soup also made its way into the salad. Although we enjoyed our meal, our tastebuds were ON FIYAH! Out of curiosity, we asked our waiter if chili is usually in the Herbal Salad. He said not normally...feeling bad, he brought us some rice to hopefully tame the heat in our soup and that secret sauce that goes in the Herbal Salad to tame the heat in the salad. What service!  CLOSING STATEMENTS:  Now everyone who frequents Thai restaurants are familiar with the Thai Spice number system with 1 being the most mild (yeah right!) and 10 being "you so crazy!?" hot...just be forewarned that unless you love spicy, even level one packs a punch! One of the ladies from the kitchen came out explained that it was also the season for the chilies from Fresno that they use which meant that they are more potent than usual. She thanked us for coming in and sent us off with another Herbal Salad with no chili. :)  ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter: \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  5  Will I Return???  Yup!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The secret elixir that&#39;s in the Herbal Salad...took it home to hopefully duplicate it soon...
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my favorite salads in town,  Komol&#39;s Herbal Salad up close...
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Kha, heat level ONE....Still packed some heat!

xjGxKIL4LL5CMFbsNYlIvA.text: 5 Stars? Absolutely.  From the outside Komol doesn't look that impressive. But Komol has been one of my weekly lunch places for over 2 years now because the quality of the food keeps me coming back. Service every so often slips a little which explains my previous 1 star reviews. But when I start craving Thai food this is where I go, and I usually walk out very satisfied.   Panang Curry or Chili Mint Chicken, medium heat = happiness.   I try not to hand out 5 Star reviews anymore but Komol's earned 5 Stars from me before and its the only rating that seems to fit. Lotus of Siam across the parking lot may be more hyped, but Komol in my opinion is the better choice.

Gs-gqiGFo_-ShPmKXRwbhg.text: Komol may not have the diverse menu of Lotus but it offers some equally tasty plates. This is as good an option as any considering the number of Thai restaurants next to each other there. They get a lot of customers wanting to avoid the wait at Lotus who are then surprised to find dinner was just as good!

mc54d-FED1beOYJFfkYf3A.text: The Skinny: came in for lunch - food is subpar compared to other Thai places in the city (2), service is slow (waited 30 minutes before food came out) so forget coming here to grab a quick bite (2), value: $6.95-7.95 sounds reasonable for lunch specials but the food ain't that good. Pass (2).  We wanted to try another Thai joint in this plaza but we found that it wasn't open early enough for me to get to work. So we hit Komol instead.   I ordered the pad thai lunch special while the hubs ordered the stir-fried eggplant special for $6.95 each. The lunch specials come with soup/salad with spring roll. We both opted for the salad with the curry peanut dressing.   The spring roll lacked filling and was flavorless.  The very meager pile of romaine was overshadowed by the gnarly goopy peanut butter based dressing on top. Not appetizing.   Pad Thai was really weird and oddly sour. I was not impressed that they left the long browning tails of the bean sprouts on the sprouts -  a) it's unappealing,  b) it has a nasty hairy mouth feel, c) any Asian worth their salt knows you can purchase bags of this completely and properly prepped (without the head and tail of the sprout) from Chinatown for dirt cheap. Portion size was small.   The eggplant dish was truly horrible. On the edge of raw,  the eggplant had an unpleasant styrofoam like texture. Lacking wok hai, the dish was bland and unpalatable. Served with a side of rice,  the amount provided was meager but given the poor quality it wasn't a bad thing.   Service was slow. It took a while for the food to arrive (at least 20 minutes for the spring roll and salad,  30 minutes for the entrees). Definitely not a good place to grab a quick 1 hour lunch.   Given the quality of the food and the slow service,  there is no reason to return. 2 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stir-fried eggplant with black bean sauce ($6.95 lunch special)
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai lunch special portion ($6.95 with salad or soup with spring roll)
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring roll and salad (comes with lunch special)

t106yqA4SGjCMOlmMzJqBg.text: On both occasions I've ate at Komal something interesting has happened.   The first time I ate there, a roach walked across the women's feet seated in the booth behind me as I head them scream and jump, The food was delicious so I tried not to think much of it...   The second time I was there recently, I ordered the Tom Kha soup, and as I sipped my soup I got an interesting texture which I thought tasted odd, I took it out before swallowing and I realized it was actually a small circle piece of cardboard. When I told the waitress, who had taken a while with my food having served my friend her food a while ago, I was brought another soup, however I was still charged full price for this. I was very bummed out because their food was tasty, but after these experiences I'm not sure I want to return.

36cHBeUBJxFAblfVF34cBQ.text: Dined here on a recommendation some time ago, so this is well well overdue.   I am in love with their Herbal Salad which has a mix of shredded apples, carrots, onions, cashews, cilantro and a special sauce.   I also like their soups Tom Ka soup which is coconut based.  And their Panang Curry over some rice is a must.    Just make sure to inform your server how hot or mild you want your food.  On this occasion we were informed that even their mild was a little too hot due to the pepper season and location they receive their peppers from today.   The service we received was really spot on and for this all of the above, I am a fan.

-h7wn-skECBlqWb3y2SJ0w.text: New favorite Thai spot! I had the panang curry and drunken noodles during the lunch specials. Needless to say I'll definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panang curry

qw7i-eWfMyqkTRiyzI3C1g.text: This place is so bomb!  I'm a sucker for spice and this joint just has the right amount of kick. Customer service was great once I walked in I was quickly greeted and the hostess seated me with a table for 2.   I don't really eat a lot of Thai food so this would be a first. For the appetizers we ordered the shrimp mushroom soup in Thai it is called "shrimp Tom yum" and you can have it on a spice level 1-10 of your choosing. In this case a 4! It was the perfect spice level. For entree I ordered the Thai broccoli chicken and shrimp with black bean flat noodle and my friend ordered the pineapple shrimp fried rice.   It was amazing! And all the items in the menu are healthy at a decent price. Too bad there summer rolls don't come with meat, that's the only downfall but overall I am definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai food
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice menu

IjiNuGYbWh0xULPKHYdpxQ.text: Outstanding Thai comfort food! I've been coming here since the 90's and the food is better than ever!  I've been to Lotus and this place measures up nicely- and since the 90's I've never had any problems with the food, the day of, or next day.  We had the Tom Kha (silky and tasty), Pad Kee Mao (wonderful!) better than the Lotus version) chili Beef, and shrimp delight.  If you don't have your nose stuck up in the air and and are looking for satisfying Thai comfort food this is the place- great tasting, fresh veggies as well. Fantastic and always consistently excellent food!

K8xcJSRcWUOeHXiYfVo2-w.text: Komol is one of those non assuming places that offers great food and yet provides a decent place to hang out in Vegas. As a party of 12, we decided to go for this on the first night of our 2 day trip, to balance out dining at a high end place the next day. The service was excellent and the food was fabulous! Papaya salad was a hit, and so was every vegetarian and non vegetarian dish we ordered, including the quintessential pad Thai and chicken Penang..  Komol means gentle in one of the Indian languages, and True to its name, the place was gentle, friendly and inviting. A sure thumbs up from all of us

l5d9xVeqsJ-yI9ItMwTeZA.text: This is a great thai restaurant. They have lots of items on the menu than any other thai restaurants that I went to. They have different variety of salads, pad thais, curries, fried fishs, and many more. I would recommend people coming here for delicious thai food and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mint Chicken
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian Papaya Salad
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Salad

Pax1RtIzmDT9pXvsjTHDNw.text: I was in Vegas visiting and heard that this place is a must try for people that love Thai food. I completely agree. I walked 3 miles(1.5 there and back) off the strip to check out this place. They have a huge menu and lots of options for vegetarians and those who are gluten free. I prefer to eat local and if I am ever in Vegas I will definitely have this place again. Five stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls

oPZ409XFB9___jSmiNtqUQ.text: Had some amazing Thai food last night from Komol- my second time visiting this place. Chili basil chicken and garlic chicken were awesome!!!

6tk0OXajIJaef7BDwnrY9g.text: Came here after being told the wait at Lotus of Siam was 1-1.5 hours on a Saturday night.  So we went across the parking lot, waited about 15 minutes, and were seated.  The restaurant was packed, so I understood the service being a little slow.  We had to ask for hot tea about 3 times, and we finally received it toward the end of our meal.  We also got a side of sweet and sour sauce when I asked for the chili and hot sauces.  The chili sauce came toward the end of our meal, again, and when i took the lid off, they were pretty much empty.    I don't know if it's because I've been so spoiled by all the amazing authentic restaurants in Thai Town in LA, but the food here was mediocre.  The tom yum soup did not have as much flavor as other tom yums I've tried.  But the presentation was cool (see picture)!  Our group ordered 2 chicken pad thai dishes and both were super dry.  The best thing we ordered was the Panang curry.  It was spicy and had lots of flavor.    One thing that I really wanted to get if I wasn't so full by the end of the meal was the mango and sticky rice dessert.  Looked so good!    I'd probably say if you have the time and patience, wait for LOS.  It has to be better than Komol.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom yum goong

_LXB88x7YV5W6yxli3lWYw.text: Location wasn't ideal. Huge a kind of mall with a half of shops were empty or closed. Two Thai restaurants were next each other. We choose this due to Yelp reviews. Inside wasn't that bad compare with outside. Friendly staff.  Food wasn't that bad but it was a bit sweeter to my taste. other than that, everything was good.

mpTrYVo8gMg-1dIA7lVwBw.text: Chicken panang was good, thick and creamy, but I prefer the panang at Thai noodle house.  Ordered level four and was the perfect amount of spice.  Although I took one bite and thought my mouth was on fire...must have eaten a whole chili!  Good thing I had some thai iced tea to bring down my searing tastebuds.  My friend got the pad thai spice level three and enjoyed it.  I tried a bit and have had better, but it was still good.  Both of us had the lunch special with comes with choice of soup or salad and an egg roll.  The egg roll is good and any place that gives you spicy mustard with your egg roll is a winner in my book.  We both got salad.  I got the peanut sauce dressing-yum and she had the ginger dressing which she liked.  This place is pretty far from me and I have many places on the west side for Thai that I like.  I would recommend you go try this and check out all the other places in this plaza as well!

oH9iTRUkTOTfB67dUcCdGw.text: Quickie review: This is my favorite Thai spot. They never disappoint with food. I love the restaurant itself. And we usually receive top-notch service. Though I have moved further away now...I continuously go out of my way to frequent this gem.  Food:  This place has a wide-array of food to choose from. You'll probably notice from other reviews that Komol does have a good vegetarian/vegan selection. I don't mean like 10 choices...I mean pages of vegetarian/vegan options. They have a lot to choose from and with their various serving sizes, from individual to family meals...they can accommodate any group situation.  There food quality is always top-notch and they're consistent. People like to counter good reviews about Komol saying that Lotus of Siam (in the same shopping center) is better. While I will not deny the quality of Lotus....when it comes to a quality/cost ratio....Komol wins.   Pad Thai, Pad Zee Ew, Herbal Salad, Go See Me, Tom Kha and their curries are generally among the dishes we always order. For a taster, try there individual vegetarian meals (which they will make un-vegetarian for you)...you'll get to try appetizers, a soup and a large entree for the price for a great price. Not to mention, they have amazing lunch specials which basically make you feel like you ripped THEM off considering the amount of food you get and what you paid for it. Seriously.   Atmosphere: Though the restaurant is getting more and more popular, it still has the feel of a quiet little spot. Pictures and artwork on the wall give it a home decor and their carved wood menu holders are an interesting touch.  Service: Typically, Komol has fast and friendly service. When's it's busy, the food may take a little long but it has never been ridiculous. The staff is willing to offer suggestions and are happy to introduce you to surprise dishes that you might have overlooked in their voluminous menu. Our last visit was a very rare night of bad service....like really bad....but I am going to chalk that up to a new server. If this becomes a trend, I will change my rating.  But, on the whole, all of our visits have been pleasant.  Overall, if you want a great meal, especially with a group that wants to avoid checks that will easily hit the triple-digit mark like at Lotus, come to Komol. Their food never disappoints and you usually leave stuffed to the point of shame. And that's saying a lot considering I am the same guy who has zero shame about pounding down a triple-chili burger from Tommy's and can happily look at myself in the mirror.

jxWeYiMuuedXQ6QSlk20tA.text: I was expecting to be absolutely blown away, and it was just A-OK.   Hit up this spot with Dana S on one afternoon and had takeout. The girl at the counter said it would be about 20 minutes--it was about 30.   The flavor of the noodles was good, but not drop dead amazing. The highlight of the meal was the barbecue pork that was in the appetizer sampler--not meant as an insult, but just an honest opinion.   I'm not sure I'd be back because there's a lot of other places I'd like to try and this first visit was less than stellar. Try calling in takeout orders in advance instead of wait wait waiting, too.

wUlB7T0MqFqhM8DVSccA1Q.text: This is my to go thai place when we have guests visiting from out of town. Their service is always great and they have amazing food. Our server once offered to give us a fresh container of rice free with our left overs, that was so nice of him.  I highly recommend you get the panang chicken curry, mint chicken, and herbal salad!  You can't possibly go wrong here, their food is consistently delicious:

6QwYaJ27KxpTVbOXdav9ng.text: I recently went on a date where the other person had some dietary restrictions. I was a little worried because I am a human garbage disposal. I eat everything. Sometimes you come across places that are vegetarian and it definitely feels like it is. As a person that enjoys meat, I did not miss it one bit when it came to Komol.  The Vegetarian Platter: was a bountiful fest of lightly battered fried spinach, sweet potatoes, eggplant, and tofu. It reaffirms that you can fry anything and it would be amazing.  The Chicken Noodle Soup: was just that. Nothing special, but it was welcomed on this cold day. No I am not talking about my experience on the date right now.  The Herbal Salad: was everything everyone raves about and more. I loved the crispy fried tofu skins mixed in to give it more texture. The dish does not lack in that department or in flavor.  The Vegetarian Delight Curry: was good. The eggplants, green beans, and tofu in a rich broth could have used more of a kick. We ordered it mild in case they actually went Asian hot on us. Instead it was definitely not made for someone who likes a kick.  There was just so much food in the end. I am still in shock by the serving size here. The service was minimal, but since I was trying to get to know the person across from me, I was happy they only stopped by to drop my food and refill the waters.

dCJgnzYITnSU-ouBzLYRIw.text: Well Vegas is making a good run for my 5 star restaurants. I now have 3 restaurants in this shopping center I will go to (this is the only 5). Two of which are Thai the other Indian. Komol is hands down my favorite Thai restaurant I have ever been to. As you walk in the door you see all of their awards including several for best vegan restaurant in Vegas. Always a good sign.  As usual I used my Thai barometer to gauge the quality of the food. The tofu Tom Yum and tofu pad kee mao were spot on with a Pascal reading of FANTASTIC! I left a full and happy patron. My taste buds although burning enjoyed basking in the wonderfulness of what I had just consumed.  Parking is plentiful and price was decent especially for Vegas. If in Vegas get yourself off the strip and eat some Thai that is twice as good as anything you will find on the strip and half the price. The cab ride will pay for itself.

ctVWq_32u6ifkY7XDSTUxw.text: Wow, I think this actually beats Lotus of Siam. Really.  PROS:  - everything the server recommended was delicious - theres a salad with apple that is a MUST  CONS:  - none  Verdict:  This is hands down the most authentic and delicious Thai food I've ever had. You have to check this place out if you're in Vegas.

4kNWXyRkE1Qviz-K7DRsCA.text: Penang is the best. This place has 5 stars in my book anyday. I usually order the Penang and Minced Chicken with a side of fish sauce to go with white rice or fried rice. I have traveled all around the country and I look for Thai food everywhere I go. Komol is what I compare other places with.

TC0MOCCxrlq1FLGA0nPD8w.text: Had some pretty yummy Thai food here last night... Lots of good vegetarian options, and when you order spicy, it's actually spicy! The service was a bit slow, but there was a large wedding party seated at the same time as my party so maybe that's why...  This might be a good back up plan if the wait for lotus of Siam is too long- it's in the same strip mall.

D2OSLbCVshZEKKjeD9P-Mg.text: Love this place! I used to live around the corner from it and ate there quite often. Its in the Commercial Center close to Lotus of Siam, which itself was named "Best Thai Restaurant" by Gourmet Magazine I believe it was. However, I prefer Komol.  Their lunch specials are one of the best deals in town, but, the food is really what makes it great. I suggest the Chili Mint... anything really,but, pork and chicken are the best! Every curry dish I had was delicious too. If you like duck i would recommend the Pineapple Duck. Larb and Pad See Ew are off-the-hook also.   My old roomie was a vegan and everything I tried that he got like the Orange Peel Gluten, was awesome. Also make sure to get their Brown sticky rice, its the bomb.   Oh my god I'm hungry now.

f6hSDoIVzbtdd2G9yKiGeQ.text: Despite being an avid Thai fan, I have been to Komol (a Vegas Valley Thai favorite) twice. The first time was years ago, before I knew about its reputation. The experience was not bad, nor was it memorable. Since I have become savvy of its clout among locals, I ventured back there and - outside of the herbal salad - I was similarly underwhelmed. We had a sampling of four dishes and - the aforementioned glorious herbal salad excluded - nothing really stood out. It was all decent Thai food, but nothing more. And while it gets bonus points for that herbal salad, it certainly gets docked for the molasses service and (to a lesser extent) whatever it is that they call merlot in this joint (I know, what do I expect when ordering wine in a hole-in-the-wall Thai restaurant). With Lotus of Siam in the same parking lot, I do not see myself coming back to Komol.  Side Note: I get hit up for change at a ridiculous clip in this parking lot when I visit Lotus. At Komol, I was able to park directly in front of the restaurant. Instantly I thought, "Well, at least I will not be hit up for change." Then, hilariously, I take two steps from my car and a dude asks if he can watch my car in exchange for some dough. It was like he appeared out of thin air! If mooching were a sport, the world championships would definitely be held in this parking lot.

lJKZM3eZMsz99LdYoN9VHQ.text: As promised, I came back yesterday for dinner.  I tried the Herbal salad and had mixed feeling about the dish.  It was either good or bad.  It just had too much coconut, red onion, but barely any tofu to balance the taste for a vegetarian dish.  The non-dairy ice coffee was good.  The server recognized me and was very friendly.  The place did get crowded  after 6 p.m.  Perharps I have to come back for the third time to order the "right" dish?

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now this is just too funny!
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taro Ball. The only thing missing is crush peanut on top.
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pad thai

MdRDB8CNPDSAufJ0zWgrkA.text: My brother is married to a Thai woman who owned a restaurant in Thailand, so she knows how to cook Thai food. So usually he will not eat at Thai restaurants because they compare badly to home cooking. Took him to Komol for lunch and he was impressed by the authenticity and quality of the food, and the reasonableness of the price. Many of my vegetarian friends also swear by this place. Exceptional food, reasonable prices, and friendly service -- what more do you want in a restaurant?

LG_RcRG8pJY63e7LSRcCBg.text: Probably the third time we have been here over the last 1-2 years. Not in Las Vegas that often. We love Thai food and this place is awesome. All the dishes we had were great. Service was also great. We were given a lot of recommendations and they did not disappoint. Ordered spicy level 3 which worked out good for all of us.

WQHn4X5LQB_gaQguXNq6PA.text: Listen, the food is PHENOMENAL. The people themselves PHENOMENAL. The only thing that bothers me is the wait time. Whether I am picking up food or dining at the restaurant it take forever. I understand that they put alot of effort into their food, but it takes a while for someone to even take your order. On top of that it takes 30 plus minutes to get your food. Other than that everything is reasonably price, and like I said the food is bomb. Huge plus they have VEGAN MENU!!

tz1_TA5SAV_MvB0MMOhDZg.text: Great food with excellent service.  I go to this restaurant every summer when I go on vacation from O.C. One of the servers(Dutch) remembers us every time , he hussle to serve everyone.  Duck Panang here is sooooo good! I don't like duck, but I love this dish here.  The deep fried prawns are so tasty, I ate the shell too.  My wife loves the Sea Bass and my Mother-in-Law must have the Red Snapper Salad. Yes, I did say mother in law. Both my kids enjoys the Crab Fried Rice and daughter must have her favorite desert" mango with sticky rice is delicious" so she said.

NXvtXJGcueKdSP4c4-1hOg.text: I honestly don't understand what all these great reviews are about. Perhaps I caught them on a bad day? Perhaps they ordered a bad shipment of meat? Either way, my dining experience at Komol was one of the most unpleasant lunches I have ever had.  The meat. Dear God Almighty, the meat. Perhaps they accidentally gave me food out of the garbage? I ordered the Red Beef Curry and it was disgusting, absolutely disgusting.   My co-workers ordered chicken and seemed to fair fine, but I made then sample my beef and they agreed it was awful. The bad beef alone might have gotten them three stars, but the complete disregard for the fact that they were serving inedible food is what gets them one star.   I did not eat even 1/5 of the food brought. When the waiter asked if I wanted to take the   rest home, I said no. I asked the other people if they wanted the food, and they all said no. One even said, "That meat is awful" while the waiter was there.   The server's response? "Ok." Not a word of concern, not an offer to bring a new dish. Nope. Komol will serve you garbage and does not care if you hate the food, just as long as you pay.  Most restaurants notice, and care, if someone doesn't eat their dish and doesn't take it home either. That's generally the universal sign it was bad. Most restaurants will try to get you something else or ask if there's anything they can do to fix it. Not Komol. Komol wants you to pay and get out.  Given the great reviews from others, I'm assuming there are other, more edible foods on the menu. But, take my advice, stay AWAY from the beef. And stay away from Komol if you want a place with good customer service.  For a delicious Red Beef Curry, try Le Thai. The beef there is tender, high quality, juicy, and does not taste like garbage.

F6E45MbioRaMbanSCdGXbA.text: Everything I've had so far at Komol has been outstanding. And even though it's over half an hour away from where my family lives on the West side, I'm going to request a trip here every time I come to visit.   So far I've tried the panang curry (once with chicken, once vegetarian), pad thai, eggplant with black bean sauce, house special duck, soft shell crab with garlic sauce, and a combination appetizer plate. One dish is better than the next. They've been spot on with the spice level both times- I asked for a little spicy and it was perfect for me- which I really appreciate. The staff was also helpful in suggesting dishes for the less adventurous eaters in the group.   My one complaint is the menu. It's this giant wood binder that's heavy and unwieldy. But other than that I can't wait to come back again and try more of the menu!

twvTDbusLE3OCZgotm0BWw.text: Keep this place a secret.  I'm a foodie and a food critic, this is my go to place for Thai. Nothing disappoints.

z_JVwvpv63ULnL14-ycsXQ.text: Read the reviews on the wall while you wait! Hilarious.  Ordered the Duck Rice, Pad Thai (5 was spicy, but enough), stuffed wings and chicken satays.  Everything was absolutely delicious. And this was PLENTY of food for two people to share.  The peanut sauce for the chicken satays was the best I have ever had :) Duck rice had HUGE chunks of duck in it (very visible, unlike my favorite delivery place Thai Style Noodle House) Pad thai, I thought was delicious, but my friend said his favorite spot Mr. Chop Chop does it better.  Service was also very attentive and the meal came to around $50 for the both of us. Also would like to add that this place is way better than Lotus ;)

VJZ6UXP3n1wSwZAM-Uwc-A.text: This place is in my humble opinion some of the best and most consistent Thai food in las vegas. I am primarily a vegetarian.. most of the time anyway and this place offers a great selection of high quality meat substitutes.   And oh man, once i ordered the panang with mock duck and they accidentally gave me real duck, HOLY CRAP it was the most amazing thing LOL. I understand that most people who order vegetarian style would be upset by this but I have to say it was a aw some accident.  The interior is kind of whatever but nicer than most thai places. but the people who work here offer great service.

wIm0S_cJ_W2AUw3CAIXI-w.text: The food is phenomenal! The ambiance is very serene and peaceful! Overall, it is a GREAT place to have a good time!!

q2GGGC7a1ldDsBVoAzyqwg.text: Now this place is the best in the world. I can't live without it, they should have 5 stars forever. Can't live without the panang and chili mint!

-qJEnM19w_xUVXYPTOaBbg.text: Barf.  Worst Thai food I've ever had.  The red snapper filet was full of bones.  The crab fried rice had no discernible crab.  The ginger shrimp was watery.  I didn't think you could mess up fresh spring rolls, but I was wrong.  Everything was bland.

x6JUqA4Up06QYUUx5VcvbQ.text: We had lunch here on a Wed. about 1pm after driving in from Orange County, CA.  We ordered the chicken panang curry and chile mint lunch specials and the herbal salad due to the great Yelp reviews.  I thought the overall flavors were just ok, I've had way better Thai. We ordered medium spicy, 5, it was more like a 7-8, pretty spicy and we can eat hot.  The herbal salad was just ok to us, not a 5-star dish. The service was friendly but oh so slow, took almost 35 min. before we were served after placing our order.  Probably won't go here again, I like the Thai BBQ joint on 3rd street better.  We have eaten Thai in Thailand, all over SCal and the best we've had in the US was at the Thai House in Fairbanks, Alaska and at Chanida in Yucaipa, CA (a hidden gem).

xMGYkWVkPFUEEOPy3pS7JA.text: A relatively new vegetarian eater, the herbal salad and vegetarian delight were very good.  Definitely worth visiting if you are in Las Vegas.

GqF0OblXeglCSmnKg2hjvg.text: Unlike most, I did not cross the scary parking lot from Lotus of Siam to visit Komol.  Rather, a vegetarian friend of mine touted this place as his favorite in Vegas and, with that endorsement, I had to visit.  Admittedly, I was turned off on first sight -- it's fake flowers and dim lighting don't really do it for me.   And the overwhelming menu made my head spin-- we're talking pages and pages of dishes, folks!  But, then the food came out.... and the angels started singing. Now, we go about once a month with our veggie friends and have not yet had anything that has disappointed.  My meal always starts with the cold papaya salad (fresh, slim-cut papaya with finely chopped green chilis,  some salt and pepper to taste and a dash of lime juice - YUM and so fresh), and the tom kha soup.  Where it goes from there is anyone's guess... but it never disappoints.  My newest favorite: the sauteed flat noodles with faux duck. (I'm salivating as I type.)  4 stars are only because you feel you have to brave the elements every time you go.  The last time I went, there was a scary homeless dude perched outside the entrance and the parking lot in front of this resto always seems to be littered with broken glass.

mb_Wauh0Z31KqDEmobwnOw.text: Went back for CES, and I dont know if i over ate or there was some extra MSG, but i got an immediate stomach ache after the meal. The food tasted excellent however.. so im sticking with 4 stars and a warning to pace yourself, yelpers!

j026LUnAJyIlPV8qN2Y3_w.text: Solid restaurant. They don't skimp on the spice. One of the few spots out here that has an extensive vegan/vegetarian menu. When I came here for lunch, service was great, probably because the restaurant was nearly empty. Coming here during dinner can be hit or miss with service. Occasionally, you will encounter homeless people wandering around the entrance trying to ask for change.

5Ef-q6UsgRBiqReLOWLmCw.text: We went to dinner late one night after a show in Vegas and the food was fantastic! The vegetable curry was the best I ever had! Loved it! Next time in Vegas, make sure you take the extra effort and drive off the strip to this charming restaurant--you will not be disappointed.

m5nDUfDUOXkcaU4C-B8J3w.text: This truly is a hidden gem. I have been eating at this restaurant for 20 years and the food is consistently delicious. The tom yum soup is the perfect combination of hot and sour. The pad kee mao is one of my favorite noodle dishes there. It is a must-try. The chicken chili mint is probably the best I have ever had. They make it with ground meat of your choice so every bite is infused with flavor and spices. The chef's special is also a favorite and I highly recommend it to anyone. One of the least recognized items on the menu is the house special omelet. The name and menu description does the dish NO justice. It is to DIE for. The curries are all great, however, if you like a thicker curry, you will have to let them know as the standard at Komol is the runnier version, with exception of the panang curry. You can order the food pretty spicy. They go from 1-10, with 10 being pretty hot and then superhot levels 1-5. If you love thai food, this place is a MUST MUST MUST!

BXmdY7qWBrzkbvXI10Q6YQ.text: got take out. nothing to write home about. i guess everything is relative, but this food was less than mediocre... sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good veg options but not exclusively vegetarian restaurant

g3naphyE1F6Pc52GsMr2dA.text: The thing about Komol is that they cater to Vegans and Vegetarians alike (myself included) and the food is actually good! The service is pretty good as the people are friendly and frequently check up on your drinks to refill them. My fav. here is the Pineapple Fried Rice and the Tofu Satay.  I love the spicy-ness of the Fried Rice and if you love spicy, say '10' to let them know how hot you want it... it's spicy but not too over the top. The peanut sauce for the satay is killer and I make sure to always get that when I come in.  Plus, the food is cheap and this place, although it SHOULD be crowded, is more of a quaint, tranquil atmosphere on most occasions; a characteristic I definitely enjoy.  I've also had the combination vegetable appetizer on many occasions and I enjoy that as well.

3d573NFfG7c5FlzDfnLyQQ.text: Great vegetarian food in an understated strip mall (read: a dump.)

5YNKWh0lRzTcYnAWn5xoXA.text: Second to Lotus of Siam... This is great food with great service. They are known for vegetarian dishes...

nPyhHH_z82DZ43IyFkicsQ.text: I've tried Lotus of Siam, I've tried Archi's, and Komol remains my absolute favorite Thai restaurant. I've probably been there at least a half dozen times and I have never had a bad experience. The menu is huge, both in content and weight, and they have a ton of options for omnivores and vegetarians alike. I usually get panang or red curry, but I've heard good things about the sesame beef, Indian curry, and sweet and sour chicken. The pad thai is some of the best I've had in Vegas, and the tom yum and tom kha are equally amazing.  If I had one complaint, the service can be hit or miss. It's never been awful, but it can be a little slow sometimes. However, I am perfectly willing to deal with slowish service if it means eating lots of cheap, delicious food.

qpC7wMbkiyVpOaJHT7C0ew.text: I love me some Archi's and I was reluctant to try Komol because I didn't want to cheat on good ol' Archi. Well, I'm glad I strayed (just for the evening). This place is fantastic! The spice levels are always right on the mark. I get up to a 6 or 7 usually, and it's got the right kick to it. The service is great and there are so many menu options it takes me quite a while to figure out what I'm going to order. My two favorite dishes so far are the Papaya Pad Thai and the Cat Fish in Red Curry Sauce. YUM!. I always have to get and then one extra dish to try something new each time.  I'm new to Thai, but it's quickly becoming my favorite!!! I'm officially a Thai Addict.

C6xxltIWMe2TVJbI-fgbPQ.text: The ground pork omelette, chicken glass noodle, and garlic pork was just ok. What was pretty good was the pad thai, and the tom yum kai. Now what was really good was the Papaya salad. I would go back only for that tho. The place was in the middle of nowhere. It was so quiet there that we felt like the only customers in there.

IpaVUN8pWxHeDMagwJAjNg.text: Saw that this restaurant was rated 4 stars, so decided to try it and it pleasantly exceeded our expectations.  Loved the Fresh Spring Rolls, a nice change from fried ones. The friendly waiter suggested the Chili Mint with Pork, the Vegtarian Pad-Kee-Mao and the Kang-Ped Vegetarian Curry and all three dishes were to die for...very fresh and flavorful. Enjoy!

25B-k_pBHcPJt0iCdPqA4A.text: I have been to literally 12 Thai restaurants in Vegas and this one has the best Thai food. Every dish has soo much flavor! Also, the consistency never changes. It just sucks that its far from where I live so I go there once every 4 months but every time I leave thinking, "that was really good!"

gFUi7Cnlx_JmlER3TCfOYA.text: Three things to say 1) As a visitor to Vegas stay away. Sketchy area.  2) Food blah.... Pad Thai had no peanut sauce, was dry and medium spice was very spicy. Mongolian beef was just a soupy tasteless sauce. Worst we ever had.  3) not sure how they have a 4 star- must be paid or really really old reviews.   STAY AWAY!

W-vv3w9Qmb6BRijOrrUdAw.text: The selection is huge! Not to mention vegan and vegetarian options? The food is good, decently portioned and attentive staff. Its very peaceful in here! At least for the times I have been here. The mango sticky rice dessert was wonderful and pretty to the eyes. They have a great selection of desserts that is definitely worth staying to try. Komol gives off a very mom and pop/family owned thai resturant, so its pretty cozy in my opinion. I'll be nore than happy to come by and try thier other dishes when I'm around the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Fq7Hgxgeov2H85O14yyJIQ.text: It's OK. It's like the Thai version of old school Americanized Chinese food that your grandparents enjoyed in the 70s. It's not bad, it's just not very authentic or flavorful. I am vegan, and I liked their veggie, non-soy attempt at Tod Mun(fish cakes). Not great, but ok and super creative. On that note, I also enjoyed the many non-soy veggie options. This is definitely not a "vegan chef," creating new and exciting concoctions; however, it is something for those vegans and vegetarians in search of Thai food in Vegas.

GUATkk6B99LPVjB5pHzzJg.text: Love the huge selection of Vegan options here. But love that the food tastes so authentic and rich! The service was also very good!!  We started with the papaya salad, portion was generous. Nice that they actually brought out the appetizer first :) Also had the Penang Veggie Curry with "Fish" and the Pad Kee Mao. Cannot wait to go back and try all their other dishes! Price is also great. I just wished they were closer to my house cause I'd be there daily for their lunch specials!!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Kee Mao with Tofu
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penang Veggie Curry with &#34;Fish&#34;
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya Salad

JpHGQJYyab4zvURF4M1QIA.text: This place was outstanding. It's worth the drive through the currently Ghetto-fied surrounding buildings in what used to the hustling and bustling Commercial Center. So you don't drive endlessly through the 'sex clubs' and gay workout places and what not, jut drive to the island of merchants in the middle, Komol is there and it faces west.  Sort of near where the legendary Jeannie Moore's Arcade used to be (If they were still around, that would be 5 star rating for sure!)      On a weekday, Komal was devoid of patrons except for my guest and I. After looking over these heavy, wooden menus that were folded up like a high level spellbook from a Tolkien fantasy movie, we ordered the fried quid as an appetizer, and it was excellent! The size of the chunks of squid within the batter made me put those on my "I have to back and try those again" list. We also ordered Massaman with brown rice and and then we ordered this kind of shrimp soup. All of it was very, very good. My buddy and I (who can both put down food like their is a miniature black hole in our gullet) were able to barely finish. If you call how we left thing, 'finished'.     The wait staff was great, and the owner said goodbye to us on the way out. There were best of Last Vegas awards on the wall  If I dont' find mysef near Lotus of Siam (my current fave, but they have mooved to be near Paradice and Flamingo), Komol will always be where I go when I am craving Thai food and on that side of town.  PRO TIP: as with any establishment that offers a lunch buffet, do not order that.  Those buffets are for the uninitiated schlubs that will eat anything and call it delightful. You've come this far, now do yourself a favor and order off their heavy bafforr wood binders. (Bafforr? Find your nerdiest Star Wars friend and ask them to explain that reference to you).

KfvzydggqHy3SxH4VtmBOg.text: Awesome food great waitstaff great prices The food was delivered and it was hot and tasted exceptional!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I hope to come back soon and have another wonderful meal

rrCl-o7k-gXraBL41clDUQ.text: This is not authentic Thai food. I have no idea how this place is rated 4 stars. Neighborhood is bad. Service is good. However... food is plain and not good, period. We ordered garlic pork, papaya salad, beef larb, beef chow fun, and spring rolls.  Maybe the restaurant should reduce the number of items menu and improve on their recipes.

HVow9Pqi-s6H8B7JfIU4nA.text: Great Thai restaurant off the strip serving vegan/vegetarian and meat cuisines. The place doesn't look like much outside yet there is ample parking, lunch specials served from 11am-230pm m-f, excludes holiday and a very kind, efficient wait staff. My boyfriend is a plant based vegan and loved his vegetable penang curry with brown rice (upcharge for brown rice). I thought my eggplant dish with black bean sauce (added beef, $1.50 more) was good yet I was hoping the beef was sliced not ground. The dish was not bad yet a tad oily for my liking. Lunch serving size is plentiful and price range was between $7-9. Overall restaurant was good and we learned it has been in vegas for over 30+ years.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The book of Narnia

EiWBB-PZ6D68drbRoBDr9Q.text: I love this place nuff said. Since Cornish Pasty moved out next door this place should totally expand! This place caters to meat lovers to vegans and Im never disappointed. Although seating wise Im not a fan of the booths to the left due to the seating being too low and not comfortable with the table.

TFahFogSfyCcpB8M51plpw.text: I am a huge fan of Thai food, I wouldn't call myself an expert at all, but I've been to more than enough Thai places (including the other 2 literally steps away) in my lifetime to know that Komol knows their stuff and knows it well. I always compare every Thai restaurant to Komol because it's consistently at the top of my list in best Thai food, and while I do enjoy some of those other places, it's always the food at Komol that holds that special place in my belly.   My personal favorites here (all of which can be made vegan or non-vegan) include Panang Curry, Papaya Salad, Tom-Kha Soup, Daikon Pancakes, and Green Curry Fried Rice. I really, really love that when I do order vegan, I don't have to adjust orders and worry about them not hearing me correctly or being annoyed. It's the one take out place I've frequented that's never messed up my order.   The spice levels (1-10) here that I order are always consistent. Portions are always a reasonable size & prices seem fair considering. Take out here has always been quick/easy to do though I wish they would jump on the trend of app/web ordering.  The only other con I would have is the restaurant itself.. it's very dated and not very aesthetically pleasing, not even in the charming, divey way. I would imagine it looks exactly like a little, old Thai lady's house who hasn't changed anything out in years. I almost always order take out. If I'm taking friends out to eat Thai food, sometimes I'll choose other Thai places because they have a better atmosphere even if the food isn't as great as Komol. I know Komol has been around a very long time, but they don't have to show it like all my wrinkles show my age. While doing some work on myself isn't a bright idea for me personally, it wouldn't hurt the restaurant to get creative and get updated with a few things.  Still, because of how crazy delicious the food is here.. a solid 4.5/5 rounded up to a 5 for me.

q_VCLbDlfin45lbIcY7dWQ.text: Friendly service. The food comes to the table fast and delicious.  The veg spring rolls are the best I've ever had.   Also there isn't a wait far a table like the other place in the plaza.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh basil in the spring rolls.  So good

E-hkbXdis3nLCtgIRf8LMg.text: 2nd best Thai I have eaten. EVER. My in-laws, who are averse to foreign food, also loved the food here.  The staff was very accommodating, they customized our order to make it vegan.  Great experience.  I would recommend it!

MAJg__5Isy9B93dQPEdVUw.text: Back in LV again for business and hat to stop in to my favorite Thai food joint. Ordered my favorite panang curry  and this time tried the duck.  Both of these were fantastic as I have come to expect, along with fast friendly service.  Great job.
