uXht3N8DXDntDlp4fYFpaQ.text: If you are a soup person this is not my favorite place for soup. The soup is not as flavorful as other places but the seafood, beef, tofu, and other non soup items are amazing. Ask for your dish to be served non-American style and they will make sure it has a ton of flavor.The best Thai food in Las Vegas.Operated and owned by same owner for more than 25 years. Traditional authentic Thai food in a cozy atmosphere. Dress attire is casual and the music is very relaxing that they play. Large Vegetarian option menu or gluten free.

3XkwWTF75KdjJG1wLlsrzQ.text: When I go to Vegas my expectations are lowered when it comes to Thai food. Living in the Bay Area and Seattle spoiled me for amazing Thai cuisine. What a surprize to find a vegetarian-friendly, high-quality place in Vegas. Far away from the glitz and located in a sketchy part of Vegas (pretty much everywhere but the strip) I found a place that takes Panang seriously. Not the watery lame curries that soil the name of Thai restaurants, but rich, flavorful, thoughtfully crafted Panang. The sauces were great as well as the fresh mint spring rolls. Friendly and delicious.

qXLTz9A6Q7AATjclOh8wJQ.text: This is a very nice Thai restaurant located in a strip mall in Las Vegas. We were all vegetarians and there was special menu for us. Service was very good and we were all happy with appetizers and main dishes.

DMAwRJCxuZ0lcpX0wVnBSA.text: maybe the establishment was having an off day, but this restaurant is not four stars if you are going for the vegetarian or vegan options. while the flavors were okay, and the service sincere, what really kind of threw a wrench into it all was the portions.   while im not one to binge on food, for the price, at 12-13$ a plate, i expected more or.. if the servings are going to be small, adjust the plate size to match.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. this pad see ew is untouched a fresh from the kitchen. serving size is pretty disappointing considering how much is being charged.

YFplOv0KhOMUXgZvImZnPg.text: Wow! My new favorite Thai place. Presentation is superb, and food fantastic! The service is professional and quick. My choice of fresh spring rolls is something that I will order again.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7b-8xR0rCdRqup5EO_Qy-g.text: Vegans and vegetarians, LOOK NO FURTHER.  This is the best in Vegas.   We had a lil problem locating the restaurant in the plaza but don't give up.  Huge menu for us and also for meat eaters,  so everyone in your party has choices. So much to choose from and everything is good. Ask waitress for recommendations since it's hard to decide on one dish. They all look so good.  The restaurant is nice and clean and service is impeccable.   I will definitely  frequent  this place.  Feng was our waitress.  We visited Thailand and this food makes us want to go back. No kidding!!! They even have vegan desserts!!!!

BHH_yOuVMpuH_FFdtpz98g.text: I have been dining at komal since 1995 I was only nineteen then and I love it as much now as I did then and even more as I am a food connoisseur and have eaten at over 100 restaurants in Las Vegas since the mid-90s from the littlest mom-and-pops to the fanciest Gourmet upscale restaurants  fine dining  with just two of us with wine and champagne at places like the Tillerman the Manhattan with a piano bar Anthony's which had Wild game rattlesnake ,shark, rabbit ,at any rate what I love about komal is the extensive menu of offerings a family feeling atmosphere where they know your name I enjoy the fresh spring rolls, the panang curry garlic eggplant Pak kee mow, you just can't go wrong everything on the menu is amazing and for the price you can't beat it

H47XG8-zfosMkwctvExjTw.text: Quite possibly the BEST Panang Curry I've ever had in my life! I come here often, as this is my go-to place for Thai. Plus, my woman is Vegan and this is one joint in town where we can both have a complete dining experience together.

1Q_dG3oXGYfrP26JkdZT1w.text: Spicy, vegan-friendly Thai food. That's all one needs to tell me to come here.   And once I was there, the giant menu was almost overwhelming, but I stuck with curry and fresh sprint rolls.   Everything is so damn good.  And if you ask them to make it spicy, they will TURN. IT. UP!  Coconut juice came in a cute coconut-shaped bowl. Thai iced tea was good. Coconut ice cream was delicious.  Our waiter was really cool. He always came back to check up on us and to give us what we needed.  This is probably in my top 3 places to eat Thai food, and I LOVE my Thai food, so  there.

IL8ZXwuPhgKybvLPAfhkqw.text: Definitely a cut or more above any Thai restaurant I've been to. Service slow, but it didn't bother me at all. My friends were whining, however they loved the food. Vegetarian Pad Thai, Lemongrass Chicken, Herbal Salad, Fried Sweet Potato. I'll be back! And prolly won't eat at another Thai restaurant in LV, except Komol. Great prices, and healthy portions!

7zd1KOeR8saBECa903UEYg.text: I'm new to Vegas and I was having the worst time finding a good Thai spot, until I found this place! Not the best location, but it's some of the most authentic Thai I have ever had. Great prices and great service, will be returning.

pqlEsucymue6jYMyFg13gg.text: We went here because the Lotus of Siam was closed, and I'm glad, because this place is even better. True enough, the service is a bit slow - slow to take our order slow to bring the food and slow to bring the check. But so what! The food is worth the wait. And the ambience is quiet and quite lovely. I missed having music at first, but my companion was so interesting I soon forgot about it and really enjoyed our dining experience.  If they speed up the service and add a little soft music, I'll give them a five star in a nano second!

GkMSE1cQ4J3WpRm_GNVZTg.text: Alway great food and service !!!  The Best dish is Herb Salad. Love their Tom ka Soup too.  Don't forget to safe room for Homemade Coconut ice cream

z2LOgYxhSLIuK7eqV6QVww.text: I come here at least once a month and I live in Los Angeles.  I'm not going to lie, whenever Lotus of Siam is more then a 15 minute wait, I will walk over to Komol and order basically the same thing (and some dishes aren't as oily as Lotus).  I am a huge fan of Thai food, it's like Chinese food on steroids YUM!!! So first of all, the menu is heavy... and I mean literally heavy, this wooden block is like 7 lbs... so be careful not to drop it.   Secondly, can you please get some legit hotsauce up in here?  If you do I will come here over lotus 9x out of 10!!! Rooster sauce, Sriracha,... come on get it together!!!   Their soups are good and hearty, vegetables aren't mushy and gross. (I always order wor wonton soup) Asians love soup!  Entrees are good here. And when you say spicy as 10 here, they will stack that entree with hella jalepenos so beware!!!  I always say 10 and half way thru the tears wish I got a 9.  Garlic Chicken extra onions spicy level 10 please!!!  thai ice tea here is just like everywhere else. nothing special.  Prices are reasonable.  AWESOME VEGETARIAN MENU!!!  Small dining area... not good for large groups.    Soda is never super carbonated.    I will still be back

WaujYb7P2MZD1znFpdwj_A.text: Komol, you no doubt deserve the bump up to FIVE STARS. I eat you at least once a week and have been coming here since I was 16. I've never been dissatisfied with the food. Not one bad dish in all that time. I cannot say that about any other restaurant. Also, the service has been stepped up a notch too, so thank you for that.   Trust me, all the food is excellent here, but these are the dishes I always order: Tom Kha Num Tok Panang Beef Garlic Pepper beef/chicken Herbal Salad- I dream about this   FYI 1. When you go to Komol if you say HOT they will make it HOT for you. Don't try to wear the Daddy pants if you don't have a belt if ya' know what I mean. 2.  Even though the service has been much better recently I still recommend letting your server know if you are on a tight time schedule. They will do their best to accommodate you.  Thank you Komol for the 20 years of flavorful dishes you have made for me and all of the memories I've made around your dinner tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Kee Mao lunch special. It comes with your choice of soup or salad.

It's a Saturday and you only have 2 waiters working the floor, all while having to check people in and out?! They obviously did the best they could with the little help they could've gotten if the MANAGER would be a little bit more thoughtful! I felt bad for them so I felt the need to say sorry to them!

qIgskJ7EJbzHEcNXD7dbtA.text: U Tried the rest now try best should be there slogan been coming here for many years have an awesome lunch  lunch menu also during the week from Monday to Friday

GbI-NMm2QhLqboJrSYoOaw.text: Great food, service, and gluten and dairy free options. As someone with food allergies, this place is heaven. It deserves five stars no question.

X_I2q141rVDyB844maBN_w.text: I ordered the lunch special, Vegetarian Hot & Spicy with salad (ginger dressing) for the mister and Tofu and Vegetable Panang Thai Hot for both. As usual the panang was bomb dot com! Never tried the Hot & Spicy until yesterday but it was pretty good. I always order tofu and veggie panang because it is consistently DELICIOUS broke da mouth.  The location is kind of sketchy but the food is totally worth it. If you are in need of some GREAT Thai food you need to check this place out.

kb1riYU86_nBS0cY8owbVg.text: Great Thai food for vegetarians and non-vegetarians. Loved the Herbal Salad and Panang vegetables curry

DHXId7VQX54t6xOzljyQew.text: Being in the same shopping center as Lotus of Siam it was a toss up if we should come here or not.  Komol didn't disappoint. The menu here is heavy enough to beat away someone trying to attack you which is a grand way to make a impression. The service here was very attentive and the waiter was good about engaging in conversation without being long winded.  The food is a little slow to come out is my only complaint  The good: Chicken Penang curry: deep rich flavors with coconut milk Garlic soft shell crab -  loaded with garlic. yum. a little small compared to what i had before b Herbal salad - Good but not crazy about all the toasted coconut.    Tom yum soup - just okay and a little oily

SPw7IJRMoxu4Y_oqujP3Gg.text: Off the beaten path, but worth the Uber ride!  Extreme amounts of vegetarian dishes;  and very extensive menu. I had the Pineapple fried Rice and Egg Rolls, and it did not disappoint!  There were five of us and everyone was pleased with their meal! I've never witnessed this before, however with all of the "spicy" entrees everyone was asked on a scale of 1-10 how much heat/spice they wanted, I thought that was such a great idea, as mine would have been Zero!  lol

h6qAQir3nl1gX1c3VVh5IA.text: Had a really nice lunch here with my brother.  We shared papaya salad, thai - syle mint chicken and beef fried rice.  Thai iced teas.    Flavors were all quite good.  I thought the papaya salad was a bit on the small size serving wise for $10+, otherwise great value for the $ and very generous portions and value.    We ordered everything spicy and the server checked in on us throughout the meal on the flavors etc.    Just really good service and our server was genuinely interested in making sure everything was A-OK.  With tip was around $40

QVmvFfIPKJo-yoNnisRciA.text: Outstanding Thai food and I have been to Thailand!  Pages of vegan and vegetarian dishes--large portions.  1-10 spice scale, 7/10 is Spicy.  The neighborhood looks ruff, it's fine

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan curry dish
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup of Tom yum chicken
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom yum tofu and mushroom

eOW5C-EZU7h-hF_E2fROEg.text: I tried to find this place 8 years ago when I first moved here and gave up after driving around the Commercial Center (which is huge!) for about 20 minutes.  I wish I didn't give up so soon.  A UYE motivated me to get my butt over here again.  I did drive around for a bit looking for it, but I was a little more determined this time.  The place is tiny and doesn't have a fancy neon sign like Lotus of Siam.  But whatever it lacks in flash, it makes up for in tastiness.    The panang curry was amazing as was the herbal salad.  The tofu nam sod with crispy rice was absolutely delicious.  My favorite dish hands down.  They aren't shy about the spice so adjust accordingly.  I like spicy and a 5 out of 10 was enough for me.    Service was good.  They kept the water coming, that's for sure.  Just get here early for dinner.  When I left, there was a line out the door on a Monday night.  They have a lot of inventive dishes, like pad thai with papaya noodles instead of regular old rice noodles.  Great for vegans and vegetarians, but there are meat options, too.  The menu is huge and has separate sections for vegetarian and non-vegetarian to avoid any confusion.  I probably need to try Lotus of Siam before I come back.  But definitely looking forward to swinging by and trying more of their dishes.

qXrnI2LSX2tg1tzEEW2Lhg.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant. The food is always fresh and has a  great presentation. My favorite dish is stir fried eggplant with ground chicken in black bean sauce. It is so tasty. I don't like very spicy food so I just tell them 0 spice. I also love their brown rice, it's far more delicious than any other brown rice I've had. Their cucumber salad and crispy spinach are to die for. The restaurant is clean and they are very pleasant. The service is a little slow but that's because everything is made to order. I always bring friends and relatives who are visiting Las Vegas to Komol everyone loves it as much as I do.

xQxifSUDbOCfSswIWBlzlA.text: I'd been here a couple of times for lunch previously, but never for dinner and never with my husband. Our $25 restaurant.com gift certificate seemed like the perfect excuse to drop in for a date night. Komol is fairly small. And there never seems to be more than a handful of tables occupied. It's a really nice little place with a good atmosphere. We started off with the stuffed chicken wings. They were good, but mostly they were just interesting. I'm not sure I would ever order them again, but I'm glad I tried them. We then shared the hot and spicy pork hock curry and beef chili mint. To be honest, neither were what we expected - though, that was certainly not a bad thing. I typically do not enjoy curry dishes, but this particular curry dish was incredibly delicious. The beef chili mint was also fantastic. When you order, you can choose on a scale of 1-10 of how spicy you want the dishes. My husband and I both opted for a 6. And while we both tend to find things others describe as "hot" to be merely "mild", the dishes were almost too spicy - but in that good way. We then finished it all off with a dessert of fried bananas with coconut ice cream. All in all, it was a delicious meal. To be honest, I think I actually prefer Komol to Lotus of Siam. And the service was excellent - up until it came time to pay the bill anyways. When we handed our server the restaurant.com gift certificate, he set it back on the table and said "we don't take these anymore". Uh, what? We purchased it. We purchased it for this restaurant. And it doesn't expire. But ok, fine. We asked a couple of questions about it as we were clearly taken by surprise, but didn't really get anywhere. I suppose I can understand, but - and maybe this is just me having lived in Vegas too long - what irked me the most was that there was nothing done about it. No "so sorry, we'll take care of those two beers" ($8). No "our apologies, your dessert is on us" ($4). For us, it really took away from the overall service. And it takes away a star from my rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried bananas and coconut ice cream
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chili mint
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot and spicy pork hock curry

Srfdwn4SbHJzuZK4aqtjUQ.text: We drove up and we're wary of the location but went inside anyway. And I'm so glad we did! I'm vegetarian and they have one of the biggest vegetarian menus I've ever seen. My meat eating friends ended up eating vegetarian dishes too! The food was delicious and had large portions. The service was also really good. The wait staff was very friendly. Overall great experience.

PtpfXFSLWv6J_tQgUds2HA.text: Well well well...Lotus...You have a competitor!  I am sure they have been competitors for awhile, but I recently just discovered Komol restaurant and I am blown away by the flavor of the food!  I actually went twice in one week (seriously not planned) and both times the food has been great!  Service did lack a bit the second time, but the wait was worth it.   Things my friends and I got:   *Chili mint tofu with ground chicken - so flavorful!  MIx it with some fried rice, and this may be the only dish you need to order   *Pad Kee Mao - this is my favorite dish in ANY thai restaurant.  Wide rice noodles, cooked in some flavorful thai sauce with chicken, vegetables.  Very yummy.  (Although still cannot compare to my favorite place in Seattle xD)   *Herbal Salad - This type of salad was a first for me, especially in a thai restaurant.  It had a myriad of chopped veggies and apples, mixed in with lemon grass and a sweet spicy dressing.  Very refreshing and I promise you will not be disappointed...unless you are allergic to an item. ;-)  Also it is all vegetarian!   *Beef Panang - Very good, but I wished they added some kind of vegetable to it, like string beans or something.    *Curry Fried Rice - amazingly flavorful!  Each bite was a mouthful of curry and I could not stop eating this!   *Pad See Yew - Another great wide flat noodle dish.  Less spicy than Pad Kee Mao but just as or even MORE flavorful.  A must try!    *Green Curry - this was probably the only dish I was not a big fan of.  It was pretty bland, considering everything else was so tasty.  It may be that everything else was too flavorful that it washed out the flavorful of this particular dish....who knows.    I didn't really enjoy the ice cream served at this restaurant.  I wish it was more creamier.  The menu did state that it is home-made.  The thai tea ice cream flavor was there, but should be a bit creamier.    I will definitely be coming back here again!  Hopefully with more friends so I can order even more next time. =D

5qynak3fm4OvSKjXn1Y2iQ.text: We have been coming here for a long time because they have had really good vegetarian options. Lately the taste of their food has been going down. The flavors haven't been good. But more important than that, we went for lunch just now. There were 4 of us and my 15 month old baby for who we did not order anything and we had her snacks she was eating. The service was terrible today. They barely came by and I had to get the attention of the waitress to bring us our bill. When we got the bill I saw a service fee for $8.60. I didnt know what that was for and she said it was automatic gratuity because there are 5 people in our group. We were so pissed. There are no signs anywhere that says gratuity is added on for 5 or more people. The standard for most restaurants is 8 or more people. Moreover, my 15 month old did not order food! And I have never heard of someone counting a baby as a person in the group for purposes of gratuity especially when we didn't even order food for her. And if that is their policy to include a baby for purposes of charging gratuity they should have told us ahead of time. Needless to say we did not add any extra tip and we will never ever go back. This used to be one of our favorite places to eat but that was sleazy I will never ever return. We also cleaned up after our baby's mess from the table and floor from the snacks she was eating so that can't even be an excuse.

jOkn5dmeyThJFist5uEKLg.text: Wish I remembered the servers name.  He was great, very attentive and knowledgeable of menu items.  We ordered the Esan sausage, tamarind cod, chicken panang curry and cup of Tom Kha Soup.  When the sausage plate appetizer arrived, we weren't sure if the lettuce/ginger/cucumber was supposed to be rolled up and eaten like a wrap or everything eaten individually? I tried wrapping it lettuce wrap style and it was good, very flavorful sausage.  The chicken panang curry and tamarind cod come out and I think the cod was the star between the 2.  The cod was crispy and perfectly cooked with a sweet/sour tamarind sauce.  Never had this anywhere before but it was good combination with the other spicy and creamy curry dishes we ordered.  We ended the meal with coconut ice cream with sticky rice.  This was the perfect way to end the meal, not too rich or filling, very light,not too sweet and dairy free!  *portions are generous, menus are heavy!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamarind cod
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Esan sausage
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Kha Soup, the &#34;cup&#34; is huge!

aZuOEQKgcUbY7Yz3SSvH5Q.text: Best Thai food I ever had. Good service and servers. Also great management and owners. 100% satisfaction guarantee. Food is certified. Come see this restaurant.

zcqBqCP-jURnJRdG9m4h4w.text: Excellent thai vegan food......will come again when visiting las vegas.the aroma was so good.food was so tasty and prepared nicely.  Good service. Enjoyed our lunch on chirstmas day:-)

CYW8ZWD7bKQzEbtsrkkAJA.text: This place is HOT STUFF!   Literally.  No, their AC is not broken. It's their food that makes them so hot. You can order your food with a hotness level from 1-10. I usually order Medium at Thai restaurants, but I went with a 3 on this order because I was sharing with my non-spice loving wife. Man, that 3 was hotter than any Medium I've had anywhere. They don't mess around here!  Besides their super hotness, I'm a fan of this place because they have a truly vegan/vegetarian menu. I didn't need to quiz the server about the presence of fish or oyster sauce here. They even have vegan home-made vegan coconut ice cream.  We ordered the Vegetarian Pud Zee Euw (8.95; Stir fried flat rice noodles with broccoli and soy bean sauce w/choice of American or Chinese broccoli) and the Vegetarian Dinner Special  #3 (10.95) which included an appetizer (Spring Roll),  soup (Mushroom Tom Kha) and  Vegetable Pad Thai for the main course. They were all very yummy (and spicy) and among the best Thai food I've had.   Now that I know where this place is, I'll be back, but I have to say that it is not easy to find. It's in a large shopping center, and if you enter on the wrong side, you'll pass dozens of businesses before you find it. The best directions I can provide are: it's kind of in the middle of the commercial center, near a bar.   Pros: Very Veggie friendly with dedicated menu section Great prices Lots of parking Real spiciness Friendly service Entry way is filled with articles and awards (including a letter from Yelp!)  Cons: Location is a little shady and kind of hard to find

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad Thai close up. You can SEE the heat!

xXW1iOxNYx65TRRmR8dZTw.text: I secretly was rooting for this place as it is located in the same lot of Siam though I've never been to either one. However, this place didn't completely met my expectation.  We ordered three items. The tom yum goong was nice and spicy but here's where they went wrong. The beef pad-kee-mao was made with ground meat. Really? I've never had ground meat in any Thai noodle dishes before. It was too much of a short cut. The last dish was a larb salad with mint. Flavors truly delivered in all three dishes I must say. I would still come back to try other dishes without ground meat.

0Wqjw1-Gh8ytc6h_Xf1CCA.text: Authentic Thai food and decent prices.  The neighborhood sucks, but you didn't come here to look out the window.  Service was pretty good.  A few times I had to ask for more water, but the night was busy, and I drink like a fish since I ask for 10/10 thai spicy'ness.  I ordered the pad kapao and pad see ew, both were very good and had tons of flavor, but pretty heavy with the oils.  I am used to eating at Krung Thai now, which is a lot more "clean" vs Komol and Ocha being more "authentic" and oily.  I do prefer Komol's over Ocha if you were wondering.  We also ordered a fried rice, and it was very good.  Next time I come, I will try some Panang Curry since I missed out this run.  Hopefully, you can't go wrong with this place!  Overall, I will definitely be back.  If you are on this side of town and craving great authentic Thai, give this place a shot!

rF9G8kmFDCCQCjm_rJhJhg.text: I was excited to try this place because of the yelp reviews, although we wanted to go to Lotus of Siam. We regret our decision.  The herb salad was the best thing we ordered. Fried catfish was tasty, but tad salty. Duck fried rice was good. The beef massaman was SO sweet ... But it's my first time having that dish so I don't know.  But the biggest disappointment was the soft shell crab... It was EXtremely salty!! So salty, my tongue was stinging. We had to consume so much rice to offset the heavily salted food.   I don't know if they used MSG, but we were so tired after the meal, 4 of us went back to our hotel room and passed out. (Not going out like our original plan. It was Saturday night)  I would not go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef massaman: toooo sweet. Did not like this at all.
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab: the sauce was super salty. My tongue was stinging.
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried catfish w/ garlic sauce. Was tasty. But salty tho.

B4ONwfhkq-sBPHXtwDV-Hg.text: Komol is the overshadowed younger brother of Lotus of Siam. It's just as good, if not better, in my opinion, but doesn't have half of the notoriety--or the crowds, fortunately. It's usually full, but no lines like LoS.  The vegetables are fresh, the spices--especially curry--must be something homemade instead of packaged, because they're distinct and uniquely rich.  We've been known to go here several days a week, because there's so much to try, and we have so many favorites, it really never gets old.  If you like curry, you really MUST try their Panang. It's unreal. Also a consistent hit with us is the Pad See Ew--it must have freshly made noodles, because it's truly addictive.

GSuczQT_uGDtzUl2HWJoZw.text: Really good food! I love how they have vegetarian & vegan options too! I went here with my friend who is vegan so I thought that it was really great that she had so many options that tasted great as well.  The staff was also really great and attentive. They constantly checked on us and refilled our water all the time. It really means something to me when the staff attentive.   I would definitely go back here again!

pPzzj7cDwSUa5chVtAfdLA.text: Average to above average Thai food at reasonable prices, but VERY slow with indifferent service. As best as we could tell, the kitchen was prioritizing making Uber Eats orders over the diners in the restaurant. No Thai food, no matter how good, would have been worth that wait. Spend your time and money elsewhere.

gs5peUX9fR1Dlp2Kve2uoA.text: A regular stop when we're in Las Vegas!  Located in the bizarre "Commerical Center" off Sahara, a sprawling huge parking lot with restaurants, odd businesses, strange clubs and an occasional crack dealer and homeless guy with no shirt and a shopping cart stumbling around, we've come to love our dining experiences at Komol.  It's a friendly, family run place and we've had no big problems with the service like another recent reviewer.  Once seated you're presented with a heavy wooden menu! It weighs like 3 pounds!  They have great vegan options including soups, salads and wok-made dishes of all varieties, and a great portion of brown rice if you order it.  On a recent visit we requested that all of our dishes be prepared with as little oil as possible--but things were still on the oily side, especially our eggplant with black bean sauce dish which was positively greasy. It's almost as if the chef did the opposite of our request.   So, I'm deducting one star--I'm simply not a fan of lots of oil and grease in Asian food.  Bye for now; we'll see you on our next trip!

3Qg_O_FVchscJjFdFc8tNQ.text: I swore the last couple times I've been here I said to myself never again. Komol used to be my favorite Thai Restaurant in town at one time. They used to deliver to my work, so I ate their food frequently. The last few times I've been there I have noticed the food isn't as good as it used to be.   We went there last night, had a reservation, when we arrived the employees were running around like crazy. The place was busy, but not anything crazier than I've seen it before.   We are seated and wait for awhile for someone to take our orders. She finally comes and we are both famished. Had we known what was about to transpire, we would've ordered our entrees. So we eat our salad, and she comes to take out entree order. We waited ONE HOUR for our food to arrive. I was so hungry I was close to walking out. Then, my entree arrives. Mine only. The waitress leaves the table. Doesn't say a word about my friends dish. I sit patiently staring at my food. We call her over to see what's going on and she says "it will be out soon". So I'm sitting there patiently for my friends food to arrive, where I come from it's rude to eat without everyone having their entree. Ten minutes later it arrives. My Pad Kee Mao was less than stellar. I ate the shrimp out of it and left everything else. Needless to say, I won't be going back.

dOjrnD4awsFsuRdeKbh01w.text: Great food, big portions and awesome service.  I was thinking vegetarian and this place popped up. Tasty curries with generous amounts of it.  Panang curry with soy chicken.   Gorgeous assortment of great textured veggies with a smooth zesty curry. Their brown rice has a purple grain mixed in for more delicious nutty flavor and beautiful color.   Loved this place and will be back

stPD_6nidk9iQVRSk0wx9w.text: Komol is the shiz! Tofu chili mint (extra crispy) is my go-to. Additionally the vegetarian platter, veggie chow mein, salad with peanut sauce and tofu-vegetable soup are also great. The food is a 5 and when Dutch is there, the service is too.  I knocked off a star because if you go on a Friday of Saturday, plan on waiting.....and waiting....and waiting. You will wait to be seated and then wait to get your food...and not necessarily in the order you placed it. At any rate, the food is always fresh and delicious and if you are a vegetarian, they will be mindful to not cook your food with oyster sauce or in the same cookware they use for the "other stuff." Bon apetite'!

1MzPyof-Hy7hmiKE7aQu0Q.text: This is my favorite restaurant in town.  I love the vegetarian menu and have tried most of what is on it.  Everything thus far has been wonderful.  My absolute favorite though is the mushroom tom yum soup!  On top of the super amazing food, the service here is always incredible.

wS0gunNIxM-WIkssNyF32Q.text: Food: I'm very glad this place's menu has a multitude of vegetarian options. The options are even available with soy meat. Started off with fried wontons. I mistook the fried wontons as being the cream cheese stuffed ones, but I was wrong. My first couple wontons didn't even have a filling so it was just friend wonton wrapper, but on the third one, I noticed something like chicken inside. Whoops. Then I had the shrimp pad thai at the "Thai Spicy" level which is their hottest level. The heat intensity was good but could've been hotter (I really like spicy food). I liked that the chili didn't detract from the flavor of the pad thai. But unfortunately, my shrimp was under seasoned and both the shrimp and noodles were overcooked. Noodles should have a little past al-dente consistency, but these noodles were rubbery and sticky.   Service: Granted I was there for a birthday party and there were 12 people on our table. . .but service was slow. Our waiter left a pitcher of water on our table and it showed just how they rarely came around. Once we'd ordered, it took a good 20+ minutes to get our food out. When the food came out, it was ticket by ticket since the check was split. One side of the table got food before everyone else. I ended up waiting at least 10 minutes after everyone else until my food was served. In Komol's defense, another person at our table didn't get her food until way after me so Komol comped her dish because it took so long. We kept asking for additional sake cups. It wasn't until our third request that we actually got them.   Overall: Service could've been better and I've had way spicier and better Thai food. I would go back to try their vegetarian options, but there are better options available in Las Vegas.

vWrXbsVNpsWNshrKWvAVwg.text: Beat Thai food ever!! Friends in Vegas took us for dinner and we enjoyed everything we had. Deff one of the beat hall in the wall place I've ever been to! Good service and deff can taste all the flavors in the food

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VyQyYxE810ENCyhNoyfSMQ.text: I've been eating at Komols for years now and I'm finally getting around to writing a review. It obviously goes without saying it must be great Thai food if I've been returning for years. This week alone I picked up a Togo order on Wednesday and dined in on Saturday.    Today I rolled into Komols at 11am. That's when they open and they close at 10pm nightly. I started off with fresh spring rolls which are served with a peanut sauce and a sweet and sour sauce. Delicious. Next we had the Thai herbal salad which is spectacular and to die for. It has shredded apple, lemon grass, red onion, fried tofu, cashews, green onion, basil, carrots, and coconut with a hot pepper and lime juice sauce. Highly, highly recommend giving it a go. For the entree we ordered Pad-Kee-Mao which is a stir fried flat rice noodle dish with garlic, chili, tofu and basil leaves. Today I was in a spicy mood and ordered everything a 7 out of 10. I also order all my items off the vegan portion of the menu, which means they only use soy bean sauce, organic sugar, vegetable oil and spicy seasoning herbs. No meat, no dairy.  That's just my preference they also have a full carnivores menu as well.    The decor is classic Thai style and you can tell they've served countless satisfied customers since opening up shop in 1986.   The help has always been friendly and attentive. Even when they're slammed with customers the food still arrives in a reasonable amount of time.   If you stop in and see me chowing down throw me a high five and prepare to enjoy a great authentic Thai food meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Spring Rolls
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spice tray

ABbopWg4gewLhcFvBCXQqQ.text: Amazing experience! Looks a little sketchy from the outside but don't let this deter you from coming on in. The menu is very robust and has a ton of options, veg and non veg. We had the tum kha chicken soup (which was amazing), a lemongrass salad and chicken pad that with medium spice - it was the perfect amount of flavor and spice too. Highly recommend coming to Komol

3eEgwl9_bbbvkS-c5GAHKQ.text: Their food is good, but shame this restaurant tried to rip us off, they charged us way more for the food - about 20$ different. I asked for the recipt, and they brought me one that was whitened over- because they changed the prices, and even then the totals didn't add up. They kept calling it a mistake, even though they were definitely deliberate in trying to cheat us. Don't go to this place, and if you do, keep track of the prices. Maybe they thought they could get away with it because we were tourists.

a8GnMxAjitJ71Tp0Wpse7w.text: Went here twice. The tom yum is delicious and the tom kha has a burst of flavors! My whole family went back just for their penang curry!

If5fP_0z7bgZk8CTdprzSQ.text: Had lunch today with friend and thoroughly enjoyed our lunch. Service was fast and friendly.  Had the lunch special that starts at $6.50. Includes salad egg roll and main dish.  I had the chicken pad Thai. So good.   I'll definitely be going back.   Just about 10 minutes from where I live.

sV7gbjWjZwZWzRkYUUunug.text: This is the Best Thai Restaurant in town!!   We started with herbal salad followed by Penang Curry and Pad kee Moa.  Medium spicy was perfect. Yummy yummy ! Do not missed homemade coconut ice cream  at the end  Sooooooo good ...!  Thank you Komol for "Great food great service." We will  be back Komol  .

Uk8VOsRsHR4PwD6JcWnutQ.text: We came here for a vegan anniversary dinner on 4th of July since it was one of the very few restaurants around Vegas that were open, plus we were excited to try a new Thai place that had a specific menu for vegetarians and vegans!   We were able to make a reservation easily over the phone and as soon as we got there, were seated right away. The menu is pretty huge so be prepared!   We decided to go for the Vegetarian Thai Style Fried Rice, a cup of the Tom Ka, The Chef Special "Curry" and the Combination Appetizer, with an order of Thai iced coffee (they use non dairy creamer btw!).   Food came out pretty fast, except the soup didn't come towards the end of the meal and to make up for the wait, they were nice enough to upgrade my cup into a whole bowl which I really appreciated.  Service was fast and the servers were very attentive in refilling waters and attending to your needs.   FOOD: -Vegetarian Fried Brown Rice - 1/5 this was way too sweet but to be fair, the server did warn us that it would but we figured that the spiciness level would mask the taste of the tomato sauce that is literally all over the rice. We had to ask for some hot sauce since it didn't have any spice in it at all but at the end we decided it wasn't worth eating.  -Tom Ka - 5/5 this was my favorite out of everything we ate and I wish it didn't come at the end of the meal when I was already stuffed but I'm glad I got to take a whole bowl home! It had the perfect amount of spice and veggies.   -Chef Special Curry - 4/5 this was my bf's favorite dish and it was definitely the level of spice we were expecting. The server did warn us that it isn't an actual curry and it's more of a dry dish but it was great regardless!   -Combination Appetizer - 4/5 I really enjoyed this because you basically get a variety of fried spinach, sweet potatoes, eggplant, spring rolls, and tofu to dip in some yummy sauce. It was a very filling appetizer for 2 people.  Overall had a good experience and it's in the same square as the famous Lotus Of Siam but I would definitely try this place if you're not looking to wait in line over there and still enjoy some good Thai food!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom ka soup with mushroom, veggies and tofu
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian fried rice Thai style
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s special curry

84xPOSzi0U_ecef2iEOHPg.text: UPDATE   I decided to come back. What a bad decision. Food was just as bad saw a Roach and here's the kicker I spent $50 ordered 4 dishes and they would only give me 4 hot sauce. When I asked for me she said flat out no. What the heck it's unlimited on the tables. Absolute ridiculous. I have a lot of vegan friends and belong to multiple vegan groups I have told them to never go back plus with the addition of GOOD VEGAN Thai food popping up all over Vegas there's no need to ever go back. See ya komol. Taking bets on when you close down.   I miss the old komol :( I live 45 min away and have consistently gone at least 2-3x a month for years. Because it's so good especially being a vegetarian but it's going downhill fast. I heard about the roach incident and then being shut down so I simply asked to see their latest inspection grade card before eating there and they gave major attitude. Um sorry I wasn't the one with roaches in the kitchen.   The veggies themselves has like no sauce. And we're half the size they used to be. Barely even half a plate full.   The pad Thai just seems cheap. No peanuts little flavor  The tom yum used to be my favorite but today it was so bad it tasted like unflavored mushrooms in water no thai spice or flavor at all.   So dissatisfied and upset. I want my old komol back :(:

7KVEFbeOBzurPRpE5XAweA.text: I finally managed to try the oldest Thai restaurant in the Sahara Commercial Center. It didn't live up to its standards.  Komol is one of three Thai restaurants within a hop, skip, and a jump of each other, and it's almost certainly been around since before I was born. It's also the last of the three-headed beast of beloved, dare-I-say hyped Thai restaurants that I had to try. So I stopped in to try a lunch special today. It does seem like the decor could be from an older time, but it's still clean and has friendly waitstaff. It's fairly brightly lit and the atmosphere was relatively quiet when I dined in.  I chose the panang curry lunch special ($7.95) with beef, owing to recommendations from Yelp friends and the server's answer to my inquiry on which dishes were the most popular. They first brought out an egg roll w/ sweet & sour sauce and horseradish, and my choice of side in the egg drop soup. Both were good but not particularly impressive, and I found myself having to add salt to the soup.  The curry came out, and it was oddly... not high in temperature. Mostly warm, to be sure, but I  usually expect it to be painful to the touch, you know? This was perhaps an ominous sign. The curry was pretty good, but it wasn't as impressive in flavor as others that I've had, and I was surprised that the "mild" level of spiciness was a 1 or maybe 1.5 at best. I will say that the meat portion was very generous, although it was a fairly generic cut of beef. The veggies were fine but not spectacular and not as abundant as you'd expect from a place that specializes in vegetarian cuisine. My biggest gripe at mealtime was that the rice had a few grains that were hard (read: tough to chew, as opposed to uncooked).  The problem that I had later that afternoon was stomach pain. I didn't have an issue that required me to visit a restroom, but I'd give it a 3 or 4 out of 10, if 10 is the most tortured my intestines have ever been. I'm sure this was caused by Komol because it was my first meal in 16 hours, and that whole temperature issue was a tip-off.  I may give Komol another chance, but I'm not sure why I should be so generous with so many other great Thai restaurants in town, some of which are just a short stroll away.. My intestinal fortitude is the only reason that I haven't dropped the rating further, and if I'd had to drag myself to the toilet... you know the punchline.

Du8qY2T_Htgvbilc0yluqw.text: There was alot of vegetarian options, however everything was bland.  I ordered fried wontons which came out with no filling. Wish I had known prior to ordering. She ended up comping us. We also ordered a rice and soup.

nh1MjbEVNjKT9q2AYOydtg.text: Komol is authentic and delicious! Fantastic service and extensive menu. We had and highly recommend the Tom Ka Kai and duck with sticky rice. This is our first time here in Vegas but love the Thai ambiance and energy. We will be back. Feng and the other staff were attentive and kind.

vUqSzzkeY165hy0gTOMgQA.text: The food was alright, not the greatest. What really ruined my experience was the service and customer service. The waitress named Feng was so rude to my friends and I. We asked for separate checks (which isn't that hard to do); we had to ask her 2-3 times to split our checks and she didn't seem to understand it. She got so frustrated with us she cursed at us "Oh, shit". To top it off she messed up our orders and did not hesitate to express her frustration with us. I started off my order with an appetizer and before I could finish she quickly interrupted and said "Is that all you want?". Thanks to Feng, we will not be coming back here and won't be recommending it to anyone.

t5s2247kgry4HDFXrj8Hyg.text: Went with a large group of people. The staff was very accommodating and polite although a bit disorganized when it came to trying to figure out who ordered what.  The food came out pretty quick and surprisingly nearly all at the same time considering how much we ordered. Everyone seemed happy with their choices. My favorites of the night were the chicken lad-na and the thai tea. Maybe not the cheapest when it comes to thai food, but the flavor and serving size were worth the price.

ESxS37xXzHg8gpmRmh7utA.text: A great spot to have some authentic tasting cuisine. We stopped in for a quick snack and drinks. It was a hard day at the spa around the corner and we needed to energize a bit. The servers were so friendly and happy. The place was full with the lunch crowd. The menu had great vegan choices too. The food had great presentation and was very flavorful. The ingredients were fresh. Great prices and wonderful service.

8iu5I_ZkAeKvemWZkA97Lg.text: Best Mongolian Beef in the valley, good service too, high quality food and a great variety

yog8l3y88OrZX237vEf0LQ.text: Excellent taste, food, service and flavors with healthy size portions. Recommended.

-bjwJwRawN3ODu8enK1XiA.text: I don't even care how good the food is, because i have waited 30 mins for a pork curry, this place at most is getting a 3 star from me...  I mean seriously?  30 mins for a chicken curry, i cannot believe with this amount of reviews and traffic, with this kind of speed...    I was excited to try this place because my wife said it has the best curry, but i will never waste 30 mins waiting for a curry... unbelievable  Okay, i just got my order and the curry i ordered and it does not look like curry at all... chefs curry looks like the picture i uploaded.    Service was horrible, i asked the waitress i have been waiting for 40 mins can you check whats going on, she started showing terrible attitude, while it was 100% the restaurants fault for letting customer wait 40+ minutes while it wasn't even that busy.  Never come back and be warned to waste 30+ time.

KaRrAqxCzYBvFOfNwI5EWQ.text: I use to like this place.  And been taking guest there all time.  Last time I was there we order vegetarian and we found chicken skin in there   As well as they charge me the tip without telling me and try to double charge me for that.

tvr3c6rFh0EaLcYdvAi_aQ.text: Was craving for Thai in Vegas and found this place through Yelp. Reviews seemed decent so decided to give it a try!  Not having been here before, this restaurant was a bit hard to find as it is located inside this large empty strip mall/plaza. The types of surrounding stores were sort of random so circling for awhile until the restaurant was finally spotted - yay!  It was mid afternoon by the time we got here so the place wasn't too crowded. A few of us ordered the green papaya salad, chicken green curry and fried combination noodles.   Everything was extremely flavorful and absolutely delicious! Will have to return for more next time when I am in town!

Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried combo noodle
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green papaya salad - so good!

WuSLWdAVPDj4mG8YlkMAag.text: Komol is one of my favorite little mom 'n pop restaurants in Vegas! Though I live in Henderson, I'm occasionally compelled to travel halfway across the valley and get my fix of  their Tofu Chili & Mint. It's the best you'll find anywhere... and good with gluten instead too.  The atmosphere is a very relaxed, hole-in-the-wall kind of vibe and the servers are very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. As for the decor, it's your typical low-budget restaurant feel: pink booths, artificial flowers and Thai tchotchies everywhere. Charming and comfortable but not fancy by any stretch of the imagination.  There's an extensive vegetarian menu, and I've been told that their veggie dishes are all cooked separately from the meaty ones (separate oils for the fried items etc.). Everything I've had here has been delicious, but I especially liked the tofu skewers w/peanut sauce and the panang curry.  Give Komol a try. You won't be disappointed.

OoYW3z9A9Sc7F53Jdn4KYA.text: The food here is amazingly delicious. Truly authentic Thai dishes. The best Thai restaurant I've ever been to and I've been to a lot. Excellent customer service. The restaurant is extremely clean. The waitress are as hot as their food.

MNcYdTBB6RAnI-FCe7-HDQ.text: Excellent customer service. All the servers were very attentive and prompt. They have authentic Thai drinks like green soda. The green curry had the right heat to it and the Pad Thai was perfectly flavored. The portions seemed smaller than other Thai restaurants, but the price was right. The best plus is that they serve vegan vegetarian dishes.

R7eNUAaYprCaGe0254dTmg.text: I love this place! I have been to Thailand so I know what real Thai food tastes like. This place is owned by 2 brothers and they are so nice. The food is great. I love the wor wonton soup, thai beef salad, papaya salad, chicken, pork and beef satay, pad-thai, fried fish with chili mint sauce, and for dessert they have this homemade coconut icecream! I live in Texas now and I cannot find a place that matches up to this restaurant. When I go back to Vegas to visit, this will be the first place I eat at.

_nnepF-qBBZYg3YrThewcg.text: We usually go to Lotus of Siam - in the same seedy center.  Don't let the outside fool you.  Both places offer great Thai food.  I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food at Komol.  Everything was great - we started with the coconut soup.  We also had the spring rolls.  Great appetizers.  Main courses we selected was a seafood curry dish and the basil, chicken fried rice.  Both dishes were really good.  When in Vegas - a place to go.

sg7FTMwuHCXMIhYG0G6jag.text: Komol is a very good Thai restaurant in a not so good strip mall but dont let that detour you. I walked in and was greated and seated promptly. The decor of the restaurant is nice. Now for the food i ordered chicken satay which was very good and also got the Masaman Curry. He asked how hot i wanted my curry  and i told him not to hot so he said medium. When i got the curry the flavor was so good but unbearablely HOT! I really couldnt believe this was a medium, i have ordered HOT before from Thai restaurants and it wasent even half the spicyness of this. It was really hard to eat the whole dish because of the hotness. i highly suggest you get mild when ordereing if not it will take away the flavor from the dish

Ofxa0Tz5RC2DnNMfZbroAg.text: The food was amazing! Unfortunately, I came there after a night of drinking and had a small appetite. I really want to try lotus of siam, but they were closed.

bYvAlQ-ozSFPhALJv1gO7g.text: This restaurant is absolutely the best place for Thai food in Las Vegas period! I live in Vegas so I know. The Chicken Panang ordered spicy is sooo good, my gf loves it. I have never tasted shrimp fried rice this delicious, the Chicken Chili Mint, Pa Se Ew, and Pat-tie are excellent as well. For desert the Mango Sticky rice is perfect. I have taken my friends there so often now, that we've become regulars and all of them loved it too. The environment is nice and quite, the service is fast friendly and with a REAL smile. Everyone who loves Thai food needs to stop by and experience bliss.

z4c14huF34sL7uwdL4TATw.text: Came here with my brother, shared the pad thai, Penang curry, chili mint chicken. Delicious all! Tremendous selection, hope to come back sometime.

J-z9VYlLo4ehl6akO12OoQ.text: Fantastic experience here. Very friendly waiter. No MSG in their food, which is huge to me. It does not need it, anyway. We had the green curry and it was great. Also ordered the Herbal Salad, which was recommended here by several yelp'ers. It was very lemongrass-y, which was good for a few bites, but I could not eat a whole plate of it. My husband had no problem eating a good deal of it, though. The coconut milk curry was great. We also ordered the mango with sticky rice dessert, as well as the fried banana with homemade coconut ice cream. The ice cream is to die for. best I've had in a while-- and homemade! :)  Mango sticky rice was wonderful, too, and I haven';t found many places that make it with coconut milk only instead of sweetened condensed milk. So happy to find a vegan version!

Yw54TOrtByxKE9O8NC2V6Q.text: Wife wanted to try this place, it has many good reviews and we eat Thai fairly often!!  Overall good food, at a good price.  One thing I really enjoy while eating Thai food is sticky rice!!  And when I tried to order some, they said they were out????  I nearly LOL, because I guess I just couldn't imagine a restaurant saying they don't have something that is super common, not available?  Either way, I got over it and ate with "regular rice" which was fine....I had the panang chicken curry which was good, i usually get yellow chicken curry but my wife pushed me outside the box, and I tried the red.  I would go back here, service was good, although we ate around 5pm on a weeknight and we were the only ones there.

1OBcrGPFwqBL-WkwqZ9DQg.text: Love this place! First came here in 1996. It's vegan friendly and oh so good. Last night I had the amazing papaya salad and fresh spring rolls. The rolls were mintier than I've had before, but still delicious. I had dinner #3 which came with a tasty fried roll, coconut soup with mushrooms and a garlicky oil on top (forgot the Thai name) and pad thai. Delicious except that the pad thai was too spicy even though I requested mild. It's the first time I've ever had spicy pad thai. The service was fast and friendly. I will go back for one of their awesome lunch specials.

51AH0ZY8Nf79VNObA_MQwQ.text: Delicious food, great service, reasonably priced and generous portions

nxZG75-z_c7aFEYaXO9CxQ.text: Great food, excellent atmosphere. Weird shopping center, but once you've found it, you'll know. Great stuff!

d6lqQMbGGz5mzcVvphKvlg.text: We came here because lotus of Siam was packed and couldnt get a sit. We went to Komol as a second option and we were glad we found this place !! The service was awesome, we had the beef panang and the mint chicken and both were great!!! The quantity was great for the price and I will definitely come back!

PJovpQD0fcfRqW3eFSwmNg.text: Extremely authentic. My wife is Thai and she's hard to please as far as Thai food goes. Been everywhere in Vegas: Archi's, Kung Fu, Ping Kaow (all locations), ping pong, lotus of Siam, Thai BBQ (lol), noodle house, Satay, Le Thai, Weera, you name it. This place finally got a good review out of her. I'm easy to please but I will admit I do taste a huge difference from place to place and I wondered why. Now I know. Alot of places "Americanize" and stream line for easier production. Not naming names "cough cough Pingkaow" but some places actually use Ketchup in place of tamarind in pad Thai. Large menu with authentic Thai staples other places don't offer. I find it crazy some places don't offer Nam-sod with crispy rice. Clean restaurant despite location. Prices are fair and portions are just right. If you're in the mood for Thai and you're just visiting, it's 10 minutes off the strip. You won't regret it.

_yjSaLWYkgh9hEex7stPRw.text: We ended up coming here when we couldn't get a table at Lotus of Siam (which is infinitely better)  I ordered the chili mint chicken, boyfriend ordered a soup, and my friend ordered pad thai.  My chili mint chicken was okay, the soup severely lacked flavor, and the pad thai was just okay. The food was forgettable, at best.   Service was slow and our server was impatient and rude.  I see no reason to return.

DiPXLEb6p7ojc93k_05ivQ.text: Fresh, delicious food.  Friendly service. Reasonable prices.  Nice decor - seemed like a pleasant oasis.

qo75EnuzHRUT1S9Zl4jEyA.text: Vegas is not the best place for a delicious Vegan meal but I make sure to stop at Komol for their delicious Vegan Panang dish every time i'm in town. Komol is in a sketchy looking shopping center off the beaten path but don't be scurred, the place is clean, the wait staff is super friendly, and the food is fantastic. A must stop next time you're in Vegas gambling your hard earned cash!

gU9koyzV8Kff33K56brMQQ.text: I love Komol! It is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. The vegetarian selection is one of the largest in the city, and they have a wide variety of mock foods, such as mock duck, fish, pork, chicken, and beef. Having such a large selection of menu items to choose from means a lot to me, and the fact that they are extremely tasty and well-prepared dishes means that this restaurant has earned itself a loyal customer for life.  Overall, the food is delicious and I love the atmosphere. They've been in the process of over-hauling the decor, so it looks better and better every time I go there. I enjoy taking friends and family to Komol, because I know we'll get a great vegetarian meal and friendly service each time.

hf8RFVwVi5BFHj3iyr-Q4w.text: If you're a vegetarian and love spicy food this is your place. They have vegetarian versions of dishes usually not found elsewhere: Tom Kha soup and Orange Tofu and  Tofu Satay! They can turn up the heat too! 8 star was just right heat for me. 10 star was really hot! Tom kha is quite good. Orange Tofu was phenomenal with crispy exterior and soft inside. We got it 10* and it was sweet and spicy at same time. Herbal Salad is a unique salad I've never found at any other Thai restaurant. It has green apples, cashews and variety of herbs and spices. Got it 8* and it was a taste explosion in every bite! I've never seen Tofu Satay elsewhere and it's very good with delicious peanut dipping sauce. Dishes found everywhere such as vegetable panang and Tofu chili mint were good but not exceptional. My Tip: Try vegetarian dishes here that you can't find anywhere else- they are exceptional.

XdkKvThgaxmAEcmstg1s0w.text: I love this place! I've been coming here for years! I love the Chicken Chili mint and the thai beef salad! Service is always excellent every time I go!

Deyq5qpt9lhvRGdJ8VqoQA.text: Gonna keep it real. Went here because lotus was packed. In its own right, this place was busy too.  Really good tofu pad thai. I'd come back for it.   I gotta try more of the menu when I get back.

RWMyTtBgb7HU73tNxGy2-A.text: This place is authentic and delicious. It's hidden and hard to find but you need to find it! The service is wonderful and the food is delicious and very well priced. You NEED to come try this out for the best Thai food around!

dgFGd2jtIQwujZbr9fVcoQ.text: Best Thai restaurant ever. Umpteen lunch specials. Very authentic, speedy service. They know their customers. The best!!

gt0FbvovBngAGljX4hdlXg.text: We went there for dinner on 4th July. There were around 5 tables. It took 1.5 hour to get food served from the time we got seated, and 2 hours overall. We missed the fireworks :( We had to hunt down the waitress to take our orders or bring the check. The check never came, we went to the front desk to pay. Perhaps they did not have their regular folks working that night.  The food, which took so long to prepare, came out with extreme spiciness, while we all requested medium. I did not have patience anymore, we left.   Location for the restaurant was creepy as well.   We went there after seeing 5 star reviews on yelp and were horribly disappointing. Either is was a bad day for the restaurant or these reviews are all fake. Never going back, I've seen better.

8Fh56q6BSDCGrzR1DTMXDw.text: I came here because it was recommended by a friend who visits Las Vegas often. I had the chef's special vegetarian curry and it was excellent, with a nice blend of herbs and spices. They have one of the longest vegetarian and vegan menus I've ever seen, but there are also plenty of dishes for carnivores. It's a hidden gem in a mostly vacant shopping center, located less than a mile from the Las Vegas strip.

dam3t6h2JJ6piD1YjYsa2A.text: I keep coming back here and let me tell you - vegetarian or not, you MUST order the herbal salad!  Apple, carrot, coconut, cashews, basil, crispy tofu, lemongrass, and a spicy lime dressing....omg!!!  Sooo good I drove over here, got one to go, and ate it while stuck in traffic driving back to Henderson!  There has been talk lately of a lack of massaman in town, but it is great here and I have had it every time!  Last time I took friends from Texas and ran into Sangeetha I.!  I am heading back there this weekend with a couple where the husband is Thai and he swears by this place too.  Trust me, we will be ordering the herbal salad!

QQ0sUu8RCtIFTmrI0LLfaA.text: This place is IMPOSSIBLE to find. I drove up and down sahara and they give horrible directions when you call them.  Anyway, I ordered the Chow Mein with flat noodles and it was mediocre to say the least. It had a sight garlic flavor, but other than that NOTHING. Very disappointed because it was super greasy. By far not one of the best places I've been to.  I also got the eggrolls & they had no flavor either.. the plum sauce was horrible with it.   Didn't hate this place, but I probably won't ever be going back.

IF-do6k0i1pRuJ8CVM0WCg.text: We originally had planned to go to Lotus of Siam and was told 30 min wait so we went over to Komol and boy are we glad we did. Every dish we ordered was delicious!  We had the Tom Yum soup, the papaya salad, panang curry, steamed cod, and the pad seow. They didn't charge for rice which was a plus!  And different from typical Thai is that it was not overly salty. This will have to be our regular place to come every time we visit LV.

0LwfyBtvfYk-a3GZsR6P7A.text: Great options for vegetarians. Its a couple minutes drive off of the strip and the mall is pretty sketch IMO. The people working there are quite nice and a large selection to choose from. The portions are pretty big so it definitely filled us up.  Free parking at the lot and it is really empty during lunch hours on weekends. (I've only been there on the weekend).

E_jUI0m8DIeSTkHuEDudFA.text: Food is good, interior is little aged, menu is a wood block, containers are nice looking.

-sv5ajYUVQi23KPDDjFxMA.text: This place has the best Thai food I've ever had. My husband and I have been coming here for about 10 years. The staff is so nice. At this point they know what we want to eat and ask how our kids are doing. I fell at home here. BEST FOOD EVER! we are vegetarian and they have everything Vegi even Vegi shrimp YUMMY!!!
