opTFlR6o7uZmMwfBz67OKA.text: Decent Thai Food. But not as good as several others in the center. However, if you're a vegetarian and on a budget, you just might fall in love with this place!

R4VvgzBhEq_Gb5XBDWTz3g.text: The soft shell crab and green curry is a must get. The mango with sticky rice is a good dessert to top off your meal. This is the best Thai restaurant in town, much better than Lotus of Siam.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sPr1UvSNDs89VYdA_bpLRQ.text: I've been here well over a dozen times and everything has always been outstanding. The food is delicious (love the Pad Thai and Pad See Ew) and the vegan options are fantastic! Great vegetarian starters, especially the veggie platter. The service is great, and the staff is attentive. Highly recommend!

LeNVDhd8ziK2uyKtKoY7bg.text: This place is amazing!! We come from Atlanta and the first thing we do is cone here for dinner. Vegetable fried rice is off the chain. Service is always consistent and pleasant.

1WutCW55Ueem7jLARZ1Iqg.text: This restaurant is a little off the beaten track but well worth the drive. It's located in the middle building of a large older mall and cannot be seen from the street. The decor is peaceful along with the atmosphere. I hate this saying but the food is to die for. Don't miss this gem if you're in the mood for Thai

pRrP9slKyaPKZb35k3iLlA.text: Herbal salad was a great explosion to the taste buds.  Lots of flavour.  Hidden from the main strip but well worth the trip.  The mall is a bit worn out from the outside but don't let that deter you   You won't be disappointed.

rMMchbUWxz8BUMC5JhfZ6Q.text: Another terrific evening at our stand-by go to place. Excellent food, proper service, inexpensive . I've seen many people and places come and go. Komol is a standard, always consistent, very satisfying. A standard that's hard to find in Vegas. I'm very Grateful!

GEfdIXrMpxdQ7HNJzV6pjA.text: This is my favorite place for Thai food.  It's a family owned business and everyone there is really nice. They have an extensive menu, cater to vegetarians, and you get more than what you paid for!   Worth a try: Thai beef salad - lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and cuts of beef with a spicy/sweet/sour dressing that plays around in your mouth.   Chicken pad thai - noodles, bean sprouts, and more than enough chicken! Usually when I get this, I finish all the noodles before the chicken. That's when you know it's a lot! And they don't use that weird oily orange sauce I've seen at other restaurants. It's my favorite dish to get!    Panang curry - I was never a fan of curry until I tried this. The coconut curry taste isn't overpowering and they add just enough spice to compliment the other flavors. (I love taking the panang curry sauce and putting it over my pad thai noodles, a little unorthodox, but it tastes amazing!)  Thai tea is also pretty legit. It doesn't taste powder and it comes in a tall, slender glass with cream layered on the top. It's a tasty treat before you get your food.   *lunch is from 11-2:30 and it comes with soup/salad and egg rolls. The amount of food is definitely NOT lunch sized, I had plenty of food left to take home.  *if you're ever trying to cut carbs, try the papaya pad thai! It's almost like the real thing! Papaya is used in place of the noodles and it is great! I could barely tell the difference!   *their spice level isn't really up to Thai standards... I usually get their dishes around a 7-9 and I don't even break a sweat (and my spice tolerance isn't that high). So if you can take the heat, go for a 10!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken panang &amp; combination Pad Thai

8-mcQQgfIT8XUTgsNIEy8w.text: I love this place! The foods we ordered were delish and i think this is the best thai food so far i have been in las vegas. The garlic crab was so good! Also the herb salad was amazing too.. the only downside was the foods all were really spicy. Next time we should ordered medium spicy. Other thing that we need to pay attention is the bill... they add the tip on the bill without telling us, they did wrote on the check however it's unreadable and very not clear.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xbcza5lJpCOG0G3KftC6Cw.text: My boyfriend and I decided to come here once he saw the reviews on this place and it was everything the ratings and reviews made it out to be. He got the Green Curry Rice with Chicken and I had the Garlic Fried Rice with chicken. He rated his a 4.7 and we both rated mine a 5. It's a great place and a great experience. They deserve the 5 we both have them!

-Idr84VNx6Y68Q4Vl4POZQ.text: Komol is awesome.  Thai food is one of my favorites and I have tried most of the restaurants in town (including Lotus, which is good, but not as good) and I always come back to Komol.  No bland Americanized Thai food here, if you ask for spicy you better be ready for it.  In fact, just writing about it is making me salivate I'm going to go get some drunken noodles right now.

4xO8AzuIHQwUnpEVBnD92A.text: The food was delicious,atmosphere was very nice and relaxing, the servers were friendly. The food portions were small to me compared to most Asian restaurants.

fCU6R4B0ekWe8O-LaOk5xw.text: Given its proximity to Lotus of Siam, I'm shocked that I'd never heard of Komol before (add to that the absurdity of trying to get a reservation at Lotus) and am beyond elated that I've discovered this place. The cuisine at Komol is classic Southern Thai and boasts some of the most unique blends of sweet and spice.  Although I've yet to dine at Lotus, I can't imagine it could be worth such a wait when Komol is as tasty as it is and trumps all the Thai I've had all over town.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand-carved, wooden menus!

f8StV-e-knJDVa60Ef3-Lw.text: Not our favorite. We were disappointed at their spice level . Got an 8 on 10 and it tasted like it was 4 . The restaurant is not super clean , service is mediocre. The presentation of the food was good but it seriously lacked the taste we were expecting. I don't think we would go there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rWifiTu1Nb3zF1tMauyBxQ.text: This place is amazing. For me is the best place in Vegas for Thai food. Even when I go back to L.A I take food to go. They also have great customer service. Thank you!!!

WjMsuf94M6x4nfWZzcA2Vg.text: Great food -- truly spicy if you want it (many other Thai restaurants are afraid to make it spicy because they're worried us gringos can't handle it).  One of the pleasant surprises was that the person who answered the phone & took my order-to-go information spoke perfect English, which reassured me that my order would be understood over the phone.   Now, the location is... both fascinating & creepy.   I was there at about 4:30PM on a Saturday, and the massive strip-mall was mostly devoid of life, save for a few areas.  Made sense once I saw that many of the strip mall storefronts looked abandoned.   Entering the mall area off of Charleston Ave, Komol is on the far side, and strangely, it's right next door to another Thai (/Chinese) restaurant!    If you're the type that gets nervous in 'ghetto' areas, you'll certainly want to avoid Komol at night.   As for me, I am extremely curious as to what that mall looks like at night.    The food was good, but I get Thai food a couple times a month & am continuing to try new places to find one that really stands out above the rest.   I certainly will be happy to order from Komol again if I'm in the area & wanting Thai food, but in terms of flavor & value, the items that I had didn't stand-out above most other Thai restaurants in the LV & Henderson areas that I've tried.

sCxME_je5nKvxpcmuHvSww.text: Was invited to this restaurant by a friend who lives in town. The only way to find the BEST eateries is by asking the locals.   Restaurant is located in a strip mall with plenty of parking. Was seated promptly by courteous staff.   The food here was AMAZING! I look forward to me next Vegas trip so that I can savor these amazing dishes once again!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rWELcuVJKiwzdksJXD6pqw.text: Nothing exceptional about the place. I ordered two vegetarian dishes: green curry fried rice and kang pad red curry. Fried rice was very dry and salty. Red curry was average too, no taste other than saltiness and hotness. I dropped my plan to order a desert here. I would rate Le Thai in downtown Vegas much better over this.

OCq8u2orMOcT1wx5-iAWuw.text: My first time here, cause the bf loves Thai food. This is the second Thai restaurant we've been to since our vacation in Vegas. Tried their Tom Kha soup with fried tofu and it was great! Love it cause it has the authentic taste. Also, ordered this fried corn appetizer but wasn't as tasty so I ordered another dish. Got their saute Chinese broccoli with garlic sauce instead. That was great, cause I finished the whole dish. When I asked for the bill, I told them I didn't really liked the corn appetizer so they didn't charge me for that dish! That's awesome, I don't usually complain about the food but what they did, I really appreciated it!! So we gave them a little bit more than 20% tip just for the service! Will definitely go again if we are in town!   Bf was happy with the service and food too! He's happy, I'm happy, we're all happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their heavy duty menu!

3LiuxeYS6ZXbEPZCtkRzmQ.text: Finally met with Julie K for dinner here since we've been talking about Komol for forever.  We started off with fried veggie spring rolls - they were good but a bit too greasy compared to the ones I've had in other Thai restaurants.  I wanted to try their meekrob but they were out.  Julie got the vegetarian padkeemao (drunken noodles) and I got the same thing but with pork instead of veggies.  I normally get spicy 5/10 since I don't like burning my mouth but I think I could've gone up to a 7/10 with the noodles.  We got beef panang spicy 10/10 - it wasn't that spicy at all.  We also got pineapple fried rice. It has tomatoes, pineapple chunks and cashews - it was alright but I'm not a fan of rice or sweet rice unless it's dessert.  Service was ok. The interior could be improved.  The food, overall, was average.    But wait, the best thing on their menu  is the dessert!  They have mangoes with sticky rice but they had me at NON-DAIRY ICE CREAM!  I got the Thai tea ice cream which was the main reason I wanted to go here in the first place.  I was not disappointed.  One of the best frozen treats I've ever had.  Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Non-dairy ice cream!!!
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea ice cream (non-dairy! Yay!)
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fried rice

j2NECigdvVyq9YnPY_wA4Q.text: Pad See Ew with pork is the best I've ever had.  Green Curry Fried rice with chicken is delicious (super spicy...) For dessert, the Taro Ball w/coconut Milk is heaven!  We spent about $30 (with tip) for 2 people since my wife and I shared everything!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

d59qwY-g65PhpGLPVvKumQ.text: New favorite Thai spot!  They have a huge menu (like, literally HUGE - it's made of big, wooden boards) which has a little bit of everything, including several soups and veggie options -- Actually, I would say roughly 60% of the menu is vegetarian/vegan, which is awesome! I love discovering new places that cater to everyone. To be honest, it is kinda pricy, but it's so worth it. There's just so many things to choose from!   Made reservations as a party of 9 for a friend's birthday. Unfortunately, I was a dumbass and had eaten elsewhere not too long beforehand, so I simply went with an $8 pot of hot sake (which is about 6-7 shots) & a plate of fried eggplant -- But don't get me wrong, I def ended up doing a little scavenging off of others' plates: Tom Kha soup w/ scallops, chicken satay, mango sorbet, soft shell crab, and of course the fried eggplant... All of which were DIVINE! Next time, I'll bring an extra stomach and try something new.  The restaurant itself is a hidden gem. It shares a parking lot with another favorite of mine, Cornish Pasty Co., as well as the infamous Green Door. From the outside, it doesn't look like much, but the interior decor is precious. Lots a bright, faux flowers and and gorgeous, wooden tables creates a cozy atmosphere. There isn't a whole lot of elbow room, but I think that just adds to appeal. It's a great place for an intimate dinner with your loved ones. Also, the bathrooms are tucked-away and tidy - which is always a plus.  On top of all that, service was spectacular! I can't remember their names off the top of my head, but the two women serving us were friendly, quick, and attentive. They really made it an awesome experience. Thank you! I'll be back soon!

Nfs_m8dXlBc16fqCEM_afg.text: Arrived for dinner on a Sunday evening which is unusual for me BC I usually dine here during the week. I was shocked how busy they were - the dinning room was totally filled but I lucked out and secured the last booth before the waiting list began.  I heart the vegetarian options Komol offers, although I'm not vegan. I chose a vegan combo dinner which was only $10.95 that included mushroom Tom Kha soup, spring roll and veggie pad Thai. The food was tasty and filling and can understand why Komol is doing so well!  Komol will continue to be my go to place for Thai food in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai chicken wings
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian Pad Thai
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian mushroom soup and spring roll

zclEYC7k9tOGNQpqo6k6fw.text: Something I miss about living in San Francisco is living a street away from Thai food. Since I moved back to Las Vegas, I've been deprived from some really awesome food. I thought Vegas' thai food wouldn't be able to live up to SF, but Komol proved me wrong.  Location: It was actually kind of hard for us to find this place. We had to ask the guy where it was. It's in the middle area of the shopping center next to the korean restaurants.   Atmosphere: Everything about his place is great. The menus are wooden and different from what you expect. My friend said, "These remind me of Jumanji." I thought they looked awesome.   Food  Pad se ew: These were pretty good. I didn't think they were amazing, but they definitely satisfied the craving I had. They were a little drier and a little less flavorful than what I'm used to, but they were still delicious.  Thai iced coffee: YUM! If you're feeling a little tired, you definitely need to give this one a try!  Panang Curry: This was the star of the night. We got medium spice and it was perfect! This curry is addicting. Once you start eating it, you definitely won't want to stop.   Service: The waiters were very attentive. I never had to ask for a refill on my water (big plus) and they continuously asked if we needed something, but not too much that it got annoying. It was helpful when they needed to check up on us, especially when my friend was ready for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango sticky rice

2pEf-D3uGEvgU31GG_Gb0w.text: Shhh, don't tell anyone but in the same shopping center as Lotus, there's Komol! The best Tom Kha possibly in the country, papaya salad with flavor (not just pure sugar), perfectly balanced curries (panang my favorite), and so many more great staples and some innovations (lobster curry, whaat?!). Go there and then don't tell anyone, I like being able to get a table!

kPiE5sIuekdA9_UHIKLpeA.text: I've been coming here since I was a little kid ...like back when Mary K's Arcade was still open haha my parents had their business right next door so I pretty much grew up at Commercial Center.. We used to go to Komol once a week and it is still one of our top Thai places. I would come here more often if it wasn't so out of the way but definitely come check this place out if you're in the area ;]]]   We always get: -Shrimp Noodle Soup: It's a clean broth with lots of shrimp.. I like to add a bunch of those pickled jalapenos and the juice it's in to give the soup a kick and I love tangy things. -Spicy Chicken with Bamboo: I don't know if that's what it is really called but that pretty much sums it up HAHA  -Mint Chicken: Minced chicken sauteed with mint and different spices  -Panang Curry: Perfect balance of spice, sweetness & creaminess -Chicken Laap-Kai Salad or Larb: Yummm and so refreshing  I know there are lots of Thai places to check out even Lotus of Siam that is literally just steps away from Komol.. But Komol has been around for so long and is owned by the same family from years ago.. Service is always friendly and the food is always fresh.   HOT TIP: They don't use MSG and can make any dish vegetarian (using tofu, soy chicken, beef, shrimp, duck, fish..fake meat lol) ~!!!

xvKHSq1xDU0ZiYrqMYzXHw.text: We have come here many times over the years. It is very good! The curry's are great and the house Fried Rice is very good. They have been here for years and the service is always good and so is the food. Has to be one of our favorite Thai places in Vegas. They give you your moneys worth. Been to others close by and they don''t give you near as much food as they do here. You ask for how spicy you want something and it comes out perfect. When you arrive wait till you see their wood menu's and how much food you can pick from. There is something for everyone here!! Worth trying!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry.. very good!
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ytKyMzhrw65XQsLF38KsCA.text: It truly is as good as it gets. It was the BEST thai food we had ever been to. We went for lunch one day and then went for dinner the very next day.   Their highlights:   The Panang curry is an absolute MUST! Apparently its home made and they grind the ingredients fresh. I dont know what magic it is but it is a must try.  The chilli chicken mint( I think thats what it is).. Very different and delicious  Fried ice cream: This is what made me drag my husband there the next day. Just thinking bt it makes my mouth water.  The service is really good too. Its not just one waiter who attends your table, everyone takes care of you and checks up on you. We went over the christmas weekend and it was still easy to get tables. Really close to the strip too :)

GLCk5n5jIKzzuGQ-rhfAwg.text: Have been eating here since last 11 years and always have enjoyed the food. Great vegan and vegetarian choices.

HfY0O2GALvZKJ9B2G_Cwog.text: If I lived in Las Vegas, I would eat here everyday. Komol, hands down, makes the best vegetarian tom yum I've ever had. The spicy/sour mix was just perfect. This place is perfect to visit if you have a mixed party of meat eaters & vegetarians. Their vegetarian menu is soooo extensive & wonderful.

eivQo5BV8vgXL9_R7DsZEg.text: I won't lie. It's tough being neighbors with Lxxxs of Sxxm in the center and being the same nationality of food. Here is my experience:   1. If you or anyone else is on a date and it's late in the evening you will always be sat at the last booth by the bathrooms. I don't know if it's a Thai good luck thing or what... I happened to be on a date there and was sat in that spot. AND on multiple occasions have seen awkward couples seated there as well. The nice thing about that seat is that if you want to see the entire Restaurant you are in luck, OR if you only want to stare at your potential life partner/pal/lover/romantic interest you are SET, AND have quick access to the toilet if they make off color remarks that offend your delicate sensibilities.   2. Don't eat here if you are in a hurry. The food is amazing however the kitchen likes to take their time making your delicious treats.   3. ALWAYS ask for it as hot as they will make it. They add fresh green chills to your dish if you ask for the hottest of the hot, and they are not only delicious, they are flavorful, crunchy, and HOT. -yum-   4. IF you order the Sukiyaki (a favorite of mine) make sure you specify that you want it as the soup. ALSO don't expect the fish balls that they advertise... I've never had them in my soup.   5. YOU WILL leave full   Yum... I just ate here last night and found another new favorite dish... I can't remember the name though, so sorry! It's a beef/potato curry and it's sweet, hot, savory, and makes me want to go there again tonight...   ...if I only had a date...

KIDETnEzznW8GGQRPxbycA.text: Definitely never coming back. My buddies and I went the other day.  We ordered a variety of things thinking it would be a decent place to eat.  We were wrong! $80 wrong between us! Don't waste your money here!  Stuffed chicken wings - very salty stuffing, not stuffed very well, lots of oil seeped inside, but despite that the insides still wasn't cooked.  Pad-Zee-Euw: the gravy tasted like flour and water and cornstarch.  Very cornstarchy made it gross.  Combination Fried Rice: how the pho can you mess this up. i understand it's traditional to use left over rice for home made fried rice, but for them to use rice that has hardened from air exposure, that's just gross.  The vegetables seemed like an afterthought because they were still frozen.    Beef Noodle Soup: this is NOT beef noodle soup!  If this is your first time trying it, you'll think beef noodle soup is gross.  If you're an expert like me, you'll know they're ripping you off.  First off they just threw in 4 small pieces of beef into hot water with the spices from a packet of ramen and called it beef noodle.  Know how i know it's a spice packet from a bag of ramen?  Because the green onion wasn't fresh, it was the dry type, plus it tasted like ramen from a 20 cent ramen bag.    Beef larb: very bitter, the same bitterness as when you squeeze lime into the larb and leave it overnight in the refrigerator and the lime now tastes bitter.  It was obvious that's what they did because parts of it was hot and parts of it was near frozen.

hFzxYJqfHefH-qXfG5rWTA.text: Another gem outside the Vegas strip.    Located in not such a nice shopping mall but once you enter their doors, you're in a beautiful, great smelling restaurant with authentic, reasonably priced, delicious food.  I was overwhelmed with all the items in the 20 page (I'm exaggerating a bit) beautiful menu but managed to select a few dishes with the help of my extremely helpful and knowledgeable waiter.  The food was beyond delicious.  Everything I ordered was just a "wow" moment in my mouth.  Will definitely be back as soon as I am again in Vegas.

d27AigkBcwNk0Bqp2nToig.text: I loved the food here ... It's really awesome for vegetarians .... The veg pad kee Mao was really good ... The best part is service here ..

bxMDu8-gMXoyUbNh6DhTww.text: Best Thai I've had since Ban Kruit on the Gulf coast of Thailand.  Great tom kah yum and Panang curry.

XJnVVNJf7_SIXYEPnZYxDg.text: Komol is the best Vegan Thai restaurant in town. The Papaya Phad Thai rocks!

fVxmfzbS6TeFU9hsIL_Ebw.text: After 7 yrs in Vegas I'll admit I've strayed from my previous CA vegan(ish) lifestyle/diet. My initial visit to Komol was very refreshing for me, helping me to realize what I was previously accustomed to and satisfied with. Hats off to Komol, I'm back on track.... sort of.

t7FPkMXTC72A3STDhITRJw.text: Don't know what the hype was. The curry was very different. The service was awful.

PvzcxeCsWG0RoLARhG9MlQ.text: Like other reviewers have pointed out--Kamol is a True treasure in Las Vegas. It is maybe not located in the best part of town, but I think it adds to its charm and authenticity.   I loved the humongous variety of foods on the menu and the quick and efficient service.  I even liked the often cheesy decor. I thought that this place worked as a whole--atmosphere, location, service and food. Everything was as good as it gets.  I am very glad that my friend BizBeth recommended this place to me and took me here for lunch--I thought that my search for a perfect Thai place in Vegas was ended by Pin Kaow, but I was proven wrong by this amazing "old Vegas" gem.  I liked all the soups, dishes and even meats that I tried here, and servers were very happy to answer my questions and to serve with outmost courtesy.   I LOVED all the vegetarian offerings! I LOVED the inexpensive pricing!  I just hope that my next trip here is as good as my first!

6xxON1BNKeS1vaBBEb8xbA.text: If you're used to good Thai food this is below average. But it is a cheap, quiet restaurant off the strip with lots of veggie options. Did I mention it's cheap? A little hard to find, in a labyrinthine shopping center. Look for suite E10.

4pqz4pz1rL0zDuJFMtb89g.text: It's hard to get great thai food in vegas as we have a lot of good options. Komol however, stand out above the rest. They have a lot of vegetarian options and the servers really work with you to decide what would be best. I definitely recommend the papaya salad, it's delicious! Many more vegetarian options can be found on page 23 and do not hesitate to ask questions!

Ob4rgZsOSoQDdXIy7CElXQ.text: Komol is a treasure of the real thing. When I lived in Vegas, this was a favorite of mine and my best friend, who agreed that this is the best Thai food in Vegas.   Bad art, bad decor, Commercial Center... those would not be things that would draw me into a place. The service is impeccable and the food is awesome. My friend lived in Thailand during all of her high school years so if she says it's the real thing, then it's the real thing.   I had the papaya salad which was truly excellent. When he asked me for my "spicy" level, I said medium. Both he and my friend looked at me like I had lobsters crawling out of my ears (sound familiar), and he responded with oh no, give me a number from 1-10. So, I asked for a 3. Well, it wasn't quite spicy enough for me so I added a little of my own.   I have noticed in Thai restaurants, that most of them think we can't handle the level of heat they can. Well that may be True because it can be too hot for me but I think I could have handled at least a 5. No worries because the papaya salad was excellent.   If you can get past the bad art, the bad decor, and bad everything else here (that does not include the food or the service), then I highly recommend you try this place. You won't regret it.

Fu0IDYps7gDJzSXMLrQFnQ.text: As much as I love Thai food, Komol is located in the same Plaza as much busier Lotus of Siam. The food is great if you're a Vegan or want a lighter fare. I commend them for offering menu items there were not Vegan.  I'm all in for having my food prepared with meat, seafood or poultry. For me, they didnt't bring it with the flavor but would substitute with heat.    When I compared the two, I ordered the same items from the menu. The Garlics Prawns were cooked in a garlic sauce & really shrimpy (small). The rice was OK, and didn't have any flavor. I would go back again if there were no seats available @ neighboring Lotus where I know I will enjoy my meal & not simply eat because I'm hungry.  However, when your order is taken you know they take pride in their service as well as the menu.

6C5Np-KDaxi5ks7TBmpZxg.text: Good Thai food here.  Had laarb kai, chili mint, and pad Thai.  All great dishes and made very well.  I'm a bit surprised that their main competition is across the street, lotus of siam.  Well, food here is definitely good and worth a stop.

HZfRF_zc40soC2blonfY1w.text: A friend and I were directed here after the place we wanted to go to was still undergoing renovations.   It took awhile to get us to our seats, but that was part of the charm. I think we may have only been the non-locals in the joint (a good sign).   I twisted my friend's arm to get the Tom Kha Gai soup. Although it was very oily, it was delicious. Very spicy, but oh so tasty. She twisted my arm to get the fried (!!) spinach. It, too was great.  For our shared entree, we got Papaya Pad Thai. Unfortunately, it was not very good at all.  I think there was only waitress for the whole place and the owner (??) came and helped as well. We were in no hurry and took a very long time with our dinner, so the service that would be considered bad by some, was just perfect for us.   I'd go back if I'm off the strip again. But I wouldn't go if I were in a hurry and I wouldn't order the Pad Thai. I'd risk getting the Tom Kha again, though!

_4yJjrqRmy2o-ov-6Ppcwg.text: Excellent food and decent prices.  Came to the Commercial Center to eat the famous Lotus of Siam next door, but it was closed.  Many friends have commented to me that Komol is much better anyways. I got the garlic pork and we split some drunken noodles.  Also got the loaded won ton soup, which was basically a meal itself.  I would definately eat here again when back in Vegas.

j3Vn6Mg5pJN2dMIgF2hU3A.text: The food here is always great--the service and location aren't.  If you've ever been to commercial center, you know what I mean.  Homeless folks asking for change, ladies selling their "goods", shady figures under awnings of defunct businesses, and the Green Door looming at everything from its distant side of the area.  I'd love to add the sweet transsexuals (please tell me you get the reference?) outside Ramrod to the list, but it's gone!  Never you fear, once you brave the environment and make it to sometimes hard-to-spot entrance of Komol, you're safe.  The decor is wonderfully cheesy, but I really think that adds to the experience.  The menu is huge, but don't be intimidated!  Carnivores, please refer to the first half.  Veggheads, the second half is all for you.    My favorite dishes are the Indian yellow curry, extra thick, both with chicken or tofu, the shrimp pad thai, orange gluten (so wonderfully deep fried and covered in highly sugared sauce!), vegetable chow mien, brown rice, and the fried bean curd appetizer.  My guy likes the green chicken curry.  I also love the iced thai teas they serve there with coconut milk.  The service is very slow, though.  You're seated, ten minutes later your order is taken, thirty minutes later you receive your appetizer, ten minutes later the main dish comes out, and you might get one refill on the glass.  Probably the best thing about this place is the option to tell them how spicy you like it.  I always ask for my curries to be medium-hot, while the guy likes his super mild.  Very rarely are we displeased with the spicedatude of our food.    Caution: medium-hot at Komol does not correlate with spicedatude of Ortega or Pace salsas.  The guy has cried after tasting my curry.  Spicedatude definitions are also prone to change with the chef.  His mild may bring steam to your ears.

V3pUXY3i8ACi9ye62rtjfQ.text: I came here twice. The first time i would give it a 5 star but the second time is only so so.  Komol and lotus siam are two of the world famous Thai food places. They are also super close to each other. Definitely will try Lotus Siam next time I'm in vegas.

Gza4IzgjxErIYkNlfQBb7A.text: This is my new favorite Las Vegas eatery.   It's in a CRAZY terrible looking neighborhood, and it was sort of hard for me to find, but it was totally worth it.   The staff was super friendly and the service was speedy.   The food is AWESOME. The vastness of the vegetarian options was sort of overwhelming - I decided on the panang curry, which was a favorite of mine in my meat-eating days and is hard to find veggie style. It was not disappointing.   We also got the herbal salad, which my boyfriend seemed to like more than I did, and the tofu satee, which I've never seen before!  I will definitely be visiting this place again soon.

FHk4pi8jk_6Krgz8qluEOQ.text: One star off because the service is hit or miss. But their curry makes up for everything else. Seriously the best curry in town!

F8BXvDQrtvxgpLPMbjI0vQ.text: Please know if you're following Google maps, this place isn't located along the strip mall facing Sahara. There's an entranceway to the shops in the BACK in order to get there. I spent 10 minutes trying to figure this out. The area is obviously one of the older areas of Las Vegas when it comes to strip malls, so you're going to be put off at first on location.   Once you get inside, the scenery is a little more appealing than what's outside. Came for lunch, there was barely anyone there and we got seated fast. The menus are made out of wood, and is huge! There's a number of items you can choose from, and there are meat dishes for those who aren't part of the vegetarian/vegan lifestyle. We ordered the fried egg rolls, which were a little smaller than expected. I felt for the time we were there with barely any people there, our food took longer than expected to arrive, but I figured in preparation it was well worth the wait.  We ordered the orange tofu, vegetarian pad thai, and a vegetable rice dish our server suggested to try. Everything was outstanding, and there were so much leftovers my friend and I both left with a full box for takeout! Service was great, my water was constantly refilled and the server was kind to answer any questions about the menu.  Eager to return to try more vegetarian/vegan options out. Komol truly gives the definition of a great hole in the wall restaurant in Vegas.

E3VTLHorwlr1MQGfqyrYEg.text: Shoutout to Lisa L and Eric R for dragging my husband and I to this place (and bringing a killer coupon no less). I had always been scared of this place due to all the vegetarian verbage that gets thrown around. Luckily their meat dishes are outstanding as well!   Lisa L's description of the food was spot on. Everthing was quite tasty. Service was pretty spotty, but no major complaints there. Beer was reasonable and varied ($4 for chinese/thai imports, $3.50 for American beers) and overall the dinner was an insane value. With the coupon we spent $12.50 each for our 4 course meal + dessert + drinks. Without the coupon we still would have spent a meager $18.50 (with tax and tip!) each for that feast. Killer.   Now for a little comparison amongst Komol and LOS for the die hard foodies who can't decide which to go to (Pin Kao doesn't come close to measuring up to either one!).  Got Vegan/Veggie people with you? Definitely Komol, no question Value oriented? Komol Looking to eat the basics (ie curry, pad see ew, etc): Komol  So why should anyone ever go to LOS? LOS is really for a more sophisticated palate. The food is infinitely more interesting ! The drunken seabass noodles (not found at Komol) and the soft shell prawns (not found at Komol) are my two favorites. Komol was great, but comparing LOS and Komol is kind of ridiculous. It's like comparing Mon Ami Gabi to Joel Robuchon. Both are French, but the food is just so completely different.   Honestly it just depends if you're looking to try Thai like you've never had it, or are you looking for the basics done well at a great price. Komol serves the later.

Oc-npSAnrWrFnVL6zdGlFA.text: Excellent service and food. We've stayed in Thailand before and have difficulty finding Thai restaurants that can compare with Thailand but this place was delicious. Try the Penang curry.

K9JYQJCLB5wS2WrUOJODRQ.text: This restaurant has a lot of vegan options. It also has nice decor and atmosphere. I really enjoyed my pad Thai and pineapple fried rice. Tom Yum soup - not so much.

LSXyHEvZukH_0t2i0u3rZg.text: Before going to Komol Restaurant my level of expectation is quite high for the food and service.Why? Because it is highly rated restaurant and is recognised by The Las Vegas Weekly for one of the "Best Thai Cuisine" However, once I've tried I was quite disappointed with the restaurant food and service.  First of all I have to say the restaurant has great selection of non-vegetarian and vegetarian dishes.The parking was very convenient.Their food display and garnishes were quite beautiful.The wooden carved menu was kind of pretty.The down side wss the location since it is located in an old complex(Commercial Centre) Anyway,my friends and I wasn't there to try their vegetarian menu.We were there to try the regular non-vegetarian dishes.  Food  First,my friend started with Nua-Dad-Deaw(Beef Jerky) and Fish Cake, I order Pad-Kee-Mao seafood(Stirred-fried flat rice noodles with Garlic,Chilli and Basil leaves), and other friend of mine ordered Beef Musaman.We had been waiting for a long time for our food to come even though the restaurant wasn't busy at all that night. We were extremely hungry. When our appetisers arrived we were quite excited with the food displays and they looked enticing.Once my friend bit on the beef jerky,she said it was quite chewy so I tried.It was quite disappointed since the beef  was quite tough like my friend mentioned and it was not that flavourful,but sweet. Then I tried the fish cake,I thought it was a bit better than the jerky.The fish cake did satisfied my palate,but it didn't taste or look like the typical&traditional fish cake at all.  When my Pad-Kee-Maw Seafood arrived it is way too oily.I know that stirred-fried noodles supposed to be oily but not that oily like this restaurant made..Anyway,it tasted kind of ok.I think it will be more delicious if the restaurant didn't make it so oily. The last dish was Beef Mussaman however we get the vegetarian version instead of Beef Mussaman that we've ordered.So my friend asked our waitress to take it back and fixed it in a polite a manner,the waitress was silent and had no response.She just pulled a face,lifted the dish up and walked away. We had been waiting for our Mussaman Beef to come,but the restaurant didn't fix it for us and our Mussaman Beef never come back to us. So we have to cancelled it.   Service  Terrible,terrible service!!!.Firstly,I spoke Thai to the waitress there,but she spoke English back to me which I found it was very rude of her to do so(I am Thai and she is Thai ) Secondly, the waitresses weren't attentive.They didn't ask us whether "is everything alright" They just walked pass our table a lot of time without asking anything.Either me or my friend had to call or grab them whenever we want more water or in need of something.  Overall  I don't know about other customers ,but my  friends and I didn't have a good experience when I visited this restaurant.The service was unexpectedly bad and the food were not that great. I found the service were unfriendly and inattentive.Common! for a the price that we paid,the products and service should have been better.We ended up paying more than $60 dollars and still hungry.I am not quite sure for the future return to Komol Restaurant.Like I said I have been to lots of Thai restaurants,some good some bad,but I would say Komol is one of the worst ones for both and service.Even though I perfectly understand that some Thai restaurants in the USA do not cook authentic Thai dishes,but how about the service???I am extremely surprised that this restaurant get a good review and 4 star rating.According to my experience it is worthed only 2 stars.

RUbTwAw5Ca6TgEq-PTRKFA.text: Seriously the food here is good. And depending the day and time they make the food look super fancy. The herbal salad is the best thing on the menu. I've been coming here for years. And its rare but sometimes the servers can be forgetful but still not bad. The thia tea is great to. Never been disappointed at Komol

mE7iO6RzyVtfrSrAI0dd4A.text: Nom nom. Good authentic thai food. Got the lunch special. Panang curry with salad and peanut sauce. Great food for a good price. Definitely worth going to. It's located in the center across from the lotus of siam

83iJuO99x6CWQLAlyGq_4g.text: Our go to Thai in town. Great joint.   Herbal salad, Thom Gai and duck curry are our standards here.   Worth the visit every time.

IulK_9INWIMQ-C0ojnIoGQ.text: Just ok. Herbal salad packed flavor but it became cloyingly sweet as I ate it.  Way too much tamarind or sugar? Chilli mint with shrimp was eh also.   I'm not sure why it is called that because I couldn't detect any mint. I asked for hot sauce because my dining companion didn't want it too spicy. They gave a trio of condiments to add extra heat.  They weren't packing much heat at all.  I had spicier crushed pepper from a pizza joint.   They do offer many mouth-watering sounding items on the menu, but a few of the dishes that Yelpers noted fell flat for me.   I live in NY/NJ area where there are a ton of Thai restaurants and there are several stellar places here.  This place didn't quite measure up.

JbWiqNs5RDeD89koNSRiOA.text: Love love love this place!  They have both vegan and non vegan options which makes it convenient to dine with friends.  Best Mushroom Tom Kha I've ever had!! Awesome servers too.

UUSMKMpCZzc76cphK78ASQ.text: I would give zero stars if I could. What a terrible experience. We went there for lunch, it was packed and we got seated at a long table where other people were seated a few seats down at the same table. Like a school lunch situation. They kept forgetting about us. It took forever to order our food and the people seated long after us got their food first. We inquired about our food and were told it's coming. Then a waitress came by and told us they were out of Indian curry and asked what else we wanted. 45 minutes in and they are just now telling us that they haven't even started our lunch!!!! Hungry and outraged we left. It should be noted that the table next to us got up and left without receiving thier food bc it took so long and they had to get back to work. I would never recommend this place. Avoid it if you can.

7H5MFjs9AcbpAcBScgklwA.text: Update: came here for lunch with a group of 6. Ordered and still waiting for our food after an hour. Waitress was not polite at all.

zJNQ-HAs-lzJ-pxa_8Lamw.text: Food, service, prices were all decent. Don't be deterred by the storefront- everything inside was very nice.

tMmmBMDNkM6j1GCDSaY72A.text: We were looking for some food off the strip and found this place on Yelp.  We went there because of all the positive reviews and we weren't disappointed.  The day before we ate dinner at Mario Batali's 'Otto Enoteca Pizzeria' in the Venetian but as good as that was, Komol was the place that we talked about after we left Vegas.  We got a bowl of the Tom Yum Mushroom soup for an appetizer and two entrees, Chili Mint Tofu and the Vegetarian Panang.  They all tasted fresh and very flavorful.  It definitely hit the spot for what were were looking for.  This is going to be a regular stop for us every time we come to Vegas.  The shopping complex is easy to find but once you're inside it's hard to find the restaurant.  After driving the perimeter of the complex we found that it's located in the building in the very middle of the complex and facing the strip.  Just an FYI.

jT7e_yIgPXkV7WbNtvoBlQ.text: I love this place.  I live in the neighborhood, and I go here several times a month.  Amazing selection of vegan dishes (which they prepare in separate pans from the meat food).  The servers are very nice and accommodating, and they will even adapt non-vegan menu items, such as making Thai iced coffee/tea with coconut milk or making the nam sod with tofu instead of pork.  The herbal salad, tofu nam sod, pad kee mao, panang curry, and tom kha soup are probably my favorite dishes. They even have vegan coconut ice cream!  Good lunch special (M-F) with salad or soup (go for the salad - both the peanut and ginger dressings are great), an eggroll, and a good-sized entree for ~$8.  They tend to make things pretty hot here, so order accordingly.   @shanti - they recently did some remodeling and now the bathrooms (which admittedly, were pretty awful) are now quite nice.

dPZ4nDfJfbwQYbG0Lqyf7Q.text: Everything was good. I wasn't asked if I wanted it spicy or how spicy so my food had no spice :( I know it's silly but I had the thought that maybe it's cause I'm white I don't want any spice ?  Anyways if I ever go back I will have to make sure I ask while ordering.  The ladies there were nice. Also the wontons from the appetizer menu had almost nothing in them and I couldn't  identify what was in it. It was really just like a fried wrapper. Disappointing but that's ok.

DeW_F976KH2ghSnAEE66EQ.text: I love Thai Food.. we went to Lotus of Siam (in the same strip mall) since that had so many reviews the day before, and loved the food... but when we went to Komol, we realized this was the BEST THAI FOOD I've ever had. My husband and I went half n hour before they close, and they were so nice and professional. The food was hot and absolutely delicious.. unfortunately, we're never gonna like thai food anywhere else now.. :(   Being a vegetarian, this place was like heaven, i never have so many options to choose from, but here i did... and seriously, the food was amazing. We ordered Veg. Masaman curry, Garlic Fried rice and Barramundi with Basil Sauce - everything was great..

49bqhWR3gormrcilHFItlg.text: Marginal service and tasteless food.  Waited over 10min after being seated and the servers were standing around talking.  Ordered Pad Thai and Pad See Yew.  Both were absolutely lacking in any flavor and the Pad Thai had very little chicken and no peanuts or green onion as other reviewers noted.  Would not return.

KYwNaNKR9-X0rjAnQ3M32w.text: This place is very well hidden in a large complex of "ghetto" eateries, but like they say looks can be quite deceiving.  I was more than surprised when I walked in, to find this place extremely clean and well decorated.  The servers were definitely nice, I get the "homey" feeling right off the bat. I'd give this place more of a 3.5, just because the people were definitely nice to me and we were able to order within the first 5 mins we sat.     The menu was a huge selection, but the prices made my eyes grow extremely big.  I was shocked out how expensive some of the dishes were.  After flipping through the hard book, I made a decision to go with Roast Duck Curry and Garlic Salt and Pepper Shrimp.  My friend with the duck noodle soup.  Roast Duck Curry - It was a little bland.  I didn't taste anything, I thought I'd taste sweetness considering there were pineapples in it.  I didn't know what exactly I was tasting, but it tasted like a Thai herb.    Garlic Salt and Pepper Shrimp - To my disappointment, I thought it'd be deep fried in a batter mix then coated with the garlic salt and pepper mix.  Despite my thoughts, I thought this dish was the winner.  It was stir fried in the garlic salt mix to perfection, except for the fact I had about 10 pieces maybe less and I was paying almost I think 15? I don't know exactly, but it was expensive.    I couldn't speak for the duck noodle soup, since I didn't have a taste. But from what my friend told me,he said it was good.  I don't know if I would return here.  The prices kind of scared me, and the food didn't capture me.  But come out and try it for yourself. Maybe I was just trying the wrong dishes.

k92qE2MLxsCjBoL4tqUDdQ.text: We went to the area with the intention of going to Lotus.  Lotus was closed, so we tried Komol.    We sat down quickly, and immediately noticed that one of the plates and one of the forks was dirty (the fork had rice stuck in it) and ordered an appetizer of fried wontons and Pad Thai.  The wontons were terrible.  There was nothing stuffed in them...We then waited for 45 minutes for our Pad Thai.  It was terrible.  The meat was bad, and the whole dish was flavorless.  There were no green onions or peanuts in the dish even though it was described to have both on the menu.    They also never checked on out table while we waited for the food. I was never offered any water after I finished my first glass.  They did notice that we didn't like the food and didn't charge us for the pad Thai.  so that was nice of them, since we had to go and get food else where after.

vqt1IKzR1DY3ELYt87qdbA.text: It is ironic that a shopping center w/sex clubs and churches can have 2 of the best Thai restaurants in town.  This one continues to get better.  If your vegetarian try the kad ped delight w/faux chicken.  If not try the ultimate shrimp omelet.  An extensive menu of culinary delights w/curry dishes to die for I have gone here for 10 years and have never been disappointed.

y66Ay7FPaaVZ3tyIsMLbvA.text: Got introduced to this place by my younger sister.  It's a great place for Thai food, pretty authentic if you ask me.  A little oily, but less greasy than most thai places.  The food is legit, and it's great for vegetarians.  My vegetarian in-laws rave about this place as well  I don't know what I ate (had a lot of different plates), but all I can say is that I liked it all!  And just to stress the popularity of this restaurant, it is located in the commercial center in Vegas.  Commercial center is a graveyard for restaurants location wise (in my opinion), but the parking lot is still full because everyone is at Komol!

iGPHtS93SDxhrhYe5i1uQA.text: I tried this place on a recommendation from a friend and I am glad I did! The food is fantastic. I made the mistake, however, of letting my boyfriend choose 8 on the spice level. I think the food would have been that much better if I didn't get it so spicy, but even with my mouth on fire the food was so flavorful.  It actually ended up being really good leftovers too!   Finding the place was a little confusing. It seems to been a small mall sort of thing and I am pretty sure I drove around the whole thing until I found it. The only slight problem was the service. It seemed to take a bit longer than it should have and we asked for a few things and never received them. It was nothing that would stop me from going back there again.

twRgeZf2HFJJuqzbid3PhA.text: Good thai restaurant, if u r craving thai Vegetarians have a good number of choices to explore. Good service, good food and okish ambience.

vyLkTtZSoi1lNV_v6pfdeg.text: Oh my goodness!!! The pad kee mao was soooo sooo yummy. It was truly the very best Thai noodle dish I have EVER had!!! Such a perfect balance of garlic, basil and light heat. The Angel duck was a great complement as was the panang sea bass. We will be back!!!

vsgBC7FsKH4EnjO5jTw9cw.text: Great Thai food in Vegas away from the hustle and bustle. Excellent customer service!

uXpcc5M5UAQFy0C4nc5BoQ.text: Me encanto Los Platos Vegetarianos!!! Vegetarian Plates are great!!! Can't wait to visit Vegas again to try more food.

Z9tUqm5Bv04DdFpxFcLStQ.text: I came here last night for dinner. It was tucked away in a hidden spot that I never would have known about if it wasn't for my boyfriend taking me. I'm glad he did though! We walked in around 6:30pm and got seated right away. Everyone was friendly and said hello. I looked over the menu while they brought us water and was delighted to see all the different choices they had. I already knew in my head what I was craving, my normal pad-see-ew, but had to look on to see whatelse they had to offer. so many veggie options that I think I need to return and sample some soon! I ordered a glass of the house red wine and that was only $5.95. Filled to the top and def helped to clear my head and calm my nerves. I ordered like I said the pad-see-ew and was pleased with my choice. instead of meat I got the veggie option and asked the waiter what other veggies they add in besides the broccoli that normally comes with it (in the meat and veggie way.) He said they didn't really add others, but he could for me if I wanted. I told him that was okay just to add more broccoli. (i love my greens!) My plate came out with chinese and american broccoli so I was pleased over that. The black bean soy sauce was made just right and the noodles very wobbley like i like em! My boyfriend and I shared the orange chicken with sticky white rice. It was the best orange chicken I have had. Each piece so crispy and full of flavor. My tastebuds were in heaven. The sticky white rice is just as it says. very sticky too. some of the best I have had as well. My boyfriend ordered his usual pad thai set at a spice number 5. medium. When it arrived I was surprised with how spicy it was. For a 5 it was making my nose run and my mouth wanted some milk and I'm a girl who can handle her hot sauces and chili peppers! I am excited to go back and try a new dish I have never ventured into in the world of thai. The service was lovely and the prices were great. For all 3 dishes, a glass of red house wine, and a thai tea I believe it came to 41 dollars. We sure didn't break the bank, but we did make out with leftovers for days! Thank you Dan T. for surprising me with this little (a little hidden) golden dinner date.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pad see ew with a mix of chinese and american broccoli.
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. orange chicken. YUM!

vx954Wzu3kex75lBnvnabQ.text: A second visit here proved to be as good as or better than the first. I'll put Komol up against any Thai I've had anywhere. (In the U.S. that is).  This time we had Chicken Rad Na and Red Panang Curry with tofu. Both were excellent, but that Panang Curry, wow. The sauce is thicker than most other curries I've had and I like the way the sauce coats the vegetables and tofu. The dish was creamy, spicy, hot, thick, colorful and . . .delicious.  I especially like the wait staff. Our waiter was very helpful in recommending the Panang dish and he called in the service of his brother to deliberate together to give us the best directions to the airport. The lack of any TVs is also very much appreciated. Thank you Komol.

ZvL2d4vBOoCkzNVsXmurFQ.text: I was in town for my 50th birthday with my husband and family. Some of us love meat and two of us are vegan/vegetarian, so I wanted to find a place that would appeal to all of us. I found Komol on Yelp so we got in the car and drove there. My problem is I want to try everything so I order and order. The Panang sauce is delicious. Had tofu in the Panang ( no meat)! Ordered the herbal salad it was very tasty. This review is over a year old, but I felt it still deserved to be published. We went again a year later and it was just as I remembered. I will be going every tim I go to Vegas. It is a MUST!

arv0k1dM1j_IxjoZXGd9eQ.text: a great alternative to lotus of Siam which is located a few doors down and is always crowded.  komol has a number of dishes that are better than lotus.

BawAPrjoqKwnHdV_qWnHfg.text: I use to the really like this place. The food is good and the service is good enough. But after noticing pest issues on two separate occasions, I had to call it quits. I alerted the staff the first time and they said they would take care of it. I didn't go back for a while. When my father was in town and staying nearby, he wanted to go to a good vegetarian restaurant. I decided to give them a try again (hoping the issue was resolved). After we finished our meal, my father pointed out a roach crawling by. =( That doesn't work for me. Please note, this happened June 2014. I haven't been back since. I hope they have solved the issue, but you might want to look around before you chow down.

buHbTubfwTy8iRbA1bNhgA.text: Excellent food... would highly recommend for vegetarians.. we ordered vegetable fried rice and chow mien.. plus a bunch of stuff. Everything was perfect

Z3u9-Cazucr27EgaRmJWLQ.text: I don't know what the big hoopla is about Lotus of Siam, but Komol is a fantastic restaurant and the best Thai place I've ever eaten at.  I was completely surprised by the comfortable ambiance, good service, and delicious food.  Don't let the run down area fool you.  Once you get into the restaurant, it's a whole new world.  I ordered larb with chicken and the spice was just right.  The pad see ew was also wonderful--not too oily and just right in terms of meat to noodle ratio.

iubmbLP58-S0jPYJcJhSbA.text: Fantastic. This place deserves every accolade it receives. We really enjoyed the food,  the atmosphere, and the service. I would recommend this place to anyone,  and will probably go back before my visit to Vegas is over!

8rhbPNgyuAEW7KnrCt_ggw.text: Great little thai place; beware it's in a shady strip mall. Zagat rated, aol recognized, and yelp reviewed. Food is great, prices are cheap although not dirt cheap. I had the Tom young soup which was great, the panang chicken curry and the house chicken noodles. Warning to those who like spicy papaya salad, you won't be underspiced. I would recommend this little dive place, it will hit the spot but not empty your wallet!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside looking towards cashier/door.

zo_pkqlax9tHV-T4njim_w.text: This did not meet my expectations from reviews and photos that were posted.  I thought it is a bit pricey, especially for the appetizers.

Ofd9e-Irgndc_hwxLFYzXw.text: Pretty bummed to report that Komol has truly fallen from its ranks.  I hadn't eaten here since before it got shut down for a roach infestation.  After they reopened I was very hesitant on returning.  I was in the area the other day and decided to give it a shot.  I have to admit I was looking around for roaches when I was inside. I didn't see any, but the interior was dusty and everything had kind of a greasy layer of film on it. There was only one other table occupied, so I was seated pretty quickly.  The waitress was kind and pleasant, and I ordered veggie panang.  When my starter salad came out the lettuce looked a little bit wilted, and it was room temperature versus cold. I decided to eat it anyways. Two bites in and I got a huge mouth full of dirt. I spit the lettuce out and sure enough under the dressing-all over it was dirt. It had not been washed at all!  The waitress came by to see how things were going and I told her about the dirty salad. She lifted up the plate and saw what I was talking about, apologized, and took it back to the kitchen. She brought out veggie soup for me. It was very bland.  Next came my veggie panang. The rice tasted old, and the veggies were not cooked long enough-the eggplant was quite tough. The flavor of the Penang curry itself was bland and oily. I was so disappointed! I ate about half of it, just because I was so hungry.  But I will surely never return to Komol  again. And to think, once upon a time this was my go to Thai in Vegas.

u_k2YeVODOos0lSR8WD9YA.text: The food was delicious, however, the salads were a bit salty but everything we ordered were very flavourful. The service was quick and I'll definitely be coming back!

jFkISdCVdQiWtgdM36zm_w.text: I believe their service is dependent on whom they are serving! Since we love their food, we come to this restaurant every time we visit vegas! However their behavior still remains the same! The staff is pretty rude- on asking basic questions on the items on their menu, they get angry and leave the customer mid-way saying they will be back! Someone comes after few mins asking us if that was all the order we wanted to place! Pretty rude! When the food arrive, it is super cold! We do not tell them anything because they have already lost interest in us! They just lost a valuable and loyal customer and i will make sure i pass this review on to my friends and family!

k68pjjOORG3s5rt5EQfe2g.text: This place was delicious! They have individual vegetarian dinner combos and I got #3 which was mushroom soup, a spring roll, and pad Thai. I was very impressed with the flavor and was surprised how amazing the mushroom soup was. Our server must have refilled our water glasses 10 times because we were so thirsty and we were grateful that she was on it giving us refills. My fiance ordered the chicken veggie dish and enjoyed it. The prices were very fair as well.

ew2a_VYmiL5C8uZea9PutQ.text: Komol is usually my go to place for thai food when I am visiting Vegas! They have a separate vegetarian menu  I love that! It makes is so easy to chose the right thing without having to make adjustments. Ambience is nice. They do tend to get busy over the weekends so make a reservation. We went on a Thursday night recently and didn't have to wait. Customer service is good for the most part. If you go on a busy night they do make you wait quite a while.   Food was good. Average! We ordered Vegetarian pad kee mow and vegetable fried rice with fried tofu. They have a 5 spice levels and I went with medium. I could have gone a little up since it wasn't that spicy. I asked for the red chili sauce and that made the whole difference. Its pretty reasonable pricing with good portion size. I have had better thai food in LA and Sf, hence the 3 stars.   Parking is pretty easy to find. While in vegas, I guess next time I have to try Lotus of Sian next door!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian Menu
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

5E0PiS2ecCQDsnwyXr2OKA.text: I love this place . Many vegan options . Loads of flavor . Clean and attentive staff. Portions are big .

19yMBquQUVhfEertP3igAA.text: Excellent restaurant! This is my first choice of restaurant in Las Vegas! One of the best great Thai food I had!! Found it several years ago by a recommendation of a local and I highly recommend it!

ESRJ8bru9L_byC3kYI_ySg.text: We came here for a birthday dinner last night and enjoyed the experience. It seems like the more casual version of both Lotus of Siam and Arawan next door. It's a small space but decorated nicely. The menus are ridiculously large in both size (they're wooden) and content. They have a separate set of vegetarian pages in the back but most of them are the same dishes as the front with vegetarian meats. Seems like they could consolidate this a bit.   First off let me say we over-ordered for three people. But it was really fun trying everything. To start we shared a bowl of tom kha soup with shrimp and the herbal salad. The soup was the best tom kha I've ever had. I usually prefer tom yum because it's not as thick and milky but this tom kha was thinner and full of flavor. I'm going to be craving this soup a lot this winter. The herbal salad was a surprise, also full of flavor. It reminded me a bit of a papaya salad but it was crunchy with cashews and onions. The texture of the tofu was awesome. Very porous and crispy. This is a great starter but if I had to cut down on the ordering the tom kha would win over the salad.   For dinner we shared the chicken panang curry, house special duck and chicken pad kee mao. The curry was the best. We ordered a spicy level 7 and it was just enough heat. The sauce wasn't too thick or runny and they give you a good curry-to-rice ratio. The pad kee mao was delicious (huge portion) and the only disappointment was the house special duck. The duck came in a sauce the same consistency as a Chinese sweet and sour.. very gelatinous. The vegetables also felt like a Chinese stir fry: baby corn, snow peas, crinkle cut carrots. The duck was not crispy anymore due to sitting in the sauce so we hardly touched this dish. If something is called "house special" it should be a little more special than this. My only other complaint of Komol is the service. After receiving our food our waitress came back once to refill waters and never returned even though we were there for probably an hour and a half. I'm still a fan of the food though and would return for an intimate dinner that doesn't break the bank like Arawan and Lotus may.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wooden menus
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Herbal Salad
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Duck

gjHSIvBjfU9NtadA9pWgxQ.text: Don't let the Commercial Center aura scare you away! This is some of the best Thai food in town. I've been coming here for ten years and am always impressed by the food quality. They let you choose your spicy heat index and prep everything fresh. I'm updating my review now that I've traveled in Thailand because I feel even more happy with this great little gem of a restaurant. It is truly reflective of the foods I ate while I was there. My favorite soup is the Tom Ka with seafood combination. It has a nice coconut milk base with squid, shrimp and chicken added to the lemongrass heaven of a dish.  For my favorite meals I always order them 8/10 on the spice level because I love spicy. For noodle lovers, I recommend the Pad Kee Mow with Shrimp. It's garlicky and prepped with fresh multicolored bell peppers. When I'm in a beefy mood I get the Chili Mint Beef. It is very robust and comes with fresh rice. Their Penang Curry with chicken is so delicate and delicious for those who love a great curry.  There just isn't a dish that I've not liked.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad kee now with shrimp is my favorite noodle dish
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable delight
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom Ka combination seafood soup is delicious

hFFPOhmAC7N_CEMnSJJzvw.text: Authentic food and excellent friendly service!! The vegetarian pad kee mao was delicious and the Thai-hot spicy level was perfect! I can't wait to try their other vegetarian dishes, I'm happy I found this place. I will definitely be back again.

_zU7y79f3pZZhFqKgSZ5Jg.text: The worst costumer service ever. The host and the waitress are unfriendly, bad food and old too. I don't recomend this place

hXK49JXoU6SBUkghwH2uSQ.text: Komol is so underrated! My friend recently introduced me to it and I'm obsessed. They have so many great vegan options and the portions are very filling. I enjoyed myself and the staff is very friendly.

-9864TJU8aBG3powmJwC9w.text: Amazing options for vegans and the price is right! Highly recommend! This place has to be one of Las Vegas best kept secrets or maybe not because they have an in tire wall of awards! It's quick, fresh and friendly!

jbIEC8YoAfxtc25jv2y1Cg.text: My new favorite Thai place. The spring rolls were sublimely decadent. The satay was terrific. The Panang curry brought tears to my eyes. The bill was low. Service was excellent. Loved it. Going back soon.

2tzH4R3SkOJtShukT2f8-g.text: My favorite Thai place in Vegas. Everytime I am in town I have to stop by before my flight back. The seasonings and athmosphere remind me of Bangkok but in the outskirts of the Vegas strip. If you are looking for a great hidden gem without breaking your bank than this is a must place! Enjoy!

t6yzy0t63akl8wJOFi0V0w.text: Came to the area hoping to check out the lotus of Siam but with an hour wait on a Sunday night i went looking for another way to get my Thai fix. Told the waiter I was from out of town and told him I was in the mood for noodles and a salad. He recommended me the duck noodle and and nam cha a minced pork salad with crunchy rice inside. Grabbed Thai iced team and sat back. The highlight was definitely the duck noodles, it came with Bean sprouts onions and a rack of spicy seasonings. The rich dark broth was amazing, it tasted of stewed bones and soy, and with the chilies and pieces of stewed fatty duck, it was a complex combination of savory, fatty, spicy and sour. After having the duck Noodles the salad wasn't able to beat it. It was minced pork and crunchy rice with some lettuce.   Overall i would definitely be back for that noodle. Service was great, attentive and friendly. Was glad to experience a bit of local Thai in my brief stop over to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck noddles- according to the waiter they stew it, a dish local Thais come back for
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Was hoping to try Siam but there was an hour wait for one on a Sunday night

RmB9HsEjdjkdW5lGmvhNhA.text: Wide vegetarian menu, which is very rare to find in any restaurant in the US. Love the ambiance and service. I think it's going to be my go to Thai good place in Vegas.

7dyQD0-Sn6zJvyCOvzFpKw.text: Tom Ka shrimp was creamy and tasty. Fresh rolls were tasty but wrapping was dry. Penang Duck curry was outstanding. Deep fried duck was stir fried and no longer crispy, which was disappointing. Taro ball desert was inconsistent with some balls soft and warm, others cold and cheery. Service was great. Overall,recommended but almost dropping to three stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not so crispy duck
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penang Duck Curry
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom ka soup and fresh rolls

_la5-HeiUuSWA5KfQBw7wQ.text: Location might be a little weird (behind a nightclub) but don't let that scare you away. Everything I've had here is excellent and the Panang curry is probably the best I've ever had.  Tom kha gai and spring rolls also very solid. Thai basil flavor really comes through in the spring rolls. Service is great. Price is reasonable.

HR23ULicvZpT1A0Z2sL0nA.text: A hidden gem Thai Restaurant. This restaurant has been in this location for over 30 years. A must try Authentic Thai food .  Try to go early as this place can get packed around 6pmish. I ordered for appetizer, fresh spring rolls.  Main course, Chicken Pad-Thai and house special Angel Duck which was tender and sauteed with black mushrooms, baby corn and snow peas.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xs9u6rXwCeAMwY6liAAGsw.text: Excellent service and food. Reasonable. Had the basil mint chicken. One of the best in town. This place is always great.

Ymo2_YnHHT1BhYR_88XrkQ.text: The Heavens, they have heard my prayers and answered accordingly! I don't think I've EVER had such delicious Sesame Chicken in my life.. Nay, I take that back, that was NOT even in the same category! The Sesame chicken I'm used to would give its left nut to taste like Komol's!  I look at it now, sitting so delicately atop that blue, mikey-mouse-shaped plate. "How are you, my love?" I ask, knowing its answer is OBVIOUSLY "AMAZING". I dig in, and let me just say, the melt-in-your-mouth deliciousness that partook between that meal and I was almost too Hot for TV! The moaning itself was enough to take this experience from a PG-13 to a Rated-R!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sesame Chicken Lunch Special, spice level 10

u_Cl1i_lltFG6cgp-QXpzw.text: Great Malaysian/Thai food.  Just about everything is goof on the menu. I prefer here over Lotus of Siam... I think Lotus is overrated....  KOMOL!!!!!!

FAt_hjZx2HsaS4WW76ojSA.text: I'm vegetarian and I've never had such good salad rolls before. Their Salad roll was amazing, the sweet and sour sauce for the roll was just perfect with their peanut sauce. The Pad Thai noodles were mouthwatering along with their Thai milk tea. I would recommend this restaurant for any vegetarian or vegan. Would come back again!

_2oUo1xxydzYfpUT66zA7g.text: It is closed due to unsanitary conditions and pests. Should mark this location as closed! Wasted time driving here to figure that out. :(

TDtY1HB8bP1l34n0sJEv4A.text: The food is good but the staff is rude and they don't know how to communicate. They barely speak English and they make you wait a long time to be seated if they don't like you. They don't like white people and they discriminate big time. They all need a lesson in how to serve customers. Never going to come back.

bJ6boVDz_tNdQbpPZp59qw.text: Love the food. Great quality and taste. The service is a bit slow but very friendly staff, and helpful.

VQCFEajKQBARzZifPpVatg.text: Hidden gem in commercial center! Great lunch special and the prices were great! Panang curry was yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panang Curry

OhlT76GaOlYQNrwRvuXpwA.text: By looking at the outside, you wouldn't know this "diamond" was tucked inside this old shopping mall. once inside, the space is small and close together, with tables of large groups making it hard for the wait staff to get around, but no worries, the service is excellent as is the food.  We started with a couple of apps, first up were the fried chicken wings, crispy not greasy, with a tasty dipping sauce.  Then came the grilled meatballs.  They were a bit chewy, but had a spiciness to them I liked.  For our main entrees we got several, Chicken chili mint, which had minced garlic, chill peppers and fresh mint leaves.  This was excellent!  Next we tried the Pad Thai noodle with shrimp, the rice noodle stir fired with egg, bean sprouts, green onions and ground peanuts always one of my favorites.  We also love a good curry and this time we tried the Beef Panang.  We finished off the meal with a  little desert, something that was new for them to serve tonight, Taro ball in coconut cream.  Um good!  Nothing would prevent me from coming back again, this place is excellent all around.  It can be a bit busy, so if you come there maybe a wait, but it's worth it.

ps-FWnPtMD092xD37nOl5g.text: Amazing food. I usually never write reviews on Yelp, but this place is making me write one. we were a party of 8 people and all of us love spicy food (we are from India!!!) We orders a prawn appetizer, shrimp fried rice and fried fish entree and made sure we mentioned to make them very very very spicy - 10/10 spice.   The waiter was surprised and warned us about the spice, but we were sure we could eat it. The food came and it was wonderful and perfectly spicy. Their desserts fried banana with coconut icecream and fried ice cream are a must try.  The Best THAI food I have eaten in the United States... Keep up Komol !!!

4YLPjFueAfRCbXzIwplzFQ.text: I really like this place. It's a bit old and outdated but the food is great, and the service. It's easy to get in and out from Sahara or Karen. One of my favorite lunch places in town!

XeFieG5bx9ZIW-yo1iRJMg.text: I am so sorry for the low rating , but my experience just fell short. Maybe it's because I was there before most of the workers, stalking the parking lot with great anticipation. I knew this was going to be an EPIC lunch! It was an EPIC fail.... My feelings were hurt :( I wanted the panang in the reviews. I wanted the pad thai gasm! I waited about 40 mins after placing the order for two lunch specials and that was fine.. Given I was extra early! But when I made it home, that's when the devastation hit! I wasn't given a delisicious velvety panang it was a grease bowl.  Man, it was just really greasy and seperated. No spice no flair. The pad thai had no flavor in fact it didn't even have one lick of flavor. Flavorlessnesss....hmmmmm... Oh that's it! The sever never asked me a spice level!!!! My earliness must have frazzled him!   On a high note the peanut butter dressing on the salad was very good as was the soup!! That let's me know this place has great potential!   Moral of the dramatic story! Give people a chance to warm up before going! I don't think I'd given them a ompletely fair shot, so I will return one day to try again.

wFm-GSVBtbJipzOBi8Q1jg.text: Food quality and taste is just ok. Service is just ok. Portion size is good. They use tomato sauce in their Thai fried rice as opposed to most other Thai restaurants I've been to that use actual tomatoes. The garlic fried rice was bland and I guess they ignored me when I asked for medium spice on it. They're a little overpriced compared to Thai Pepper which is a few blocks away and taste isn't even close to Lotus of Siam which is on the same shopping center. They do have an extensive vegetarian menu however, if that's something you're looking for.

h0MZ6fctDXeMrr2QT6INyQ.text: The food was good - good quality meat, tasteful spices, but it wasn't earth shattering. I came here with high hope since I've been hearing how good Thai food is in Vegas, but Komol is like a better version of my local Thai places. I thought I would see more authentic dishes but didn't. Service was really good and beer was cheap.

wHZksvXJmbRL9CV22BsBrQ.text: I was craving mee krob so bad. I found Komol from yelp since it was one of the highest Thai restaurants in Vegas. The menu is a heavy wooden menu. They have a very extensive vegetarian menu..way more than regular menu. Ordered fresh spring rolls, beef panang, chicken chili mint and thai tea ice cream. At first I ordered mee krob but they were out *crying* Fresh spring rolls ($4.50): it's just ok. It tastes and looks like meatless vietnamese spring rolls with Thai sweet sauce. Super minty and it freshen your breath in seconds. 2 stars!! Beef panang ($9.95): My level 6 spicy has a nice kick. But that's the only good thing. It is just spicy..the sauce is super thick but I can only taste the chili. What happen to the curry taste? I usually eat my curry sauce with rice but not this time. 3 stars and I am being generous. Chicken chili mint ($9.95): better than panang but it's overly salty. At least this dish is tasty and good. Too bad they also chopped the cartilage =( Adding fried egg on top will make this dish better. 3.5 stars Thai tea ice cream ($3.00): Did someone eat my ice cream already??? The ice cream is so small compared to the picture. That is so misleading. It looks like someone uses a super tiny spoon to dig it out. Small scoops of ice cream. The flavor is actually not bad. The flavor is actually there. 3.5 stars yelp.com/biz_photos/iA8V... The service is friendly and attentive. I guess I am spoiled with Thai food in Los Angeles..especially Hollywood. This place is popular though because it's packed!!!! 3 stars!! Maybe the vegetarian dishes are better. Komol restaurant is almost yummylicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea ice cream
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Komol plate

UJjJKLxQeuMjtJ1zkasOcg.text: Hands down one of the best Thai places in Vegas. Everything here is genuine and delicious. The food here is almost on par with Lotus of Siam without having to place reservations a month in advance. The herbal salad is refreshing and a must order. The menu is huge and there's a wide variety of vegetarian options for those who don't eat meat. You can't go wrong with chicken panang curry it's ALWAYS good. I'd eat here everyday if I could!

MmHtB86ks8be-vS4cmAiLw.text: Best Thai food I've had in awhile! Venture off just the strip a bit for this hidden gem. Flavors were consistent and amazing. Service was pretty good overall, they did forget a couple of our dishes however. When we realized we asked for the bill and to take off the forgotten food. Realizing their mistake they still made the food and packaged it to go for us free of charge. I for sure would return for their amazing service alone. Mistakes happen, so much more credible when they own up to them.

SZBcHpMRCFr5rgYtNjhIuA.text: Honestly I would expect more out of such a highly rated restaurant AND a Zagat restaurant as well. I think the night we came was jinxed or something because my experience here for a friend's birthday was not terribly good.
