qvfpa8mKT-GHjutvkyJ0AQ.text: One of the best places to enjoy real good Thai food.  This is one of the hidden jewels of Las Vegas. Ordered Tom Yum soup, herbal salad, pad keep Mao and panang Curry were great. All the varieties are available with chicken and other meat too. Will highly recommend it. Just make sure you order everything below 4 on spice level to enjoy the flavors anything more you definitely should like HOT food.

0SXTtgP7_MrJjj0xL8q3Jg.text: Huge menu for meat eaters and vegetarians. Found the food a little salty. Not a great place for wheelchair or scooter. They have booths or tables with armless chairs. The tables are very close together.

jS0Gig-kqe3jzFwaAH2XtQ.text: We went here for the first time for lunch and it was delicious!!! There are a ton of options for carnivores and vegetarians alike. The waitresses helped me pick a vegetarian option and it was very good and came out exactly how I ordered it. My husband is a meat eater and he had a really great meal as well. It is a little hard to find, but it is in a strip mall with a bunch of other restaurants. Overall I would definitely recommend grabbing lunch or dinner here!!!!

KiePwAraeye1t1cdkAQtMg.text: This place is amazing! Best Tom kha soup ever and they actually make it spicy! Great vegan options, great  Thai food and super nice people. Service can be a little slow but it's totally worth it.

b1GcZ5hHGO1F2xXpSZUGmw.text: Loved the variety of vegetarian dishes !  Great service  Delicious & Healthy vegetable Rolls

Xj6mxa3eEMrybwuj9BgvsQ.text: I was looking for no msg restaurant and found this through Yelp. The servers were sooooo nice. I think I was lil tired after work trip so when he brought me replacement cabbage for free I almost cried. I got lost twice and he guided me patiently. I order seaweed soup and salad they were amazing.  I will come back here again it is like my favorite place in Vegas, thank you.

q226UV7J23-XC8N6ONNR9A.text: Wonderful place for vegetarians, huge amount of options. And pocket friendly.. Very tasty Thai food. Wonderful staff and perfect ambience.

mDxPxlHjVQgp_HhzROp9RA.text: A very strong 4 stars!  I met some Yelpers here for dinner.  We took Nelson Q's advice on going with the Herbal Salad to start.  This was crisp, fresh and different (the good/refreshing different, not the searching for a modifier different.)  We were fans of the Salad, the lemongrass, fresh herbs and fried tofu.   Spice level was 5/10 and played nice with the acidity of the salad.  My point?...you should order this salad.  We also ordered Pork Pad Kee Mao and Veggie Panang Curry--wish I had read Cathy C's review that you can ask for items a little hotter here than you might at other Thai Restaurants.  The curry was a little thicker than usual...nice texture, felt a little love put into it...anytime you feel a little of the love that goes in to something that's good right?...yeah, it is!  The Pad Kee Mao was a little less flavorful than the other items, but this was the only dish we ordered mild...don't be like us...get them all at or near your maximum heat level!...added some chili flake and pepper sauce afterwards and was much better--not just heat wise, but for another level of flavor.  They do a great job here with their Pad Thai as well.  The restaurant itself is rather nice inside.  You can easily forget that you are in commercial center.  We also appreciated the signs on restrooms.  A heart of the lades chest (assuming because women love with their hearts) and a heart over the males gentiles (assuming because men love with their...,) nice and direct?...I liked it.  I have long since stopped trying to find the best Thai in Vegas.  There is a different favorite for each Thai dish that I typically get.  I would definitely come here before I would go to any hyper popular Thai spot in the same center!  Additionally though Komol has earned a spot with me for their Herbal Salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JEPFCatGR9xKJ9E7I9JJQQ.text: We read about the best Thai restaurant in Vegas and wanted to try it out. Once there, we were told 45min to 1 hr wait. We put our name down and decided to walk the complex. It's a real hole in the wall complex with plenty of restaurants and locals coming to eat. We passed in front of Komol and after looking it up on yelp, we decided to eat there instead.  We asked waiter for recommendations and he suggested the tom ka and basil chicken.  What an experience this was. So far, no other Thai we've tried after compares. Loved it!

4JU-J2fqM7ui5yENq_0QUQ.text: The pad kee mao with shrimp & garlic tofu were amazing! Called in a to-go order & I'll be back again soon for sure.

fSOVNjwJn_Ied3HFVtBQ6g.text: Food: 3 stars (because of the bland entrees we ordered) Service: 5 stars  Made reservations for 10 and the employees were really nice, since we kept changing our times between 7pm to 8pm. The outside does not look appealing, but once you walk in, you feel like you entered another world. Nice decor, nice bathrooms, and nice heavy wooden menu!  Some of the items we ordered:  -Cucumber salad (4 stars): always love the pickled cucumber taste, although it was a little bland.  -Fresh spring rolls (2 stars): was too plain, it needed something else, maybe it was too much lettuce inside and we couldn't taste anything else. Adding the sweet sauce that came on the side made a big difference!  -Egg Fried Rice was pretty good.  -Vegetable Delight (3 stars): was good, nice assortment of vegetables, but it was pretty bland. The sauce and flavor wasn't all there, it needed more. The tofu was cooked well. I said mild, but it doesn't mean to not add flavor!  -Kung Pao Tofu: (1 star) there was absolutely no flavor to this dish. My sister sent it back and got the Mangolian Tofu which had more taste than the Kung Pao but it still wasn't that great.  -Vegetable Pad See-ew (4 stars): the flavor and the noodles were pretty good.  -Yellow Indian Curry (5 stars!): this was probably the best dish and only dish that was amazingly delicious! We got this medium spiced and it was still pretty mild.  GREAT Customer service! (5 stars!) Our waitress was very accommodating and helped us with suggestions and concerns we had with the entrees/options. Just wish their food wasn't as bland, maybe we ordered the wrong thing? Or do we  have to say Medium to Hot for spice to get any flavor to our dishes??

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber salad
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian tofu
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg fried rice

55rB7bQhCT84FxniNFeh0A.text: My boyfriend and I brake for Thai food so much that I honestly think we have gallivanted across almost every local Thai eatery in the Vegas valley, ranging from the dingy hole-in-the-walls to the more refined and established. I'm surprised we don't smell like curry all the time...  Anyway, this place was on my list for awhile. I held high expectations, but was rather disappointed in both the service and the food. We got seated for a late dinner, and our drink order wasn't taken until way later. My BF asked what the difference between the red and green Thai sodas was, but our waitress seemed hurried and couldn't articulate. She just kept saying one was green and one was red. We knew that. Perhaps it was just a language barrier, but we had to remind her about our drinks since they never came.  We had ordered two yellow curries, both with chicken. She appeared with two curries that seemed darker than yellow curries. Huh, we thought. Maybe they had a different way of preparing it. We dug in and it contained chicken, but it tasted awful...It turns out their yellow curry is an Indian yellow curry. She never did once check up on us, and we had to flag her down for the check. Maybe it was just a rough night, but we'll be passing on Komol. There are two better Thai places worth your money in the same plaza.

rRb3GBB_zWpkSJzKV86Wgg.text: I'm giving them two stars because the food is really good. Ive been about 3 or 4 times during lunch. The problem I have is that flies are always joing me for lunch. Its kind of hard to drink your water ,eat, and keep the flies out your food. Good food with bugs Every where.

jjlqWiDS-nZu7J_QWA3qHQ.text: This is the best. Great options for vegans, vegetarians. There are other options also... food is always good and I have never been disappointed. I have brought many people here and everyone has enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Prices are perfect also.

ScrLh1MU62yHsPuZyLDomQ.text: Great food , decent service, reasonable prices. The fish cakes were quite tasty. Don't let the outside appearance fool  you, this is a great place for lunch or dinner, a very extensive menu everything you could look for.

XfPhg-0ZHhV9Dw34d0iwLQ.text: I really like the food here. It is Vegan friendly and had a lot of choices. We had Thom Kha soup, Vegetable Pad Thai noodles, Sweet and Sour Veggie Chicken with pineapple, peppers and onions and a side of white rice. I loved that they didn't put a lot of peppers like some restaurants will give you peppers with chicken not chicken with peppers. The noodles were perfect in texture and seasonings. The ice tea was also very good. I wanted to try one of their Vegan desserts, but we were just too full. Will definitely be back. 4 stars instead of 5 for server friendliness.

EVO2568j15XLs43RkXwH_w.text: GREAT place!!!  Me and my daughter wish we found this hidden Vegas gem a long time ago!  Exceptional entrees made fresh to order,delicious desserts and a HUGE Vegan/Vegetarian menu page!!  They have also won many awards over many years and we can see why!!  Cute menu design...large wooden cover.  Just a cute place we will definitely keep returning to

9tzAHlpHb3r2S_Vlnxl0mQ.text: Komol was A-OK. Definitely not my favorite Thai place.  It was 4:30pm and there were 3 different Thai places in this commercial center. I had my niece so decided against Arawan as it looked a bit fancy. Lotus of Siam wasn't open yet. All of them were highly rated so I thought I was in for a treat going with Komol.  The service here was really good. There was always someone around and they were very pleasant.   They have a huge menu and the prices are average. They have a large vegetarian section.   The food was okay in my opinion. Maybe it was an off day? All of the food, I ordered medium, had zero spice. My niece doesn't eat spicy and she didn't notice any spice.  Combination Tom Yum Soup: chicken, shrimp, squid, and mushrooms in a sour, sweet, and spicy broth. This really lacked spice. It wasn't bad but it wasn't special. They were generous with the protein.  Shrimp Lad Na: flat noodles cooked in a wok with American broccoli in a bean curd gravy. This was good. There was a good char from the wok and it was full of shrimp. The broccoli was a little soft. I like a bite to my veggies.  Pineapple fried rice: chicken, shrimp, cashews, and pineapple. The portion was large but this was my least favorite. It tasted like the flavor base was ketchup? It just wasn't good to me.   Panang chicken curry: this was good. It was served with a bowl of white rice. The flavor was good but definitely lacking a punch of spice.  I was pretty disappointed with our meal. With a Thai tea it was about $60 without tip. When I want Thai food I want a flavor explosion in my mouth. I want dishes that have balance of savory, sweet, sour, and SPICE. Spice in two ways: Heat and full of spices. It wasn't there for me at Komol. Yelp usually never steers me wrong, but I was really disappointed. I may go back to have one of their vegetarian dinners but not any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tom yum soup. Kind of bland.
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty small lad nar. It isn&#39;t served with Chinese broccoli either which is weird. Flavor was good.
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fried rice. Onions should have been cooked more. I&#39;d pass on this. Too sweet and one note.

fjvA3K3tlQ4UAF1TEGY0SQ.text: Awesome Thai food.  A hidden gem!   Lots of vegetarian options. Spice levels can be insane, so order carefully. I mean that in a good way, I loved my hot Pad Kee-Maw.

fTO8SVNsWBXr5XJRy7JqIw.text: Sorry yelp you let me down. 4 stars don't mean what it used to. The Tom yum gung soup was pretty good but the fried appetizers had really breaded shrimp, onion rings (Thai?), Pineapple fried rice was very mushy and tomato flavored, the rice that came with the veggie green curry was mushy as well. I think its the same mushy rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple fried rice
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried appetizers
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K-NPSIEhiQpnjZp_jo8qVw.text: Vegan review: First off, finding this spot was no easy feat. When you drive into the seemingly abandoned plaza, it looks.... Abandoned. Look for a store front in the middle of a block with a green wall. If you can't spot it, because it is quite small, on the corner of the same block, there is a large rectangular building the has blacked out windows. I think it might be some kind of club. Komol is just a few doors down. On to the review...  I came to Komol because of their vegan-izable menu. They have so many options for veg-heads like myself which was overwhelming because I'm not used to it. Due to my indecision, I went with what the waiter suggested which was the Panang curry. I also got a bowl of rice on the side which was apparently free!   Tip: ask for crushed peanuts on the side! They will give you a container of crushed peanuts which is a fantastic addition to any Thai dish.   They curry was really flavorful and I really liked it. I sprinkled crushed peanuts liberally and it was so good!  Overall, I would come again for the options but it was pricy compared to the other Thai place we went to located in the chinatown area.

aHCQVsPev0UqEsH37ejwfw.text: The best Thai food ever!!! It never disappoints, it's always consistent.   It's located in commercial center. It's close to lotus actually. Weird, right? Two competitive Thai restaurants in the same shopping center... But... Don't be fooled by the hype surrounding lotus, go to komol.   I would recommend a reservation, the wait time can be quick or you may get stuck waiting for 45 min. It's always better to be safer than sorry.  The decor is a little dated, actually very dated... But the menu is presented in a beautiful menu book, broken down perfectly.   Sooo many vegan options!!   The service is on point and there isn't a long wait to get your food. The staff is knowledgable and accommodating. Our waters never run dry there.   The food... Yum! We always get a level 7 for spice. We love heat. The curry is never watered down and the flavors never disappoint. Always consistently delicious and full of flavor. Lots and lots of veggies, they don't skimp on anything here. They give enough rice for the table And aren't nickel and diming for every little thing. Give this place a shot... It's my favorite Thai restaurant in town.

Qp3KfZfHJjZsYoOOngPzHg.text: My husband and I just tried his restaurant for lunch due to all the rave reviews and varied vegan/vegetarian options for me. I ordered vegetarian Penang curry with tofu and preferred brown rice but she said there is an extra charge. A dish of chicken satay arrived strangely and before we could say it's not ours, the server was gone. Finally she returned with our food, mixing up who got what. We told her that appetizer wasn't ours and she didn't say anything, just wished it away. What arrived as my dish was just tofu and some thin slices of green and red pepper in tons of sauce. I was expecting tons of vegetables. The white rice that came was inedible, so over cooked it was mush and I couldn't eat it with my meal. I asked for a new rice but the server said that's how they cook their rice! Yuk! My husband ordered wonton soup and chicken pad Thai. He was happy with his 2 dishes and claimed his pad Thai was the best he's ever eaten. That's why I'm giving it 2 stars. I'm very disappointed to say the least.

r_C5Q1zSOoYOByekdnokqQ.text: Another hidden gem in Las Vegas. Came here last night for dinner. We ordered the Papaya Salad which was really good and tasted super fresh with the right amount of heat. Boyfriend ordered the combination Pad Thai which comes with chicken, beef and shrimp. At first when he got the order they only put chicken. We let our server know that we asked for the Combination Pad Thai and she was more than happy to take the order back and replace it with a new dish. I ordered the Chicken Panang and it came with a side a of rice. The food was really good lots of flavor and it was very clean inside.  Its small but very clean and cute. Will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Satay
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pad Thai
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken panang

fR9CgfClUW8Drj9_6Is5SQ.text: Excellent Thai food. I'm so glad to be back working in the area so that I can easily get Komol in my belly for lunch again. Great Lunch specials!  They have a lot of vegan options that honestly even my meat eating tummy likes. Usually I get the red curry at Thai places, but Dutch recommends the Panang and it is very flavorful. I also like the Thai Beef Salad and Tom Kha soup.   A few weeks ago I brought some coworkers here and they loved it. We basically split a bunch of stuff family style, a fresh shrimp appetizer, pineapple fried rice, cashew chicken and garlic shrimp. Everything was perfect. I absolutely love this place. One of the best Thai restaurants in town. Staff is always friendly and Dutch is the best!

kR-tVDrFBCaKOoFm_q0b6w.text: This place is Awesome! No wonder they been around for so long. The have a big vegan menu selection of some of the most authentic thai dishes you could possibly get in the middle of the desert. Staff is very friendly and make suggestions of vegan dishes to try. Just ask.

k7ZmBO-V1q2RLUA5kx02qw.text: This is the worst Thai food I have ever had! Not an exaggeration. Sadly, I went there because I saw some really great reviews for the place. Unfortunately, they lied! The food was horrible and absolutely, not Thai! I eat Thai food almost once every month and know what a pad Thai is supposed to taste like, I know what massaman and Panang curries generally taste like and thoroughly enjoy Indian curries. We ordered those 3 curries at Komol and we're shocked to find that all three of them were uncommonly sweet, like, dessert sweet! Sooo bad! The pad Thai we got was also ridiculously sweet. What's worse, is that the waitress came, inquired about the food, we told her that it was too sweet, she walked off as if she was going to do something about it and didn't come back. We picked at the food until we couldn't take it anymore, payed for it and left. In hindsight, I wish we'd tasted the food, realised it was disgusting and left without paying.  If you like your Thai food extraordinarily sweet, please come to this place. If you like your Thai food Thai, you will want to give this a miss.

zxDjnTgsox0hfIk-0UO1mA.text: First time here.  It's in one of oldest sections of Las Vegas; Commercial Center.  The place is clean inside and the servers are very polite.  The food was very tasty.  It has Thai food as well as Chinese food.   I came here with a party of 7.  Several of us ordered appetizers. I had the spring rolls and the were very fresh.  My other friend had fried Wontons.  They were very good.  I ordered the Orange Chicken.  It's was too sweet for me but tasted good.  I probably should have went with the Lemon Chicken. My friend had that and did not complain.  My other friends had Thai dishes and they also like their food.   I would definitely come back again.

tyZHLxOV3XZs5sxCZ22Y2Q.text: The vegetarian options are crazy high and the food is really tasty. Like their lunch menu as well!

OQXV5GeQIikvNXvGps85Xw.text: We found this place on Yelp of course and I must say it is amazing.  For starters, if you are Vegetarian, they have the most extensive menu I have seen to date, about 4 pages from Appetizers to main dishes.  They also have chicken, beef, pork, seafood as well as gluten free.  We started with the spring rolls which tasted better then any other place we have tried them.  We also had the chili mint dish, brown fried rice with veggies, and Barramundi which had an amazing sauce.  All were dishes were excellent and the price was very reasonable.  The staff are very friendly, willing to answer questions and can modify any dish.    Everything is made FRESH TO ORDER so it may take a few extra minutes for your food to come out.  They only have 3 woks in the back and since everything is made fresh don't be in a hurry, the food is definitely worth the wait.  The place looks small from outside but is actually much larger on the inside.  If you like Thai food you HAVE to try this place.

v-5Qp3ykf3l0VAvF5oN2gw.text: Commercial Center should be known as Restaurant Row for Las Vegas. Within this shopping plaza lies many hidden treasures like Komol Restaurant. I arrived in time to partake of their lunch menu. I ordered Vegetable Panang Curry which included an egg roll, steamed rice, and a salad. There were lots of brightly colored veggies in my curry and it is so delish! My only complaint is that tofu should have been added to the dish. The service is great and I'm looking forward to trying more items off the lunch menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable curry
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad and spring roll

CwI2dSDeSQIvPAaKZ7T7QQ.text: I feel bad having to drop the rating down to three stars, but I have to be honest.  My last few visits here have been all over the place. The employees here are generally nice and friendly. It's rare I encounter a rude employee. However, the food has been SO INCONSISTENT and it's really started to irritate me. When it's correct, it's delicious and I realize why I love Komol. When it's wrong, I'm upset and not wanting to come back.  The spice levels are all over the place. I don't even ask for medium anymore because it's way spicier than it has been in the past. I ask for a 3/10 spice level and apparently that is up for interpretation on what that means. During my last couple visits my meal has been so spicy that my eyes water and I start coughing. So, not enjoyable for me. It's become normal for me to have to send my food back to be made with no spice at all and then I request the spice tray to add spice myself.  I've also had to deal with some of the entrees coming out not tasting as it should and have had to send things back to be made correctly. I don't know, I like supporting locally owned places but it can't be this inconsistent all the time.

lcFfOvBLMd1b4L53IX-QvQ.text: Just amazing. We did a custom order a dish we order everywhere we go. Chicken in brown sauce with basil and green chillies. Really amazing food was great service was wonderful. When in vegas a must visit. Food was so good for lunch we decided to come back dinner. Keep up the good service and food quality guys.

MThAHecndaVNHDmNB13-Bg.text: I've been patronizing this place for a while now.  I used to love the food.  However, with every visit, the quality of food has been on a decline.  I kept going back, though, thinking it might be just that one day that they were not on their game, but it became a pattern.   A couple of months ago, I went here with my mom and brother and we ordered a few dishes.  Some highlights:  Rice was undercooked.  white rice.  undercooked.  served to us.    The salmon on the salmon curry was severely undercooked, too.  It was basically lightly seared on the outside and had about everything raw in the inside, and I wasn't in the mood for sashimi for lunch that day.   Anyway, we informed the server and he quickly gave us a new bowl of rice.  The server also took the salmon dish, since it was too raw for our taste.  When the dish was returned, "fixed," it wasn't a salmon that was on our plate.  It was actually a fish with white meat.  It didn't even taste like a salmon.  They thought that they can pull a fast one on us, since the curry was orange and encapsulated the whole fish.  smh.  We informed the server of this, and he quickly came to defend the dish, stating that, "It IS salmon - it came out of a package."  Ok, well maybe the chef picked from the wrong package (intentionally, perhaps, to save money by using a cheaper fish)?  The chef knew what a salmon looked like a few minutes ago.  The server then agreed that it was a bit on the non-pink side and just deducted that dish from our bill.    If this experience isn't worthy of the 1 star, I don't know what is.

8s3PAvkfo_0-HbcRvod1vg.text: Honestly speaking, Komol being just around the corner from The Green Door kinda turned us off - Hey, if your thing is the Green Door - more power to you - but the thought of The Green Door and chowing down just don't seem to go hand in hand to me.....  Anyways, on to the food-  Yum, Yum, Yum - the Chicken Red Curry with Zucchini, bamboo shoots and basil was so darn yummy - awesome creaminess and oh so flavorable - now I understand the love for Komol Curry from everyone - Damn, just looking at my picture makes me want somemore.....  *** Just wish they used white meat chicken - FYI - I'd pay a little extra ***  The Orange Beef was yummy too in the beginning of our meal however, towards the end of our meal the beef pieces just started to taste like candy and some beef pieces had too much flour on it - other than that the taste is good but the coating of the flour needs to be done more evenly cause some pieces had too much and other pieces were just right....  The 2 dishes that didn't blow us away flavor wise was theveggie  eggrolls- ugh, the eggrolls tasted pretty standard and the Pad Kee Mao with shrimp which is flat rice noodles,basil leaves,garlic and hot peppers- I think the cook forgot the hot peppers cause now that I remember and after looking at my pics I saw no hot peppers but this dish needs to upgrade on the flavor...  Looking from the outside we were kind of hesitant to go in but once you walk in and sit down you start to notice how nice and semi elegant it can be. Semi-Elegent meaning a nice place for a date or a family dinner- The Physical Menu is hellah cool - it's made of heavy wood with a carving in the front.  I do plan on coming back again for the yummy ass red curry - DAMN!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Komol Logo on the Plate your eating off of....
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Egg Rolls
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Egg Rolls

FSz4rpeab-1BkORdRiNdig.text: This place has to be the he best Thai I've had in Las Vegas. Been to quite a few main ones and hole in the walls. The curry's and fried noodle dishes are always great. The appetizer sampler has a good mix of different tastes as well. Don't forget to wash it all down with some Changs.

XlrilbbCfjFU0P6suqNOnA.text: What can I say. It's the best Thai restaurant in Vegas with an extensive vegetarian menu and fantastic prices. They even have dinner specials. I recommend the panang tofu for a great culinary excursion to the Far East.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panang tofu! So good!

DFkSvljsByILMdocrlWnpg.text: This is officially my new go-to Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. What brought us here was a magazine list of spicy restaurants in the U.S. and this one happened to be in the city we were in. Now me and my boyfriend love spicy food. So we call up one of my friends and are there not even a few hours later. The place wasn't too busy for a weekend, and we got seated right away. The menu had a huge selection. The three of us decided to share the Tom Kha, Herbal Salad, Pad Kee Mao, and Chili Mint Beef.  Tom Kha - I don't think I have ever had a tastier soup. It's a perfect combination of spice and coconut milk.  Herbal Salad - Crispy, refreshing, and citrusy. Like this salad and the soup alone earn 5 stars. Pad Kee Mao - Flat noodle dish, tasty. Chili Mint Beef - I was a little too overwhelmed by the chili to taste any mint. But I don't blame Komol since my boyfriend ordered it a level 10 spiciness.  I really love that this place does turn the heat up though. At a lot of Thai places, 5 is just barely spicy and 10 is like eh. Here, 5 is regular spicy and at 10, you're on fire. Hoping to be back in Vegas soon to stop by here!

qR43d2im1QJc8SMzPuh_nw.text: Good food (chicken salad) was really good the service kinda suck I waited over an hour for my food on a pick up order .. they seem a little bit nonchalant with the service

iKVabwWPkcaQwLFPsx_VSw.text: WHO: The hungry people craving delicious Thai food!! They are Vegetarian friendly as well, so don't be SKURRED!!  WHEN: Monday through Saturday, 11am-10pm; Sunday, 12pm-10pm  WHERE: It is located in the Korean plaza on Sahara & Commercial.  WHAT: I have been to this restaurant about 3 plus times and they never fail to make me a happy customer. Happy customers = favorites = telling other fellow yelpers = Komol has more favorites to serve! Lol.  Whenever I come in, I am always delightfully greeted at the door, and then shown to my seat. One of my favorite things is the WOODEN MENUS. Too cute!... Inside these wooden menus, are delicious foods you may choose from: (the ones I've tried are as follows). 1. Herbal Salad: my favorite salad in the entire GALAXY! This salad is definitely out of this world. I do not know what they do to it, but they are definitely DOING IT RIGHT!! This is a must have as soon as you are seated! 2. Panang Curry: This dish is one of my favorites at every singly Thai restaurant, but their panang curry has got me hooked! I don't know how else to explain it, but it's just the blending of the spices, plus chicken or tofu = mm mm GREAT! 3. Green Curry: As you can tell, I am a sucker for Thai curry! It is just absolutely TASTY! This also will have you asking for a second order!  I am definitely going back for more as soon as possible. Get your car keys, hop in that car of yours, and head to Komol now! (Herbal Salad is a must! ;) ) HURRYYYY!!

u4UC_VFgYc2Nda0J_jJKmQ.text: In addition to seating us despite reservations and the amazing food with very good portions. The service was on point. Felt like my water was bottomless every time I took a sip someone came over to fill it back up. Despite that, everything else from taking order to when the food got on table was really fast.   Great place to eat if you ever get a chance.

VwoG6Zl92s4zm8TWkOi2gA.text: This place SUCKs !!!  Waited 2 hours for the food Then get hit with a 18% service charge  FOOD taste NASTY

QEPC3IJXFTwY4Bq1hiIcYw.text: KOMOL is a hidden gem, it is tucked in the backside of the commercial ctr area.  I know what you're thinking, I thought the same thing..."um, commercial ctr, the same area as the green door?' i know, i know but you have to try KOMOL out  nice, clean restaurant, not a big place, wait staff super nice. as for the food....AWESOME, piping hot when it comes to your table, not only is the smell delicious but visually its delicious.    we ordered: (FYI - KOMOL does not used the 1-10 heating scale. when you ask for HOT/SPICY be careful, you get what you ask for, order a chai tea just in case)  Chicken Tom-Yum: (heat lvl med-high) if you are a mushroom kind of person, you will love this soup.  a lite chicken base soup, w/ chilies, lemon grass, lime leaves and lots of SHIITAKE mushrooms.  (they are very generous w/ the shiitake mushroom).  very flavorful, the vegetables are not mushy and lack of color.  very vibrant, refreshing soup.  Herbal Salad: OMG, i like this salad ALOT, it may be new "go-to" item on the menu. julian sliced apples, carrots, coconut, grn onions, onions w/ a lemon vinaigrette mixed w/ cashews and top w/ "hot" pepper. this salad BURSTS in your mouth. you can taste element of this salad. the apples are grn i believe, they remind me of granny smith apples.  you have a combination of sweet, salty, savory, nutty and crunchy.  the coconut adds another level to the salad. this is no cucumber salad here.  Chicken Pad Thai: (heat lvl HIGH) how can you go to a thai restaurant and not order pad thai, HELLOOOO.  my, my, my, i've tried many pad thai's around the valley, this goes in my TOP 3.  now we asked for a lvl 10, the waiter informed us that they do not do the # thing. but he's get it to that lvl for us. HA! you like SPICY/HOT then order high, heaping portion. the colors are amazing, your pad thai does not look like it was all mashed together and cooked in 1 pot, drizzled w/ oil, YUCK. (i've had pad thai like that) just like w/ the other dishes, crispy crunchy vegetables, nice chunky pieces of chicken.  the pepper flakes in this dish does not make the HEAT, i don't know if the oil used to cook this dish is infused w/ peppers, u get heat w/ every bite.  ALL in ALL a great meal, reasonably price, good to share w/ friends

AtnWdvkjP33fpPshREDHdg.text: Went back to Komol again and tried some other dishes that I didn't get to try before.  It is probably my favorite Thai restaurant~  Everything tastes so good here and I will definitely keep coming back here for more!  I haven't got to check the menu yet since I always come here with a whole bunch of people that orders for us... If they have pork leg over rice, I will definitely try it there!

hs7XHBNLEJnxY-vyK6bInQ.text: This place for being highly rated doesn't quite add up due to the service that my self and my party experienced.   I think the high ratings are for the FOOD and not the service. The food was good but it didn't match the taste of other places I have been to. Who doesn't give limes with pad Thai and why do I have to wait 5 mins when requested?!   The service has to be one of the worst I have ever experienced. When we got there, it was a little crowded but nothing out of ordinary. For a table of 4, once food was ordered, WE WAITED AN HOUR AND HALF for the food, and then the food came out staggered.   Our waitress, while accommodating at first, became lethargic and dismissive towards us after the ordered was placed.   The 3 star review is hampered by the service and not the food, food: 3.75, service: -4.26, it doesn't add up but definitely not far fetched either. Not a fan and probably won't return.

Ry_fXpQ7fUDKboqNYtkcug.text: We had lunch here a few days ago and it was amazing. This best kept secret was great. The lunch menu had plenty of tasteful options. The fried banana was full of flavor. We will be visiting this place again.

PIGzPDZoRMNzEuNVFOimJw.text: I expected to be impressed by this restaurant. Not so, as the most impressive item was my Singha beer served in an ice cold glass mug. The food was mediocre, including the soft shell crab.  The service and atmosphere were okay, but the quality of the food does not compare to Ocha.

VzRaft-wkolYVlAgz5ogRw.text: My first time in this restaurant and to me hands down the best thai restaurant ever! i yelped it and wanted to try it, i drove 25 minutes just to get there from where i stay and it was pretty worth it. pad thai was great. others ive tried were pretty sweet, less meat or just wet and salty... Komols pad thai was on point! id definitely go back there and bring people with me. id also recommend it to people!  I had one of their soups also.. i forgot what it was called but the owner Chai recommended it to me! I asked what was the best top seller soup and sold i went for it!

Vc97JGwyFnAqspwM6wMPTQ.text: I went here for the 1st time Friday night and really enjoyed it.  It wasn't crowded, the staff was really friendly and helpful and the food was great!  We ordered off the vegetarian menu: herbal salad, garlic eggplant, and panang curry.  I don't usually order salads at Thai restaurants but my friend ordered this and I was so glad she did! The fruits/veggies in it were crisp and it had such a refreshing taste - it tied with the panang curry for my favorite dish on the table.  The garlic eggplant was also good but the flavor in both the herbal salad and the panang curry could not be beat.  Looking forward to going back!

LJX9UoRFTmr1VLuxQOkdcg.text: This review is based on To-go food only. Not dining in. However I feel that it would be the same if I had dined in. If I ever do, I will make sure to update this review.  I am somewhat picky with my Thai food. I want it flavorful and spicy. I felt that Komol lacked a little bit of both.  I ordered the Pad Kee Mao noodles and the Garlic and pepper chicken. Both level 8 in heat. I really liked the flavor of the noodles, but the spice was not there. I would consider this a level 2 - 3 at other places. That is my biggest pet peeve when dining Thai. You are suppose to have the spiciest of foods, level 8 should BURN!!  The chicken was ok, but more garlicky that peppery. And again, NOT SPICY ENOUGH. One of the reasons I tried this place was because on their website they brag about the spice level and that they can "heat you up".  Um, was that False advertising? Maybe I have to ask for the extra heat level?  The food had potential, but just didn't hit the spot, CLOSE, but not quite.  I would like to add that the service was exactly what I would want. Friendly people who help you pronounce the dishes correctly and answer questions when asked. Both the woman who took my order over the phone as well as the person at the counter were extremely friendly.   I wouldn't say I will never come again, but I will try to be more specific when ordering if so. Try to find that heat level they brag about.

S06eoguvYHf8PD4NhbvsQA.text: The food here was decent.  No complaints.  The lunch special was decently priced and they have lots of vegetarian options, which always gets an A+ in my book.  Still, I just wasn't really impressed.  The decor was really generic (it didn't speak "Thai" to me...), so the ambiance, I guess, was sort of like an old Vegas lounge...without the glitter and slot machines.  The service was so-so.  We waited a minute or two at the front of the store without any one attending us, then they disappeared...once we looked around the corner it was clear that they were readying our table.  I had to wait a bit, too, to have my water re-filled.  The food was appetizing and enjoyable.  My companion ordered a medium spicy, which ended up being too hot for him (but I think that was his fault, not theirs).  I liked the spicy kick.  If I was driving through Vegas again (which I will) I would consider stopping here, as it's just off of the freeway, but I would look for somewhere better, first.  Oh!  And it was hard to find, at first.  We'd eaten in the same strip mall, before, so we were a bit confused.  Here's a bit of an illustration :  | |    |*|   | | | |_      _| | |__|    |__| Sahara Ave  It's in a strip mall off of Sahara but it's not in the surrounding stores, but in a little floating  strip(*).  Hopefully this helps you :)

WNs27Arvx3K-36aT0_Dstw.text: Probably my favourite restaurant in Vegas. It's hard to find good Thai restaurants with vegan items but this place has so many. There's a whole vegan/ vegetarian section of the menu and it's a smorgasbord of deliciousness. My personal favourites are the soy duck curry (get it Thai hot if you're brave), the fresh spring rolls with soy chicken, and Thai iced tea (made with soy milk). I'm not huge on curries but the soy duck curry is amazing. And if you're not into curries what so ever there's fried rice, noodles, salads, and a whole lot more. There are plenty of items for your carnivorous friend as well, which are also pretty tasty from what I've gathered. Definitely give this place a try because you'll be coming back for more.

OCPpEEIFqWl8zYYVpUjrIw.text: This place is a hidden gem near the lotus of Siam. Absolutely great place for vegetarians! We had the green curry, chowmein and the fried rice. Everything was delicious - much much better than lotus of Siam which is overhyped in my opinion. 5 stars for this gem of a place.

mksP-VtoyDsdTyMp7BarNQ.text: Komol review-Komol is a nice "hole in the wall" that could do more to live up to its 4 star reputation. It was hard to find in that big parking lot, but once we found it we were promptly and politely greeted. Like everyone has mentioned, the menus are a work of art! We ordered the soft shell crab and it was delicious, but the portion size was smaller than my fist and for the price it just was not worth it. My curry was ok but I wouldn't order it here again. We actually came for the vegetarian menu and ordered spring rolls and pad Thai. The vegetarian spring rolls were great, just a bit too much basil and the serving size was huge! The vegetarian pad Thai was also great, filled with veggies and tofu! Overall this is a good place to eat if you have money!  Pros: 1. Vegetarian menu was delicious 2. Beautiful menu design 3. Caring wait staff  Cons: 1. Small portions for the price. 2. Food was "meh" considering the cost.

7CJEIy2EAHtfh62yARuWow.text: So, I stopped in for lunch after volunteer work in the morning.  I knew about this place because I have been in for lunch before.  However, it wasn't anything special back then.... I had only ordered Pad Thai.  Although it was tasty, I didn't find it very special so had not written a review for it.  But today, today was a different story.  :D  The entree we ordered was Chicken Chili Mint.  It was pretty good.  Ground chicken with a variety of spices that included mint and fresh red chili (hence the name).  We ordered it mild and BOY was it mild.  I would recommend medium heat. The waitress said mild is about a 4 out of 10 in the heat scale...However, it didn't taste spicy at all.  Wasn't a bad portion either.  It left enough room for two desserts.  We ordered the banana steeped in hot sweet coconut milk.  Oh how it reminded me of the Vietnamese desserts I had as a child...It made me feel like I was a kid again.  Warm, soothing, rich coconut milk drowned the chunks of firm bananas.  The texture of the bananas were spot on.  It still held it shape and was not at all mushy in texture.  This dessert packed sooo much flavor!  I recommend sipping the coconut milk little by little.  It is REALLY sweet so I feel that's the best way to eat it.  Slow...to SAVOR the wonderful flavors  :)  I ordered the coconut ice cream with sticky rice...and it was absolutely amazing!  The sticky rice was very warm and with the cold ice cream sitting on top of it, it resembled a thai version of warm brownies with ice cream.  Anyways, here's the kicker...the coconut ice cream is HOUSE-made!  Technically, it's not ice cream.  The base is simply coconut milk and fresh coconut water, so the consistency is more icey (kinda reminds me of a sorbet, but not as refined).  I happened to like that it had those larger icicles because it cut through the decadent sticky rice pretty well, very refreshing.  The coconut milk "sorbet" had thinly sliced fresh coconut and jackfruit.  I would come back just for this dessert alone.  Minus one star because upon entering the restaurant, they had a board with their specials of the day written on it which included Mango with Sticky Rice.  However, when I ordered it, they said that they weren't serving any because the mangoes they had were not sweet/ripe enough yet.  So, I would suggest not putting something on the specials board when it's not available to order.  But I can't complain too much.  The lack of ripe mangoes was the only reason why I decided to try something new and ordered the coconut ice cream with sticky rice...haha...  Chicken Chili Mint + Diet Coke + 2 Desserts = $23  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana in warm coconut milk
Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut ice cream with sticky rice

wo8UBC4kZcAb4HKaogq2gA.text: I haven't had too many instances where my experience has been completely off from what yelp suggested, but this was one such case.  My husband and I originally tried for a table at Lotus of Siam, but were told that we'd have a 120-minute wait. So we walked around that complex, yelped, and decided to get dinner at Komol. We put our names down, and there were just a couple of other names ahead of ours so we were hopeful to get seated in about 15 minutes, but nope - took an hour and 20 minutes. By the time we got our starters, it was 2 hours and just then, we got a call from Lotus of Siam. In hindsight, we should have taken off at that point. The Thai ice tea was decent, but it was all downhill from there.  We'd ordered mushroom Tom Kha, but got a Shrimp one instead. The replacement soup tasted like... well it didn't have one. The baby corn had clearly gone bad both in our Chow Mein and Red curry.  By this time, we were simple waiting for our check and get out as soon as possible, and that's exactly what we did.

YyaqPiPfkf4XMCgnWC3BDg.text: I'm glad I ended up here a second time.  There was nothing really off with my red curry with chicken but I had ordered medium heat and what I got was about a 2 compared to the Thai places I frequent in Phoenix.  The second visit I started to order the chef special curry and the waiter inquired as to my normal favorite Thai dishes and suggested I should really try the Panang curry which I had never had.  So I did.  And this time medium heat was 4.5 which is certainly close enough to 5.  Just different chefs in the same kitchen will quite often vary more than a full point.  I still think I like the thinner gravy to soak the rice in of the red curry, but I like them both.

LwoRy2SuwNcTCB3uTYZfhA.text: Lotus of Siam...Schmotus of Siam. Komol is fantastic and not nearly the wait.   Everything on their menu is delicious. No taksies backsies.   Favorite menu items: Orange tofu, ANY curry, and spring rolls.

FYHyhxibI3exZuAbCDAxhg.text: Had to go with the yelpers on this one and got the Herbal salad.  That citrus dressing, it's addictive.  Nice touch with the crispy tofu and the apples.  The pad thai doesn't have that redish, orangy color.  I googled which color pad thai is more authentic and I didn't really find an answer.  But I did find out a lot of chefs add different things to get this red color from paprika to ketchup.  Regardless though, I liked the dish.  Not too sweet or mushy as a lot of restaurants can make their pad thai.  I also go the chili mint chicken.  I asked them to slice the chicken instead of ground chicken.  I'm not too keen on this dish, it was really oily and the chicken wasn't the greatest I've had.    There is a lot of good Thai in the city and Komol is solid with some dishes you cannot go wrong with.

WIXEWlCvtZvticLxdRRgsw.text: If I could live on this food I so would. I love that you can get a dish either Vegetarian or vegan and the "meat options" there's not many vegetarian friendly places here in Vegas so it's definitely wonderful to find this little gem. The service might be a little leggy but trust me the food makes up for it and it helps that it's all very fairly priced.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

SYNRIk8tbpeRxkdG1-sZCw.text: I've been coming here for a few years now and this is still my favorite spot for Thai food. You can't go wrong with their chicken Tom Yum soup! We ordered it at the 7 spice level...the spicier the better. It had a little more mushrooms than I care for but it was still as delicious as ever.   The service tends to vary every time we come in, sometimes the service we receive is fast sometimes it's slow...the one thing that never changes is that their staff is always nice and friendly.   We tried the garlic fried rice with shrimp...WAY better than the regular shrimp fries rice. I can't believe we had never ordered it before! I can't wait to go back! ::drool::

XdWZFUjg2LYG85PM7LgQXQ.text: This place has great food and they have a big vegetarian menu for me to explore. I will definitely be back. To bad I had to pack my own food to go.

bdCQRwCZ1NX62xvEAfF1Bg.text: I love Thai food and when I read about this, I was so excited to try it! The price is great and the staff is great! The only thing I did not like was when my main dish came out, it was cold. The food itself was just OKAY. The texture of the chicken was a bit rubbery, definitely not all breast meat.  I am the biggest panang consumer in all of Las Vegas, and I immediately noticed the panang recipe here is much different than most other Thai restaurants. Not my favorite here. Yet, our Phad See Ew noodles were rather enjoyable. Vegetarian options are available. On a side note, I did like their custom engraved menu covers. Hieroglyphic style Komul engravings on real wood. Cool!

6gaKtX-3H_kQPbFKVu08gA.text: Absolutely awesome! I've been here a few times for lunch and they have delivered the goods each and every time. I tried the pad-thai the first time and haven't swayed away from it (and probably never will - like, ever). A few friends in the lunch party had different dishes, one was a vegetarian the other ordered a chicken based dish and everyone walked away from the table barely able to breath and honorary members of the "clean plate club."   They have great lunch specials and offer generous sized portions. The flavors and textures of the foods are outstanding. I absolutely recommend this place to any Thai food fanatics.   One quick, funny story is that we went there on December 30th for lunch. We were advised that the lunch specials were not available because of "the holiday." I asked which holiday and the server told us New Years. Guess it was a day early. Didn't matter, we were grubbing out regardless.

Lx4GOpzqgUBJOC5Nv8DhEA.text: This is the best Thai food restaurant ever! Very authentic with lots of flavor and they even have a lot of vegetarian dishes. The service is great and the people are amazing.

m8eRAQBDQS_aUF2EJsK42Q.text: My partner and I come to Komol at least twice a week. You won't find authentic Thai better anywhere else in Vegas. I usually order shrimp and chicken Pad Thai with the spice turned up. Soooo good.   If you've not tried the homemade coconut ice cream with sticky rice, you're missing out. Komol blows Lotus of Siam out of the water, IMO, and always a much shorter wait.   The service is pretty stellar too!

2di0TTmBn6U5_f999K3CFg.text: Yum, yum, yum!!!!  A great place for omnis and veggies to come together. The duck was apparently a little tough?  I got some tofu dish that I Asked to be really spicy AND OH BOY OH BOY. The menu is huuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuge so be prepared to wait on that awhile. Everything is clearly label and the waiter was happy to answer questions. He was awesome, friendly and super attentive. The Herbal Salad is probably one of the best dishes I've had, ever, ANYwhere. "HERBAL SALAD $9.95 - lemongrass, tofu, garlic, onions, green onions, basil leaves, cashews, apples, carrots and coconut mixed with hot pepper and lime juice." I have no idea what they do to make simple ingredients taste that amazing when put together but really, get there. It's a big plate so you can share it with someone as an app and still get entrees. Would definitely go back. Not a huge space though so I'd come at off hours or early.

photos.caption: Photo of Komol Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vS4DXQkYBM-go6u8rqHkwg.text: This place has the best Tom Kha Gai ever!!  Don't get the soup anywhere else but here.  I am unable to get it at other restaurants now because it doesn't compare.  Komol gets pretty busy...their food is fairly good and I continue to go back.  I am hoping that they do not use MSG; I get quite thirsty every time I eat their Chef's Special, a minced meat with chopped green beans dish.  Spice doesn't do that to me as much as MSG does.  Their pad kee mao is just okay.....my least favorite.  Their curries are delicious though.  Only a few of their items are off...most of their dishes are winners.  Service has always been nice....the servers stay very busy, they work hard.

HM0DeqocizjYgV6BRaNc8g.text: Komol has probably some of the best tasting Thai food I've had in vegas so far, however, the service and timing of your food is the absolute worst I've ever experienced in the 2 years of dining out every week in this town.  My last 2 experiences it literally (we timed it from time of order) took over an hour to get our food. Today it took 45 minutes from time of order before we had enough and walked out. We walked into the restaurant when the entire place was dark besides one aisle, and there was one 2-top there. Somehow a 6 top who came about 10 minutes after us got their meals shortly after they ordered. We watched both servers constantly pouring food out to their table. We finally got furious and walked out. I will never, on principle, ever dine here again. If you choose to eat here, don't come hungry, and be ready to wait an hour for your food. They need to rehire their kitchen staff.

Rui7vsQ2Q9FQkBacpCymCA.text: Had a good time here and would go back. Tons and tons of options for folks who eat meat and folks that do not. Service was a little slow but didnt feel ridiculous. Definitely recommended.   By the way, the restaurant is located at the center of the strip mall. I think we spent an extra $2 in taxi fare looking for it in the strip mall.

ihEakebI0iPryT-rychwuw.text: My fiance and I went here on our last trip to Vegas and WOW- we both left saying it was the BEST Thai we had ever had! Everything was amazing, from the coconut soup to my Pad Thai, and the portions were generous enough that I had leftovers for the following day. We really, really enjoyed our dinner at Komol and will surely come back next time we're in town.  They were pretty good with my food allergies, too. Luckily I know what questions to ask (is there soy sauce in this? is this made with milk or coconut milk?), but the waitress was helpful and made sure to write "no soy sauce" on my order just in case. My tummy and my taste buds left happy tonight, and that says a lot for someone with Celiac disease!

_LK9S5cMAZlGNL2W4BHZng.text: Some of the best Thai food we ever had. Reduce one star because of slow service and cramped tables. We ordered tom kha soup, noodles, vegetarian panang, basil chicken. All were really good. Thai iced tea had too much sugar though. Worth a try.

MmFYP7-Igg02C6X8qq3-ng.text: First time here and definitely be my last. i came here base on yelp review so i decided to give it a try im rating this base on the service food was good but quanity was little for the price, we ordered our food four simple dish we got two fried rice,green curry and chicken labb took them over 40 min just to get our food, i guess they were too busy trying to be all fancy instead of worrying bout getting the food to their customer . Plus one more thing their menu is ridiculous they have a wooden menu that takes up half of the table heavy to hold up better off with a laminated menu like most places.

OEvOzNu2291RQX7fdX0gkw.text: The staff is super friendly and food tasted so yummy. Was on a hype to try Vegetarian Dishes and this really was a great spot. Will come back!

dxTdBR6uzD7sEFIJsILOWg.text: Some of the best Thai food I have ever had!  Everything I have tried here is really yummy!  The service is also great.  I always want to stop here when i'm in Vegas!  I haven't found Thai food this good in Denver.

l6lHaPosHt18NJC4VtUkqA.text: Amazing vegan Thai food. Curries were so good. Panang curry with vegan beef to die for. Lots of different vegan meat selections from beef to chicken to seafood. Nice restaurant, great service. Easy to take the bus here from the strip if you are a tourist like me.

uwfu4yUNCOBv4uXxZBS9EA.text: this place is vegan paradise. super delicious, reasonably priced, friendly and helpful staff. ask for dutch. he'll take good care of you.  i ordered the indian yellow curry and added soy chicken.. mouthgasms ensued. my friend ordered the vegetarian massaman, which was sweet and flavorable.   we split the herbal salad and the vegetarian tod mun. both were delicious! i can't recommend this place enough! i wish they had one in santa cruz!

MZ4Aquf5-w99mhrIcZEgPA.text: I found this place on Yelp. I have to say I am a big fan of the herbal salad and vegetable pad thai. They a huge selection of vegan options and their desserts are delicious. The food is good and the prices are reasonable.

CmvTpyHG65nr4EH4ys2Phw.text: My boyfriend and I went here a couple of weeks ago. Since we're vegan, it's a little difficult to find places when we want to dine out. Komol's has large vegan menu. The food is delicious and service is amazing there. It was such an incredible experience and I can't wait until we go back!

FV1Mck1LzdWp4W-qjPhsdg.text: Food tastes just like directly from Thailand! , Not expensive & Good service :)

mdgOpbOwdlGyELBbsw0K_w.text: i wish i could put ZERO stars. i had some of THE WORST service here.  Looks can be deceiving. This place looks nice on the inside...  Made a reso for a party of 12, waited 10 minutes after arriving while they got the tables ready, which should've already been ready for us. -_- It's understandable that it took awhile for our orders to come out since we had such a large group, but it Took the servers about 10 minutes before asking for our orders. One order didn't come out until AFTER everyone else in the party had FINISHED EATING.  This is after we bugged the servers every chance we got to ask if my friend's food would be coming out soon. The rest of us felt bad about starting to eat before he had his food, but we had no choice as we were on a tight schedule and were already running late. (Good thing he's a fast eater)  Weird thing is, another person in our group ordered the exact same thing, only a slightly lower level of spiciness.     The food was okay. We had to stay vigilant on when servers would pass by in order to get their attention for more water, lemon, etc. Poor guys, but i think they should have tended to us a little more often than they actually did.    To top it off, the check came with a total of $170!!!!!!!!!!! (including 18% gratuity which was calculated from the total+tax, which is WRONG). This doesn't make sense AT ALL because 4 of the 12 in our party had their own plates, while the other 8 shared with a partner.  They obviously don't know how to do simple arithmetic here, and somehow they stapled some other bill on top of ours and added it together... (we knew those weren't what we ordered)  So we calculated our correct bill ourselves and talked to the manager about it. Our actual bill was only about $109 total.   NEVER again will i eat here.  Last note, the food didn't sit well with one of my friends. He got really sick, had a rough night, fever, and threw up quite a bit throughout the remainder of the next day until we got home to San Diego :(

mp03h4lXIlq31U6wUBam1w.text: My family's favorite, We have been regulars for over 10 years and have never been disappointed. Tofu Panang and Veg Chowmein is the best. Service is always exceptional, especially if DUTCH !! is there... Keep up the Good Work!!

7_XdOqrwoamlGiYyPg3iYA.text: Best thai-food in Las Vegas. Tom Kha with rice or Yellow Curry with Tofu are my favorites but I am not opposed to trying something different each time because I trust the food there is good. Also very vegan-friendly and although I am not vegan.. If this what vegan tastes like, I aint mad.

5B_hyGUS8weZrrEZ3iw0dg.text: I always enjoy this place. I usually have the pad thai and/or the yellow curry. im docking them one star because the food is good, but not always consistant

tMA05He0I3tPm5Jhm0jy2A.text: There is simply no better Thai food in Vegas at any price! Their green and red curries are to die for, careful on the heat level though because hot is REALLY hot and not as good to ma as medium on some items. I love their spring rolls, their plum wine and all of their noodle plates. I used to eat there more often as i worked very close but now i make sure to get by on special occasions because i know without a doubt that they won't serve me anything bad. Their lunch menu is a SUPER DEAL, while their dinner menu is a BARGAIN. I think this restaurant is over thirty years old, making it one of the oldest restaurants in Las Vegas. That says alot to me about their quality. I LOVE KOMOL!!! Yum- YUM!

vfzFmt1fWofNF8dFvBsi2Q.text: We had three vegetarian dishes. Barramundi (Australian Sea Bass) which had a nice tart sauce, Vegetarian Tod-Mun, a bit dry but with a good cucumber sauce, and Vegetarian Pad-Thai which was okay. We liked the  large variety of menu items. The service was somewhat slow but pleasant.

FGQuHpidu92T2ViILsfITw.text: This is my favorite Thai place. Their peanut sauce, mushroom tom kha soup, chili mint beef, and pad thai are the best. I ALWAYS get take-out because the place itself isn't great. The lack windows and dated interior keep me from ever wanting to eat inside. Unfortunately the quality of the food isn't always consistent. At its best it's 5 stars and at its worst 3 stars so I split the difference.

ILGWmAOzoKE2qSLBLGpHqA.text: Liked this place.  Good service and yummy chicken panang.  Extensive menu and good lunch specials averaging $7 - $8.  Would definitely go back.

qu5ZBh2vp-47RBHTUyJVJA.text: Holy cow, this place is good.  My boyfriend and I had wrote down the address as a place to go in Las Vegas, and when the GPS brought us here, we almost didn't get out of the car!  The strip mall is shady looking, but have no fear, the food is amazing!  The staff was helpful, and the service was prompt.  If I lived in Las Vegas, I think I would become a regular here.  Everything was amazing!

Oey-3O0q6_XfSI2sWmKiVA.text: We got turned away from lotus of Siam and couldn't be happier. Top 5 Thai food experiences of our lives. We ordered the family meal for $32 and feasted! We had tom ka gai--it was perfect.  Then we had a beef salad--the beef was tender and incredible. Then the chili mint chicken--diced with chili and mint. Then ice cream at the end. We were pretty psyched with the entire experience. Two great restaurants across the strip mall from each other. Who knew?

VBun8MqlBfeJ8P8Fyk5Euw.text: The first time My friend n I went to this restaurant, food was ok but service was bad n super slow cuz it took the waitress half an hour to get us water an over an hour to get food. However, I decided to give this place another try and this time service was much better n food was good. Garlic fish is a must try, basil stir fry is really good, duck curry is ok. The sticky rice with mango is pretty good also. Would go back to this place now that there is a different  waiter and waitress.

drdCrI5iTfwPAstqpTD5Nw.text: Best Thai Food I've ever had and the Staff are so friendly! At first I was a bit weary of the location, but once you walk in, you'll forget about the location because the inside is nothing like it appears on the outside! Will definitely keep going back.
